Magnifique decor   showReview(18996544, 'full');
P茅simo Hotel   showReview(18545186, 'full');
magnifico hotel   showReview(13459035, 'full');

quiet, clean, and great location We spent Christmas 2008 at the hotel and found the service to be fantastic. It's in a surprisingly great location. They have a shuttle service to Universal Studios, the metro is a very short walk ( or the same shuttle will drop you off there as well ) and it's only one stop to Hollywood Boulevard. We even received a Christmas present from hotel management. Unfortunately, Beverly Garland passed away just a few weeks earlier. We'd like to offer our condolences. We recommend this hotel if you're visiting Hollywood or Universal studios.

Handy for Universal Studios but that's all We stayed 3 nights at the Beverly Garlands Holiday Inn, it was easy to find as just off the freeway. It's really close to Universal Studios and they do lay on a shuttle bus to take you there, if you catch the time right that is as we found it sat on the car park most the time and it was quicker to walk, as this bus also drops at the metro station (or so we were told, we never actually caught it). Our room was of the bog-standard variety and did us for the 3 nights its a shame it's so far out of the way we had to catch the metro and buses everyday to do any sight seeing. But on the bright side the metro is very cheap and if your doing alot of travelling it's worth getting a day ticket. We did have breakfast one morning at the BG and the pancakes  maple syrup were great. Watch out for the guy standing outside the hotel who wants to sell you tours, he caught us the second we walked out of the hotel and before we knew it we where on a 4 hour tour of LA and $120 lighter. Rob who was our tour guide was great and there was only 2 other people on the trip so that was a bonus. There are lots of tour companies doing the same routes whether the cheaper ones are as good I just couldn't say.

Perfect find! We stayed at this Holiday Inn for five nights in the beginning of December at the start of a mini tour of the States. We stayed in this hotel to explore LA and can honestly say we were not dissapointed. I had emailed the hotel prior to our stay to advise that it was a surprise for my partner (this was his 40th birthday present!!) and when we checked in the receptionist wished Steve a happy birthday and advised that they had upgraded our room to a larger corner room with a fridge - fantastic!! We checked in to our room on the fifth floor and it was spacious and extremely clean. You can tell this isnt a brand new hotel but everything was in good working order and kept extremely clean and tidy. We had lots of storage space, a very comfy king size bed and a nice balcony overlooking the Hollywood hills and tennis courts. There was a function room below and we did experience some noise, but this finished reasonably early and I cannot say it bothered us. There are tennis courts, a gym, swimming pool and a small shop at the hotel. There is also a restaurant and bar, we only used the restaurant once for breakfast on the day we left. It was very nice but seemed very quiet in the evenings. Ironing board  Iron, TV (not flat screen), Hairdryer all in room. NO Safes. Parking was not a problem - charged $12 per night. Easily accessible to get to all the sights. Right off the interstate, so you could hear the traffic but nothing major. It was nice staying at this hotel, as you felt safe and it was in a nice residential area but close to all the attractions - would definately reccomend!
Nice Hotel tucked away in LA       Hollywood Blvd
Nicest Holiday Inn I've Stayed At My husband and I were pleased about our choice to stay at this hotel. It was clean, the room was spacious and comfortable and the staff was helpful and friendly.
Los angeles great"" plenty to see       TRIP TO SEE LOS ANGELES

Good Value Hotel  My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in Nov 08 and we found this hotel fairly average. It was clean and quiet with all the relevant amenities one would expect for a 3 star hotel. The hotel had a minibus to take their guests to Universal Studios every hour (which was v convenient and it only took only 5mins) and the Concierge was v helpful with giving directions and organising tours to downtown LA, the Chinese Theatre, Beverly Hills etc. Foodwise, the onsite restaurant is OK but a little bit pricey. For decent food head to CityWalk at the side of Universal Studios (although it's still pricey!). This hotel is not close to anything else except for Universal Studios  Warner Bros Studios. If you want to be downtown and nearer to the other attractions - don't stay here.

average rooms the welcoming of our stay was very friendly, the lady麓s at the frontdesk are doing a great job, top !the free shuttle-bus is nice also the parking place of the hotel is good. we had a good time in this hotel, we did not had breakfast, the restaurant looked very nicethe rooms are average, perhaps i expected a much newer look, reading the hotel reviews before bookingi liked it but next time a try another hotel

Great Place to Stay Found the staff most helpful nothing was a problem to them speak to the staff before you book any sight seeing trips the company they use is great.Free Bus to Universal Studios also free internet connection in all rooms. Hotel is also close to Underground where one stop takes you to the Chineas Theater and the walk of fame and many other attractionsRooms furnished to a high standard by far the best Hotel out of the four Hotels we stayed in this trip.

Lived up to expectations ! We (family of four) stayed in this property for two nights at the end of October 08.The Hotel is exactly what you would expect from an above average Holiday Inn,the Staff were friendly and efficient,the location is good and the shuttle to Universal is great,the problem with the drivers/consierge trying to sell additional trips is exaggerated in my opinion,we just politely said no thanks and there was no problem ?The restaurant attached didn't look great so we eat locally for breakfast( The Neighbourhood Cafe as recommended by TA reviewers and it was great),for Dinner we drove to Santa Monica (about 15/20 mins and there were lots of varied restaurants to choose from)All in all a very satisfactory stay !

A very nice hotel Myself and two friends stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and we would happily recommend it to anyone. The Hotel is clean the staff are very friendly and informative. Our room had two comfortable double beds and was a nice size. There is a free shuttle bus that runs from the hotel to Universal Studios/City Walk. The staff in the restaurant and the bar were friendly and efficient, and the food was lovely. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Great Location ! As a first time visitor to LA, we weren't too sure which area to stay in and had heard some horror stories about staying in Hollywood. The Beverly Garland was recommended by a friend although the travel agent said they didnt recommend it without a car (which we did not have) - the hotel was great! Good location, couple of bars/shops within a 10 minute walk and the shuttle bus to universal was excellent. The metro was only a 15 minute walk and this took us into Hollywood - I would definately stay here again any questions, please email me [---]

Nice Hotel But With A Surprise Guest Overall the hotel room was nice we enjoyed it but there's one thing that kind of freaked us out. I know there's no reported hauntings there or anything but in room 206 there was something like that going on. We were constantly hearing noises through the night coming from INSIDE OUR room. We didn't want to say anything not wanting to sound dumb, but after leaving my husband asked me if i heard anything at night and then we started comparing the things that we herd. We experienced things such as: faint knocking sounds on door and on table inside the room when no one was there or even awake, shuffling, items moving, window squeaking, and also shadows. This may sound strange, but that's what happened to us during our stay at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn. It's not a big deal or anything just thought we'd give future guests to room 206 a heads up. If you had any experiences like this at the hotel, please email your story to aricbell@yahoo.com

Affordable and well located Our room was clean and included free high speed internet. The hotel is well located with a free shuttle to Universal Studios, and short drives to Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Walk of Fame, about 1/2 hour from LAX and a quick drive to Warner Brothers Studio.The beds were comfortable, our room was quiet, although a bit small for four adults.

Great hotel for seeing all the Hollywood / LA sights We booked this hotel last minute as we wanted a pretty central hotel to see the sights of LA and Hollywood.Check in was quick and simple. Room was comfortable and clean, had everything we needed. The hotel had a smallish pool and people seemed to use it throughout the day (what a waste of potential LA sight seeing time though!!!. There was a decent cafe / restaurant type place which was good for breakfast. the hotel provided a free shuttle bus to Universal Studios which was handy too.The location was great for us as we had a car but then i don't think anyone goes to LA without their own transport do they! We found this hotel very convenient and much more reasonable than staying in other hotels in similar locations.
Relaxing Old School Hotel       View of our room from the coutyard

Brilliant....Loved It We stayed at the Beverly Garland on the second destination of our tour and it was brilliant. set just outside of universal city, the hotel takes you up to universal studios free where you can catch the metro to pretty much everywhere. You can even walk to the metro as it is only a few minutes away.the room itself was good, decent sized, great view of the hollywood hills and free wireless internet. the hotel breakfast was not so great though. overall, enjoyed the stay and would recommend to any young travellers on a budget... it doesnt get better then this.

Great stay at this fine hotel We had a great stay at Beverly Garland's Holliday inn. We are a 5 person family from Norway, and had to have 2 rooms. We got connecting rooms, which we were very happy with. We were all together, and we had lots of space at the same time. We enjoyed the comfort of two bathrooms 2 TV's as which was fine, since the oldest and the younger children had different interests. We were very happy with: The rooms, the service of the staff, the possibility to bath in the pool, and the possibility to wash our clothes in the valet laundry.We also have to mension the fabulous service we got from Sonia at the Tula's Cafe. The breakfast was always. Our daughter Karianne was became very fond of her. All in all we don't have anything negtive to say about our stay. The only thing that keeps us from top score is that we never got any resonse to the e-mails we sent to the Hotel with a few questions before we arrived. If we get a chance, we will be back. All our regards to the Hotel, and to So Sonia in the Cafe.

Good location, good value, good time! From check-in, every employee we spoke to was pleasant and courteous. We ate in the on site Tula's restaurant on our first night. Menu was typical though plentiful and good quality. Service was very efficient too. Didn't try the bar area. Ate at Tula's for two breakfasts too. Again typical menu and albeit a buffet offered, we stuck to the menu as the buffet was simple.We stayed in one of the family rooms with one king and a bunk bed for our two children. Room was large and comfortable and more than adequate. Included was a mircowave that we did not use, non-stocked (but working fridge) plus LCD TV.The on-site pool looked great, though we did not use. Open from 08.00am to 10.00pm. Towels were available and always on the beds in the morning. Seemed the pool was *not* popular as there was always free beds. So if you were looking for a relaxing day by the pool, there's no need to awake at stupid o'clock to resreve a bed!Fantastic location, about 5 minutes drive from Universal City. There's a free shuttle to and from Universal every hour. We did not take this service as we wanted to use the hire car and be in control of our own timings. This was a professionally run accommodation and everyone was pleasant and happy to help. Would I recommend, yes!

Close to Universal Studios Good clean hotel very close to Universal Studios (5 min in car) and close to freeway and HollywoodSmall pool but good to cool off inRestaurant good but not great.Overall good place to stay if you want to stay in this area of LA

Great place, great price We stayed at the Beverly Garland Hotel last July, we wanted a place that was near the Universal Studios Park, we stayed for a couple of nights and we were pleasently surprised. The ambiance was very California with nice touches, the place well mantained, pool, gardens, tennis court, etc. the room was clean and spacious, and the restaurant on site was really good . ( we had a great dinner for less money than for the greasy pizza we had at the theme park). We would stay here again with out a doubt. And they even have a free shuttle to the park, very convenient.

Think Twice Just returned from a 10 night stay at this hotel. It is in need of some cosmetic work, but the rooms are adequate. The beds are comfortable and the balconies are a nice feature. The front desk and gift shop personnel are very nice. The men who run the shuttle spend far too much time trying to sell tours. The hotel offers a shuttle to Universal and/or the metro. This sounds great, but is very limited. It does not run for about 3 hours during the day and the last shuttle pick up is 9:15pm even though the park is open until 9 and city walk is open until at least midnight. DO NOT EAT At TULA's, the hotel's only dining option. I can honestly say, I have never had food as bad as this place. After a day of flying from Mass to Calif, we went in for a quick bite. First, nothing happens quickly here. I watched 2 different parties leave after not being acknowledged. I ordered a hambuger, my son a reuben, and young son ordered a kids chicken meal. There is no way my hamburger was cooked that day!! It was old. Chicken meal was almost black, and reuben was on stale bread! You will need a car or cab to eat anywhere around this hotel, unless you eat all your meals at Citywalk.

Wonderful in its simplicity, excellent frontdesk Arrived on July 11th and spent two nights.The man at the frontdesk was very helpful and interested in our travel plans.We asked for a ground floor room and he offered us one with the least traffic noise, although the hotel was fully booked.Every question we had about Los Angeles, how to get here and there, was answered calmly and professionally .The recepion has a drawer with little pieces op paper with the FAQ of their guests; impressive, bever seen anything like it.The room was OK, not too big, not small either.A little balcony overlooking the parking, so little dragging with the suitcases.The shuttle for Universal Studios was very OK, regular timings, so no need to take a hotel close to Universal which are in the middle of nowhere except of course the theme park itself.For future visitors who don't want to spend a lot of money on breakfast: leave the hotel and turn left; just before the traffic lights, turn left again and you will see a large Ralphs supermarket.
Loved this hotel       My room

Great family rooms We were really pleased with our room, a King Kids Deluxe. It had lots of space. There was a sofa bed, king bed, bunk beds, with the bottom bunk a double size, plus a table and four chairs. Great for a family on a trip. There's also a great gym, small pool which does pool-side drinks and food service. The shuttle buss runs hourly too and from Universal and is very prompt. The only down side is that on top of the not cheap room rate, they then charge you per day for parking - it would feel so much better if they didn't try and make extra money this way. However, we would stay again just for the room size and quality.

Pleasantly surprised I booked this hotel for a one night stay using my priority club points, this was just a very quick in and out visit from our main las vegas vacation specifically to see Stevie Wonder at the Hollywood Bowl (fantastic by the way)Upon check in, the desk clerk upgraded us to a suite as I have a platinum priority club card. For a start this doesnt appear to be usual procedure for Holiday Inn despite what their website says, so I was happy with that. The room was on the 7th floor and was two rooms knocked into one, so was spacious. One side contained the bed and bathroom and the other side had a living area and another bathroom (so they could convert back into 2 rooms easily I guess).The 'rooms' were separated by a wooden lattice panel, giving the room a kind of Eastern feeling. The decor was nice, neutral tones and exposed, painted brickwork and we had a large plasma screen hanging from the wall on a swivel pole so we could turn it round and watch from either the bedroom or living space. The bed was super comfy !To be honest we didnt spend enough time at the hotel to check out any of the dining facilities or pool so I cant comment on them, but the room was great, the desk clerk was really welcoming and also gave us a bag of free stuff, water, chocolate etcWe spent our free afternoon at Universal city Walk, and theres a shuttle bus from the hotel that picks up and drops off every hour or so, so convenientWe've talked about holidaying in the Hollywood area again so would definitely look at staying here again

Not As Bad As Everyone Thinks I stayed at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn starting on July 13th-16th 2008. I took the time and read the reviews regarding the hotel and took everything in. Some people stated on the reviews that the food was horrible and that the area wasn't safe. Here is an honest review that I hope helps everyone from a frequent hotel traveler. The hotel is outdated and is in need of a few face lifts including new carpeting in the hallways. The hallways could also use a bit more lighting but it isn't scary. The room was clean and came with a coffee maker, hairdryer, tons of towels (we had 4 adults in our room) and an iroining board etc. Our room was kept clean and we never had a problem. We stayed in the Eldorado building which if sitting outside on the small balcony (large enough for two people to sit) the sound of the freeway is noticeable. BUT, once you are inside the room with the airconditioning on, you can't even hear it. Our group didn't have any problem sleeping. When we arrived we were asked about taking tours and we simply said that we were there for business so we didn't have time-we weren't asked again and I never felt pressured or pushed to attend a tour. We took advantage of the coffee shop and I experienced an okay chai latte, but not a big deal. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning which costs $11.95. I personally felt that this was a bit steep considering what was offered and felt that if it was around $7.95 that would be better-but the food was good. The eggs were egg beaters but it wasn't terrible. The area surrounding the hotel is safe. We attended an event about three blocks up and was able to walk back to the hotel at 11:00pm without an issue. The only issue that I had was that we had to pay for parking. Now, I was only charged $11.00 a day vs the $13.00 I am hearing but I still think that this is ridiculous since I was staying at their hotel and already giving them money via the hotel room. This wouldn't make me not stay there again, but I would look for a place that maybe didn't charge as much. The location is not far from Universal Studios and there is a shuttle that is offered by the hotel to get you there. The shuttle does not pick up at the airport-please keep that in mind when making plans. I hope this helps..

Good location We enjoyed out stay at the Beverly Garland.Location:The location of the Beverly Garland is good鈥搄ust off the freeway with easy access to Disney (took us about an hour but the traffic is crazy). There are a number of Hollywood/LA tours you can book right at the hotel. The bus stops at the hotel to pick you up and you really don鈥檛 have to travel far. The shuttle to Universal is great BUT when you鈥檙e returning home at night remember that a ton of other guests will be returning as well and there may not be room for you (which means you wait for the next shuttle). FYI: spend the extra $$$ and take the VIP Tour at Universal. Great value for money and if you don鈥檛 book it you will probably spend your day hating those (and yourself) with the VIP cards who go right past you in line and who get to get off their trams and explore the sets while you sit on your tram and simply drive by. While at the Beverly we spent a day at Universal, a day touring Hollywood and a day at Santa Monica Beach (not a bad drive at all considering it is LA).Rooms: No fridge but otherwise fine. Nice, simple accommodation. You probably don鈥檛 want a room on the ground floor since these rooms are actually 鈥榙ownstairs鈥?and really only have a view of the hill they鈥檙e built into. We started out on the second floor and had sewage back up in the tub (gross, but they moved us immediately, no problem) and ended up on the first floor right near the pool. Very convenient. There is laundry in one of the buildings.Pool: Small but nice. Always loads of loungers. Snack bar and towels. There鈥檚 a hot tub and sauna too but we didn鈥檛 use these.Food: I liked Tula鈥檚. The menu had loads of variety and the prices were reasonable. Concerns: My concerns are not so much about the hotel but have more to do with the fact that I booked this hotel because of its review in Frommer鈥檚. Frommer鈥檚 stated that kids under 12 eat free. That didn鈥檛 happen for us and I鈥檓 not sure why鈥揑 was just told that we didn鈥檛 have that package. Maybe Frommer鈥檚 should indicate you have to buy a special package to get this. Also, Frommer鈥檚 indicated Free Parking. That also did not happen鈥搘e paid $13 a day I believe. Minor things, I know, but these were two reasons I booked here so I was annoyed.This is a very pleasant family hotel and a good location from which to sightsee. There鈥檚 really not much around the hotel itself (very residential) but I would recommend it as a base from which to do Universal and see LA.

Disappointed by the beg bug We chose this hotel because it was close to universal studios,it was the cheapest in the area and it provided free shuttle service to universal studios. The staff was nice and friendly. No problem with the sevice at all. The food was good little pricey but okay. The rooms appeared to be clean. The first morning I got up went to my aunt's room . She and her granddaughter were still in bed. I noticed a red stain on the sheet of the bed the 9 year old was sleeping in. I approached the bed and then observed little bugs. I smashed the bug with a piece of paper and it stained the sheet, looked like a blood stain. Would you know it BED BUGS. We called immediately to the front desk, we were told the manager was not on site. They sent up the engineer he checked behind the headboard with a flashlight. An hour later someone else came to the room and he tried to tell us that these bugs came in sliding door because it was open and that they were not bed bugs. Not knowing that we had caught them in a plastic bag and showed him the evidence that these were in fact BED BUGS. He finally agreed to not charge us for that night. Moved them to another room. After that our stay was good.
Mixed emotions       Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn

Lovely hotel and very quiet! My partner and I stayed here a few weeks ago for 3 nights and found it really nice. The staff were very friendly and the room we had was big and spacious. It is only about a 20 min walk to Universal Studios which was great and the subway/metro is right near Universal. We had the buffet breakfast each morning which was quite nice although I wished they had more continental stuff to choose from! Our room was cleaned every day we were there - I have no complaints at all - it was actually the quietest hotel we stayed in throughout our 3 week holiday - which involved going onto Hawaii and San Francisco!!

Great value for money and one stop from Hollywood Myself and three of my friends stayed at this Hotel as part of a miniature Californian tour. It was clean, the staff were friendly and I did not notice any noise from the motorway. The reason I chose this Hotel was its relatively close proximity to Hollywood. There is a five minute walk to the subway/rail station and then one stop and you walk out right at the Chinese theatre, this was perfect for us as we went out clubbing at the Tropicana and the Roosevelt Hotel.Overall this Hotel provides clean accomodation and serves perfectly as a base for those who wish to go out drinking in Hollywood.

Not the greatest Not that impressed but the price was low so I cant complain too much. The food was absoulely terrible. we tried both breakfast and dinner and both were disgusting! the hotel also had a funky smell and the rooms were not spacious. also, the neighborhood was not the best although they do offer a free shuttle to universal studies. their website pictures seem a bit decieving. it wasnt a terrible stay but just not what i expected.

nice clean quiet for a relasing break This hotel I picked was based on reviews I had read from this website, I was pleasnalty suprised at how quiet the hotel was and when I did arrive I was dealt with promptly, the hotel reception was nice and helpful but the concierge/ baggage handlers were a bit unhelpful and alwas trying to sell us tours, when a tour came to pickup a few people from the hotel I overheard the concierge asking for his cut (not nice to see or hear) and on the final day when we were going to the airport because we booked out own transfer they didnt tell me when they arrived and didnt open the doors or help with our luggage or anything like that.good point was its location to universal studios and the free shuttle that it took us to daily if we wanted it

what a noise very noisey hotel at side of freeway.asked to be moved no response from the management found them rude.toilet in room didnt work right had it fixed 3 times.very isolated position dont stop here

loved it this was my first visit to the USA and the people at the hotel were really friendly and helpful the hotel was spotless and met up to more then my expected standards.I am retuning to this hotel next year. I reccomend this hotel to anyone.

This place can write the book on service We stayed here for a total of 7 days at the start  end of a Southern California / Nevada Holiday. The check in was fast  efficient. The room was huge  though located at the back overlooking the Hollywood Freeway was very quiet thanks to the double glazing.  Wi-fi access in our room was excellent. Free shuttle bus service to the nearby Metro station  Universal Studios is great, as was the discounted tickets for Universal Studios in the gift shop. I can't say enough good things about this Hotel, We booked through a company called Purely America  found the price very reasonable. Big thanks to Richie  all the front desk staff for helping us enjoy a fantastic holiday

Wonderful stay We stayed here for two nights in March 2008. This hotel was a wonderful surprise. The staff are very helpful, the concierge was brilliant and helped us get to Disneyland and also a private tour of LA all for very reasonable prices. The rooms were large and comfortable, we had a balcony which was a hidden extra. I couldnt rave enough about this hotel, i would recommend to anyone.

Above average hotel for business This Holiday Inn was good for the two days I was there on a two day business trip. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Areas of construction were not an issue. The catering at our seminar was provided by the Holiday Inn and was good. The beds were very nice and I had a great night sleep. It was close proximity to local area attractions. Overall I was pleased with my stay here.
Pleasant Hotel       One of the main blocks

A VERY GREAT EXPERIENCE!! We are two young italian sisters and we went to United States alone for the first time on Feb 2007 to see the Oscar event in real life. We decided to stay at Beverly Garland Holiday Inn and we had a very nice time there! It is not so close to Hollywood and you can't reach by walk the most important attraction of the town but with a short walk you can reach the subway that easily take you wherever you want in LA and surrounding area . The walk from-to the subway takes about 15 minutes. The staff is friendly and help you to do whatever in you, for example we had a problem to phone in Italy when we arrived and they helped us to show how to do it...they booked all the excurions for us and suggested which places to see. The rooms are big, with big beds for europen people, they were clean and nice. To enter in the rooms block you don't need to pass in front of the reception if you don't want, they have a separate access and you can enter only with your key-card. They have a swimming pool. They also have a restaurant very close to it, you can reach it in a very short walk. they offer breakfast and dinner ( the only thing is that the menu was always the same, but that's it ). Beside this restaurant there are not very close places to eat or to shop. Anyway, they also have free shuttle to and from the Universal Studios. Anyway, we suggest this hotel to people with a car because is very close to the freeway but we had no problems even if we did not have a car, so if you don't mind walking from and to the subway, it is a nice hotel. And then, you are in LA, close to the hotel there are typical houses, there is Starbucks ( not too close) and Los Angeles is simply amazing!!!

A Pleasant Surprise Was a bit skeptical about staying at a Holiday Inn but I have to say we were very surprised. Hotel was very clean, rooms seem new and updated and very spacious. Hotel Staff was very helpful.Has a good restaraunt on site and is convenient to Universal and Hollywood attractions. Beds are very comfortable. Pool is small but nice and very well kept.Would definitely go back again. Great for families, a great bargain considering the price.
Heres the facts from our trip...       2 Queen Beds room

Comfortable and Convenient My teenage daughter and I stayed at Beverly Garland's Holiday Inn while vacationing in the Los Angeles area. We visited Universal Studios, Hollywood, and Burbank, and found the hotel to be centrally located. The highlight of my experience of this hotel was the comfortable bed. Although I chose not to take advantage of it, the hotel offered a pillow menu giving us the opportunity to change the type of pillows we had depending on whether we slept on our back, side, etc. The staff was extremely friendly right down the the security guard. The room was a little small, but clean. The grounds were clean, and there were a lot of trees around the hotel. The only real disadvantage I could find to our room was the level of freeway traffic noise. The hotel is located right next to a major freeway, and I had a little difficulty getting to sleep the first night we stayed. I purchased ear plugs for our second night, but didn't end up using them because I fell asleep pretty quickly after sinking into our comfy bed. We ate at Tulas on our second evening. The food was pretty good, but a little overpriced for what we got. Overall, I considered our stay at this hotel a positive experience.

Excellent hotel, we'll stay there again. My wife and I enjoyed staying at this excellent hotel and will definitely stay there again whenever we are in Los Angeles.The room was excellent and the staff were pleasant and helpful. The facilities including restaurant, bar, grounds and laundry were excellent.We were impressed by the number of people we saw who were maintaining the hotel and grounds to a very high standard.Above average for a Holiday Inn and a hotel with character.

Ideal for exploring Hollywood Ideal for exploring Hollywood, near to the Metro and buses for getting to the Main tourist attractions yet located in aquiet part of Hollywood so that you can relax after a day out.Rooms are very clean and comfortable and have tea service, TV etc. Nice restaurant/coffe shop and bar although becomes crowded at breakfast.Nice pool with plenty of shade.

just okay This hotel is conveniently located to Universal which is why we chose it. We actually walked from the park one day back to the hotel. They do provide a free shuttle though. The hotel is very dated is needing updating badly. It was only so-so in the cleanliness area. It wasn't great, and it wasn't terrible. Very overpriced though.

Good value for Universal Studios Great location for Universal, easy to find, reasonable price for Kids Suites which - as they say on their website - are actually standard twin queen rooms with one of the beds replaced with screened of twin bunk area. Worked well and cheaper than 'proper' suites. Free wi-fi but charge for parking.Great breakfasts at reasonable prices.Pool was warm even if the weather wasn't - nice little sauna.Excellent tennis courts.Second time we have been - very happy and we'll go again.
Valida sistemazione per gli Universal Studio's e Hollywood       camera da letto
Buona posizione, ottima struttura   showReview(21022077, 'full');
Tolles kleines Hotel - sehr zu empfehlen !   showReview(20815485, 'full');

Helpful Staff I had a very positive experience. It was a very busy weekend and the rooms were pretty booked. The room that was to be ours was not vacated until very late. The excellent desk clerk offered to find us another room and made sure that we were happy. In all, the staff were very polite and helpful and it was a very happening fun place to be on a Saturday night!
The Sportsmen's Lodge Is A Winner       Beautiful Sights  Sounds of the ourdoor reception area

Clean, comfortable and well priced Stayed at the Sportsmen's Lodge for work for 3 nights. The hotel feels somewhat like it has been stuck in 1962, complete with kitschy astroturf ringing the pool. The room that I had was on the 3rd floor and faced the pool. This only presents a problem if you want to get to sleep early as the pool is frequented until about 11pm. Room and furnishings appear to have been updated within the last few years and were quite clean and well kept. Hallways and lobby are beginning to show their age but are quite clean. The hotel restaurant was under renovation during my stay so a temporary dining room had been set up in one of the hotel's conference rooms. The wait staff still appeared to be ironing out the details of this change. As I only had breakfast (cereal and fruit) at the hotel I can't comment on the quality of the food though the selection looked decent for all meals. Staff at reception were quite friendly and happily made taxi reservations to the airport, etc. Overall the hotel is comfortable, clean and offers a decent value for LA area.

Good hotel except for the flies On arrival our room was not ready as we were early however the Receptionist was very helpful, booking a trip for the next day for us. We had asked for a 'city view' room thinking we would be able to see downtown but we just had a view of a grassy wooded area in which there must have been some stagnant water. We opened the patio to have a look round when we first got into the room  noticed the fly screen but didn't pay much attention to it. (we've never used one). Unfortunately we left the door open which was enough time for a few flies to join us. Daft as it may seem I couldn't sleep that night although my husband had got rid of all the flies we could see at the time, and he got rid of a couple more when we came in later on - I just felt like there were things crawling on me all night. (There weren't!). It would have been better if there had been a note on the doors warning you to keep the fly screen closed at all times. I was absolutely shattered the next day when we were doing most of our sightseeing. Other than this the room was spacious and the beds very comfortable. A coffee maker was provided plus a fridge and there was a hairdrier and an iron and ironing board. There was no safe in the room and when we asked for one of the safety deposit boxes at Reception there were none left. One of the Receptionists said he would let us know if one became available but one didn't. We had a problem with the sink not draining when we arrived (would have thought the maid would have spotted that when she cleaned the room prior to our arrival?) We reported it and someone came to fix it quite quickly. The toilet also sometimes needed to be flushed twice but that was not a major problem. The room had a connecting door which was a bit disconcerting when the people next door sounded like they were trying to come through. The dividing railings between all the balconies are also quite low, and there are warnings to keep doors locked at all times. There was a fixed head shower in the bathroom and the wardrobe had 10 hangars. There was a laundry facilty at the hotel which can be quite useful if you are travelling around a lot. The pool area was nice and used by lots of people, towels were provided . There was a bar at one end. One morning we were going out very early and ordered a room service breakfast, eggs  sausage  toast. Don't bother - it was all at varying stages between lukewarm and cold. The next day we went down to the cafe which was better although we waited a while to be served.Internet access was available just off the lobby by using cash or credit card. The location is convenient for road access but there is not a lot nearby if you are wanting to explore on foot. We got a taxi up to Studio City in the evening but not as much to do there as we had hoped.Wouldn't stay there again but probably OK if you are driving everywhere and you get a room with a pool view.

great atmosphere Yes this hotel is in the old style but we loved it. The room was comfortable for 3 of us with plenty of space and it was clean. The service at the front desk was generally very good. We used the free shuttle service to Universal Studios and they also booked us tickets.From the bedroom we had a view of the pool and the hills beyond which I would recommend asking for. The pool was big and warm. At night they put candles around the pool which made it look very attractive. When we were there they were just about to host their annual cowboy gathering ( real ones and film ones!) and so there was some nice singing around the pool by men in stetsons! We also got chating to a guy who claimed he was a TV director- real LA!! Breakfast was served in the restaurant and you could order food around the pool. I have not given this hotel 5 because the restaurant and bar shut at 9pm!

Good place We stayed here for the first two nights of a tour  wished we could have stayed longer. Rooms were big, with balconies. Very clean.The hotel staff were very obliging, making me some vegetarian soup after the, very cheap, sandwich  soup supper my husband  I were sharing contained bits of ham floating in the soup. There was a good pool. Best of all, you can buy a 2 day pass to near-by Universal Studios and have free transport on the hotel shuttle bus.

Great place to stay! I have stayed here two times with my family and we couldn't have been more satisfied with the place. I'll admit that it is outdated, for the most part, although some rooms were renovated a couple of years ago but the rooms remain very clean and spacious. The hotel has two restaurants, one casual and the other white tablecloth, and both offer excellent food at reasonable prices. The Olympic-size pool is wonderful for serious swimmers and frolickers alike, and a cute tiki bar offers every favorite libation. The grounds around the hotel could use some sprucing up, though. Some staff members seemed a little indifferent to the needs of guests but most were nice enough.The neighborhood is safe and walkable with many restaurants and shops located up and down Ventura Blvd., including a Ralph's grocery store just across the street that is open 24 hours. The location, itself, is very convenient to any other area attractions that beckon tourists.I highly recommend staying here if you don't mind a laid-back, unpretentious atmosphere. The rates are reasonable and the parking is free, which normally isn't the case in the LA area. I would definitely stay here again and again.

Average hotel, great pool The hotel is located in Studio City near by shops and restaurants. The hotel is currently being renovated, which hopefully will improve the rooms, that were ok, but needed a make over. The hotel has a great pool, and there are a cafe (open for breakfast, lunch and dinner - the breakfast was fine), a bar  grill and a restaurant.Parking cost about 10 $ pr. day, internet access cost about 3 $ for 10 or 15 minutes (at the hotels computer).Most nights there were a lot of noise from the bar/parties at the hotel, which was irritating.The staff were friendly and helpful.

Excellent choice My wife and I booked this Hotel prior to arriving in LA, and were pleased that we did.The hotel is in a reasonable part of Ventura Blvd, with the usual eateries close-by. Its a simple 30 minute drive from LAX, and its close to Universal City for the attractions. Central for the other area's: Beverly hills, Hollywood etc..Room large enough and clean. Pool area was airy and has a bar. You can purchase breakfast at the restaurant near the pool which is excellent value.We had two nights here, and would have stayed longer had we not done all of the LA sights.Overall excellent find.

Highly recommended. My boyfriend and i stayed here for 5 nights in total. The place had been recommended to us by an LA local, and we weren't disappointed. Our room (a standard king) was huge and well appointed. The staff were very helpful, arranging transport for us around the city, among other things, and were only too willing to help. The valley location was fantastic - close to Studio City, and along Ventura within easy walking distance from the hotel - Jerry's Famous Deli, Iroha sushi, Il Tramezzino (for a great lunch panini), Ole spanish and tapas restaurant. Highly recommended.

All I expected  My wife  I stayed at the Sportsman Lodge Hotel on Saturday Feb'08th for a one night get away from San Bernardino  loved everything about this place  location. After reading OK reviews I felt I must come back to this site  leave my honest review  opinion of this hotel. We arrived at 6pm  found that at all Excutive Suites were on the ground level  was a bit dissapointed as it wouldnt have the same view as a higher level. As soon as I showed disappoitment of this I was offered two differant Exc Suites with two differant views to chose from, we chose room#611 which had a lovely garden  pool view. After deciding on our room  thanking him for the option we were given 2 free Complimentry breakfest coupons for the Patio Cafe for our inconvinience. Food was great along with appeteziers / thumbs up to the small but friendly bar inside the Hotel  the friendly bar tender. All employess made this great review happen  we will be back for sure ! Must also mention the close proximity to Universal City Walk  also the LOVELY settings this hotel offers such as the white bench in front of pound - thank you thank you thnak you for giving us everything we expected from this one night get away  some . . the automatic late check out was nice too !!!

Good value but not great for business travelers I stayed at the Lodge because the rates were good compared to other hotels in the area. The room was clean. The staff was very friendly. The decor is a bit 'tired' and shabby. Overall, though, it was a clean, pleasant stay EXCEPT when it came to getting business done. The wireless service was spotty, especially in the mornings. I wouldn't have minded paying for it if it had worked properly. Will I stay again? Not sure. Great deal for tourists but not necessarily for business folks.One additional note. I saw some of the other reviews where guests complained about the decor, the food, etc. Come on, folks, what are you expecting for prices like this? You want five-star hotel services, book a room at $300/night hotel. This is a decent, relatively inexpensive place to stay.
