Which is fine if they actually return the money back to you. Fourth - When my boyfriend and I checked in, the person at the front desk gave us two key cards that did not even work for our hotel room PLUS charged us TWICE for our stay and didn't even acknowledge what he did. My boyfriend didn't know either until he looked at his online statement - thankfully for that. When we notified the front desk of this situation, all they did was apologize and contacted their accounting dept who unfortunately told us they couldn't even do anything. So I stepped in and asked, if you are going to return our $50 insurance charge per night upon our check out, why can't you return the second charge as this is not a valid charge? They could not even give me an answer nor did they try to resolve it. So finally, the next front desk person we spoke with said she will try the accounting dept. again and give us a call the following business day, Monday (we left on a friday). At this point - it is now Thursday, no refund was made nor did they even bother contacting us. I believe they are waiting and expecting us to dispute the charge from the bank which is completely insane and the transaction and investigation for the dispute will take weeks compared to just a refund from the hotel itself - we have already notified them of this delay and nothing has been done. This amount was a lot too and he had used his debit card. Fifth - They give you keys for the bar which is located in the tv shelf. They tell you the keys are for the bar and make it sound like anything from the bar is complimentary. I first thought the drinks/snacks were complimentary but they don't mention you have to pay for everything until you ask - nor do they leave a sign anywhere about it compared the other hotels I've stayed at. Conclusion - Hotel was really small, pictures of the hotel gave a much bigger and nicer impression of the hotel until we walked in it. The next time I visit, I think I will stay at the Westin and pay 50 dollars more for just the convenience, safety, security, bigger room and a staff who can provide even an ounce of satisfaction to their guests. PROSDoormen were nice and rooms were clean.Please find a hotel that's either by Fisherman's Wharf or right next to the Union Square park. Spending that extra money per night is worth it.
Good Location, needs a facelift       I Pod clock radio

Stop Looking and Book Here! We ended up staying here after the Palace and the Sir Francis Drake were sold out. I'm so glad that our first two choices were booked because our misfortune led us to my favourite hotel, hands down! First off, the price was moderate considering how expensive boutique hotels in Union Square are. Then we had the option to upgrade our room to a king sized suite for only $49 extra/night. It was well worth it. The room was beautiful and the bathroom was to die for. The decor of the bedroom was fabulously fun and chic without being pretentious. In fact, I loved the room so much that I was trying to cancel some of the activities I had planned just so I could spend more time lounging in our amazing room! Also, the bed was incredibly comfortable. In addition to all this, the hotel rooms and amenities were well thought out and I found myself discovering little details that made my stay even more enjoyable (board games and such).The decor in the lobby and elevators is a lovely introduction to the hotel and the front desk personnel and door men are very helpful (Pam in particular at the front desk made my trip much easier).Anyways, I could make this already long and glowing review even longer because I loved the Serrano so much but I'll stop here and urge people reading this to book a room here ASAP! This will definitely be the only hotel I stay in when I go back to San Fran!

Poor Customer Service First off, when you book a room, the preferences you select don't actually mean anything. We booked a two bed smoking room, and when we arrived, were told that they could not accommodate us. Great.So we go up to the room. Seems ok. I start to unpack and find a pair of dirty undies in the closet. I go downstairs, and they tell me there is nothing they can do because the hotel is completely sold out for the night. I demand some sort of compensation and am basically called a liar by the manager on duty.

Great location, small room, superb staff. V Happy We booked via Hotwire.com so got a rate around $120 a night. And for that, it was superb. The hotel is lovely, the lobby great, the free wine - a nice perk, the staff, all of them, 100% fantastic.We suffered no problems with noise. The panhandlers seem a common feature of SF and none were aggressive. To be honest, all my memories of the panhandlers are of charming people trying to charm a few cents off you (I went outside for smokes frequently so met a fair few of them lol)The only thing I'd say is that if I'd paid rack rates for the same Queen room I'd have been very miffed at $299 - the room was as small as could be. It was lovely, and worked well, but put it this way, if you have your TV cabinet doors extended, you can't get from one side of the bed to the other. Not a problem, but not worth 300 bucks in my mind. Saying that - it probably is for central SF.I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel if space is not an issue. Oh - free Internet, which is essential for us as we are travelling extensively.We have now moved to the Cathedral Hill Hotel - which has rack rates at the same as the Hotwire rates for the Serrano - none of the charm but the room is twice the size. This counts a lot for us as we are here for 5 nights. But put it this way, we'd have stayed at the Serrano if we could have secured more nights at the same rate.Book with confidence! (oh and for Hotwire fans - it's the 3.5 star thumbs up Boutique option in the area :-) )
Great Hotel       room

Had a great stay! We found a great deal for this hotel - $109/night for a King room - so we booked a two night stay right away! For the most part, we really enjoyed our stay. We got in late Saturday night and were upgraded to a suite, which was an unexpected surprise. The hotel was beautiful, had great detail, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The one small problem we had was that the walls are very thin. We often heard doors slamming, and people's conversations, and that was a bit annoying. In addition, there were $20/night in taxes, and the parking was $40/night! There is a safe place to park (I was worried it might not be as safe to not use the hotel's parking) on Taylor right next to the hotel - only $24/night. They were full when we got there, so we just sucked it up, but I would definitely recommend it.The location of the hotel makes it VERY easy to get to Union Square - we had a couple dodgy moments, but we still felt as safe as we were in other areas. But overall - the hotel was great, the beds were super comfy, and everything was nice and clean. I would definitely stay at this hotel again...

Lovely Stayed at the Serrano for a week around newyears. Quite a bargain for approx 90 euro's a night including taxes, considering location and quality of service. Very close to all the shops and Union Square. Cable car around the corner, as well as the BART - a breeze to get to and from the airport via public transportation. Service was good: efficient and friendly. The room wasn't huge, but more than adequate. Good shower, nice amenities, and - most importantly - a great bed. The leopard-print bathrobes are hilarious (in a good way). No problems with noise, inside or outside the hotel. On the downside windows don't open, which can create a bit of a stuffy atmosphere. Unfortunately far too many hotels have this issue. In short, an excellent place to stay if you're visiting SF. The odd interior won me over in the end; it beats the cookie-cutter hotel average. The Serrano deserves a higher rating on the popularity index than it current position in the 50s.

Loved the free wine! Found this hotel with a great review on travelzoo.com when it was going for $100 a night - definitely a steal!My sister and I enjoyed the complimentary wine bar from 5-6. They were very generous pourers, and we quickly found ourselves talking to the other guests and sharing stories and tips about the city.The rooms were a little on the small side, but comfy, especially the beds and the down comforters and pillows! Aveda ammenities were also a nice touch.If breakfast is not included in the rate, I suggest skipping the hotel's b-fast and head out to one of the many dinners on your walk to union square. It will cost you less.Location is great and not too noisy. There is a section near the hotel that you shouldn't cross into at night, but we didn't have any trouble.Definitely would recommend the hotel, especially at $100 a night!

Great location, great service Booked the Serrano for a 3-night weekend stay in San Francisco. The location is great, it's right across the street from the Hilton San Francisco, easy access to Powell Station for Cable Cars, BART, and MUNI.The room and bathroom were a little cramped for 2 double beds, but this is downtown San Francisco, you're not spending your time in the hotel room. Room was exceptionally clean.Late check-in and luggage storage were handled with great care. Had no issues.Favorite part of the stay? Every evening at 5:00pm there is a Wines of the World reception in the lobby with complimentary wine and beer. Great way to unwind after walking around the city!

Great price/location We stayed at the Serrano Hotel for 5 days in March  had a great time in San Francisco. The hotel was close to Union Square (within walking distance), the BART station and the Powell St cable car line. Lots of dining locations to choose from. If you take the BART from the SF Airport - take Powell St north to O'Farrell and head west to Taylor St. We made the mistake of heading east from the BART and walked through the Tenderloin District - not the nicest area, lots of homeless people. All in all, a good place to stay - love the evening wine service in the lobby and the board games available for playing anytime. Take the cable car to the wharf - about 2 mile walk - but it actually takes awhile with the steep hills.

Great Start!!! Would go again..... Great start to our honeymoon, were a little worried reading some reviews going on about the area. We had no problems, Yes you might see the odd weirdo but lets face it you can see them anywhere. The hotel was more than expected, the room was very clean and comfortable, and as it was our honeymoon we had asked for a high room and the hotel obliged by giving us a room on the top floor 17th or something like that. The location is handy for everything (Dollar rent a car is right round the corner) and if travelling to San Fran again I would stay in this hotel again. Overall an excelent start to our trip round the USA. Next stop Santa Barbara.5*

Serrano was absolutely perfect We have just returned from a trip to California/Las Vegas and San Francisco was our first stop. The Serrano sounded so good on Tripadvisor and it lived up to its reputation.The room was absolutely beautiful, extremely comfortable and clean. In reviews it was said that the rooms were small but we found it adequate and spaceous for our needs. The staff were extremely friendly and it was great to come back to the hotel after a day of sightseeing and be greeted with smiles and the use of your name. So well done all at Serrano, my husband and I will definately be back when we return to San Francisco, you made us feel welcome, special and at home.

Great Location--Even Better Bed The Serrano is part of the Kimpton boutique chain. All related hotels host evening wine/beer hours in the lobby, which is a very nice perk.Check-in was unbelievably smooth. I had been staying at another Kimpton (Hotel Triton) earlier in the week and checked out at noon before walking the 1/3 mile to the Serrano. I fully expected to not be able to check in, but I had hoped to at least leave my luggage before heading out again. Much to my surprise, I was greeted warmly and given my preferred room immediately.My room was on the 12th floor and had a so-so view east of Union Square. My room was wonderful--decadently comfortable queen sized bed, sufficent armoire and tv, and decent bathroom with bath/shower combo and Aveda products. The rooms aren't large, but you are hard-pressed to find large rooms in the middle of San Francisco. The room was spotless and was immaculately tended to each morning by housekeeping.I'm a member of the loyalty program with Kimpton, which includes a gift upon each arrival. When I arrived to my room, I found a 16 oz. bottle of spring water and a small box of Napa-produced truffles. Very nice touch.The concierge assisted me twice--once to arrange shuttle transportation to the airport and another time to make reservations for my party at a nearby restaurant. Each time, Chad was most gracious and helpful.My only complaint was with room-service from the adjacent restaurant (Ponzu). On my last morning there, I ordered breakfast and was told delivery would take place within 30 minutes. After 55 minutes, I called to inquire about the order since my shuttle was due to pick me up in 45 minutes. I was told that the kitchen was backed up and my order would not be ready for at least another 25 minutes. I emphasized that I had been conveyed different information when I placed the order and that I would need to cancel the order due to my shuttle. Within 5 minutes, I had a knock at the door and my breakfast was ushered into the room. The restaurant manager had delivered it and then told me it was on the house. In spite of the frustration of waiting, I felt it had been handled very well.One final note: many reviewers have commented/complained about the large number of transients in the area. San Francisco is a large city and the Serrano Hotel is located in the middle of it all. Unfortunately, homelessness is a very sad reality of city life in the United States. I did not encounter one hostile transient during my entire stay. I felt completely safe and comfortable (and spent much of my time alone). Homelessness makes much of us uncomfortable--and it should. But it is not a threatening issue that should dissuade visitors from staying in the Union Square area.It's hard to go wrong with a Kimpton property.

Enjoyed the Serrano My daughter and I stayed at the Serrano for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The foyer is lovely and the staff were friendly, especially John and Chad who greeted us as we came in, helped with tours and were generally fun. The room was on the small side, but had lovely decor, the beds were really comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. Close to Powell St and Union Square. There were homeless people nearby but they did not cause us any problem.One waitress in Ponzu restaurant was unfriendly at breakfast time, but the other staff were fine.I would definitely stay here again.

Comfortable Room Everything about this hotel was great, except for the food.Room wasn't large, but the bed was very comfortable and the shower was terrific. Bathroom is small but they've at least tried to make some counter space. Hotel was for quiet, except for the high pressure window spraying at 6:30 am. Lobby is beautiful. I checked in very late on a Sunday night, curb service was outstanding and front desk was efficient checking in (and out.)Only problems were food related: no coffee in room. The service at Ponzu restaurant for breakfast was actually hostile, although we were able to go out into the lobby for the free coffee and bring it back into the Ponzu to drink. Bar is fine in the evening but closes early. However there are other excellent restaurants nearby, and the Hilton across the street has a top-floor bar with an awesome view.
Lovely Boutique Hotel       room lounge

Sin in the City This Hotel is a great choice. It is very comfortable, very european and is just plain fun. The hotel is only 4-5 blocks from Union Square and the Embarcadero BART Station. They have a wine and beer hour 5-6PM. The Ponzu Restaraunt attached is great too. Next door is first class wine shop. The only down fall is that is right next to the Tenderloin District, but don't let that stop you. This place is a great value and awesome place to stay in the City. Also check out the lepoard print fun wear in the rooms.

Unique decor, nice service good location I stay at Kimpton Hotels whenever I can. First because they are pet friendly and I often bring my small dog and second you can always rely on them to be interesting, well appointed and comfortable. I found the Serrano to be no different. An older building it is attractive and has a decor that is unique. The rooms are slightly on the small side, but the beds are comfortable, there is good water pressure and they are are attractively decorated. The toiletries are nice and the rooms are always clean. The staffs are always friendly and helpful and the concierage service extraordinary. As per a previous reviewer I too have found that as Kimpton loyalty member, the Serrano does not always provide the amenities the you are supposed to get, but that said a bottle of warm water and a biscotti (that seems to be the usual for me)is really not missed. But if say you are going to provide something you should.I would definately stay at the Serrano again, in fact I am booked for this upcoming weekend. As far as the location is concerned I never felt unsafe and it is close to Union Square and Powell Street

Good (not great) hotel if you can catch a deal on Priceline First, let me say that overall, this was a good hotel. The room was cute. It was in a good location and I would stay here again (if I can get it for $80 on Priceline, but I would never pay $200 for the room that we got). Okay, so the hotel's website is pretty misleading. Let's just say that the hotel hired an excellent photographer. The lobby and rooms look many times larger than the actual size. We just decided to pretend that our room was a bedroom, not an actual hotel room and it felt a little better. There was just enough space to walk around the bed and that was it. That said, the room was cute, very cozy and comfortable. Things weren't quite as nice as the pictures - the bedskirt was pretty rumpled and the windows were pretty dirty - but it wasn't horribly objectionable, just not what I had been expecting. Service wise, it was mixed. We arrived early, around 11 a.m., and we were able to check in at arrival and were given a room on the top (17th) floor. Yay! However, strangely, later in the day when we were returning from shopping we saw some sort of employee exiting our room. Seemed kind of wierd considering we were already checked in and it wasn't really time to start cleaning the room. We called and then went to the front desk to try to figure out what was going on. They kind of blew us off, but eventually decided that it was somebody checking the minbar. Hmm...that's the first time, I've seen that, but whatever. Also, unlike other reviewers, nobody happily greeted us upon entrance and exit. Not a big deal, but I think we were expecting a bit more of a pampering atmosphere, and it was more like self serve. In regards to location, it was conveniently located close to shopping and the BART and MUNI. That was very nice and worth quite a bit. As others have said there is a major homeless problem in the area. Normally, I can just ignore them and keep walking but this past trip was a different experience entirely. I was followed, called a [--] and had objects thrown at me. Not entirely pleasant, but I just tried to brush it off. Afterall, it makes a good story. And a side note, in regards to the oft mentioned Dottie's Tru Blue Cafe, which is about a block from the hotel. So NOT worth it. We waited in line for about an hour and a half for breakfast. The experience was interesting I guess...I mean how often do you get to watch crack heads pacing back and forth in front of you or see a drug deal on the corner? The food was good, but not great and definitely not worth the wait. Personally, I would have been just as happy with a muffin from Starbucks.

Tres Boutique When proffered about a hotel, boutique usually means old, small and dated. That pretty much sums up the Serrano. Add to that the neighborhood where homeless people play dice just outside the hotel entrance, and you get a less than satisfactory stay for the price.It is not a bad hotel really, but I would definitely not recommend it either. If this were a discount hotel, I would say forgive the problems and give it a try. The beds are comfortable and the staff is friendly. It is certainly adequate. It is just far from luxurious.If you are from Europe, you will be very satisfied with the room sizes. If you are used to U.S. hotel room sizes, you will be extremely disappointed. The bathroom was so small, I kept bumping my head and other body parts just turning around in it. I would complain about the size of the bedroom except that I visited a different room that a collegue was staying in and in comparison to his my room was downright spacious.They have free internet access, which is wonderful. However, despite supposedly being high speed, the speed I got was far closer to dial up. The TV was good however. They actually had quite a few channels.This has been a somewhat rambling review. The bottom line is that at the regular price, this is not the hotel for you. The rooms are clean but small and the location is on the edge of a very bad section of town. If you somehow get a bargain discount, it might be worth it. Just go into it with an open eye.

Perfect! We'll be back. My boyfriend and I stayed at The Serrano for 4 days and 3 nights on a holiday weekend. We were immideatly greated by the bellman by we've been waiting for you, what took you so long? (in a friendly joking manor mind you). And for the next three nights, the same bellmen greated us with Hello Fresno after telling him where we were traveling from once. The next morning when we were asking for directions, the person at the check in counter challeneged us to a game of 21, we beat the dealer and got 2 complimentry breakfests at Ponzu. The rooms are perfect size, if you're expecting a giant hotel room that isn't old then your in the wrong city, everything in SF has charm. The hotel seemed revamed and was EXACTLY as the websites pictures showed. The sauna on the LL and fitness room are open 24/7. The hotel is about 3 blocks away from bart, trollys, and union square. Perfect location. And we did walk around the hotel at night, it's a large city people you will see bums in ANY area! We booked the hotel through a time share but I would 110% pay full price and definately stay here again!!!!!!!

Repeat customer disappointed this time... Stay Monday, Feb. 4 - Wednesday, Feb. 6, 2008This was my fourth time staying at the Serrano (3 times in 2007, 1st time in 2008). We have kept coming back because the experience is fun, and because as return stayers there is such a nice welcome back. Not this time...The bellman is great, friendly, he knows who you are just by teling him where you are coming from. At check-in we were asked if this was our first time staying at the hotel. I told the man that this was our 4th time, and asked if our Kimpton In-Touch loyalty number was attached to our reservation in the computer (I thought maybe it was not showing up in the computer that we were return customers because the loyalty number was not attached to the reservation). He said that our loyalty number was attached to the reservation.We proceeded to the room. In the past, there has always been a nice note and some treats (cookies, drinks, small bottle of wine) in the room welcoming us back as loyal, returning guests. There was nothing there. I thought maybe something would be coming later. Nope...nothing. So, again, I thought maybe our number is really not attached to our reservation. The following morning I went to the front desk and let them know that we usually have a little something waiting in our room as in-touch loyalty members, and nothing was there, so I just wanted to double check that the loyalty number was in the computer. The woman checked and just simply said Yes, it's there. I guess I have been spoiled, but I was disappointed that there was nothing waiting for us, and no special welcoming feel this time. We were going to head out for the day (around 8 am) and got some change from the front desk. The woman then said she would try to send up something for us, inquired where we were from, made small talk. I thought that was nice and we would have something when we get back. Nope! When we returned, the room was clean, but no goodies were there.Got back around 2 pm and took a nap. Was awoken with a knock at the door at around 4 pm. A woman handed me a bottle of water and a little box with 2 chocolates...not exactly the same touch as before.At check-out the next morning, the same woman at the front desk who the previous day looked in the computer for our loyalty number asked me if I wanted to sign up to join Kimpton In-Touch. I told her we are already members, is the number not there? (She just checked on this for me the day before) She said, oh yes, the number is here. She asked us if we have stayed at the hotel before. I told her this was our 4th visit. The hotel was not busy at all, so I was confused as to how so many staff members at the front desk didn't have a clue about anything.I booked the reservation though the Kimpton website after logging in with my loyalty number, so I was expecting to receive all the perks that go along with that. Instead, I felt like we were treated as if we booked through Priceline or something (I should have done that--I would have gotten a better deal, and the same service).I am normally not a complainer--but I definitely feel like the experience for the return customer is different now than it was in the past. I think the front desk needs some help. There are lots of hotels in SF Union Square and the reason I would return to the Serrano was consistent service where I felt they recognized repeat customers. Even with me giving them many hints, they still did not get it. I was not impressed this time, and I think it is time to try some different hotels when we go to SF.

would not go back seemed like a decent place until I tried to go to sleep... there was what sounded like a highschool party going on in the room next door, called front desk at midnight and no answer? called again later and they sounded as if this was a regular occurence and not appologetic. the building itself is old and makes a lot of noise, plumbing and heating was rather loud, and could feel what seemed to be broken tile underneath the carpeting. Not a terrible place but one of the worst nights of sleep I have had while away from home in quite a while.

Loved Serrano Hotel, San Francisco Booked the room the day before using Priceline, sight unseen. Paid $70 (plus taxes). Hotel was exactly what was pictured on the Internet, staff was extremely friendly and upbeat. Serrano is a boutique hotel, which would usually mean old and small, but we found it extremely charming, quiet and very clean. It was located within walking distance to Union Square. I would stay there again! Also recommend the Taylor Street Coffee Shop, just a few doors down! Excellent breakfast, great value, quick service! Recommend parking your car across the street to save a little money ($40 for valet, $30 for do-it-yourself).
Wouldn't recommend       View from room

Don't Worry, Stay Here! Overlook the spotty neighborhood and try this fantastic hotel! Excellent greeting on check-in, lively atmosphere in the lobby (and free drinks in the evening!), and a comfy room too. Just avoid going any further from Union Square than the hotel's Taylor Street address.

A Windy Long Weekend in San Fran My wife and I stayed four nights at the Serrano Hotel in San Francisco from January 3 to 7, 2008. We had never stayed at the Serrano Hotel before, but since it is part of the Kimpton boutique hotel chain that my wife and I enjoy, we thought that we'd give it a try. I booked our King Deluxe room via the Kimpton website for $126 per night (plus tax), a rate that I thought was very reasonable for downtown San Francisco.We arrived Thursday night at 10 pm during the worst winter storm of the season (our flight from Canada was delayed 3 hours due to the storm conditions in San Francisco). Unfortunately, after a long trip getting to San Francisco, we did not get the warm Serrano Hotel welcome advertised on many web pages and websites. Don't get me wrong, everyone was decent to us, but there was no offer of a game of 21 to upgrade our room (as mentioned in the bedside book in our room), and the concierge desk person was less than enthusiastic when I asked about any half-decent places to eat on a late Thursday evening in the immediate area (we had missed dinner due to the flight delay).Speaking of the immediate area around the Serrano Hotel, it is less than upscale. In fact, the neighbourhood, despite being only two blocks from Union Square and kitty-korner to the San Francisco Hilton, is what one might call Transitional. That is, by day the neighbourhood is okay, but come darkness, the streets are taken over by homeless people and panhandlers. Furthermore, the streets in the area are very dark, lacking sufficient municipal street lighting. Some people may find the idea of walking alone at night too scary to try...As for the Serrano Hotel itself, it is a three star property (based on the five star scale). Some websites refer to it as a four star property, but it is not! The lobby is nice and clean, with a feeling of the roaring 20s. Our room, a King Deluxe, was also clean and contained the blessed Kimpton King Size bed (there are no Tall Rooms at the Serrano Hotel). As always, we had excellent sleeps in the Kimpton bed, but our room was extremely small with a very plain and basic bathroom. We can only hope that one-day the Kimpton people will hear about flat screen Plasma and LCD television, and start installing 42 inch sets into their hotel rooms instead of the small 20 year old television sets they currently utilize. Other than our first night when we enquired about a local place to eat, we found the staff to be quite friendly, with many staff members going out of their way to say hello to us or to ask if we needed help with anything. The various concierge staff were excellent at arranging dinner reservations and taxis for us, while the cleaning staff did an excellent job of keeping our room clean and tidy.Overall, we rate our Serrano Hotel experience as okay, but not quite what we have come to expect from Kimpton properties. If one must stay in the Union Square area, then the Sir Francis Drake, also a Kimpton property, would be a much better choice. But our favorite Kimpton San Francisco area hotel remains The Argonaut Hotel at the corner of Jefferson and Hyde on Fisherman's Wharf. For just a few dollars more, The Argonaut Hotel is in a far superior class to the Serrano Hotel, and at The Argonaut Hotel you get the bonus of staying in an area of town that is fun, safe and filled with excellent tourist and eating options.

Loved the Serrano! This small boutique hotel provided us with the very personal service (How are you today, Mr.  Mrs. H?) that makes you feel special. We were upgraded for free for our honeymoon. The executive suite is lovely, with large jacuzzi tub, lots of granite tile, and antique furniture. Beautiful lobby, very clean room, and pretty, cheerful decor takes away from the drab rain of the city, and is so much nicer than the generic big-box hotel rooms. Great firm mattress, fine linens and down duvet. Prompt attention to small problems or requests. Concierge got us into a great nearby restaurant (John's Grill) at the last minute for NYE. Ponzu restaurant (attached to hotel) was excellent for a romantic dinner (try the lemongrass steak and fried rice)! Top-rated Dottie's Cafe is just around the corner, and worth the wait for breakfast (awesome berry torte). While the hotel is on the edge of the Tenderloin district, we never felt like we were in an unsafe area, although there are many street people everywhere in SF, it seems. You are only 3 blocks from Union Square shopping, cable cars, etc. Other perks: free ethernet connection, mini-fridge, in-room safe, nice large LCD TV, free games to borrow from the lobby, free evening wine tasting. One caveat: the lobby was quite chilly from the frequent blasts of cold outside air whenever the door opened.One other word of warning--its true, Alcatraz tours sell out a week ahead, so buy tickets ahead or you'll be paying more to get them from a scalper or broker.You really don't need a car with all the transportation options, but the one day we rented a car to drive a little farther out, we took advantage of the free valet parking for hybrids (otherwise valet is $40, and garages nearby are 25-30/day). Would absolutely return here on our next visit to SF!
Ottimo Hotel   showReview(22469350, 'full');
Fantastico   showReview(22083999, 'full');
Carino, pulitissimo e centrale   showReview(19507153, 'full');
Affordable and great location       Small bathroom with Shower in bath
Great Deal for simple and charming experience       a room without a view

Victorian and Ancient Having recently spent 4 nights at this hotel we were very dissapointed at the noise we had to tolerate from our room being adjacent to what we believe was Student accomodation. The room was small, needed a thorough update, it showed its Victorian Style leaving us to believe we were in the Victorian era.The Shower was grotty, the taps grimy and after showering you still didn't feel clean. The window of the shower was also broken.We have never known a hotel to close its very popular restaurant for 2 nights, and the bar for 1 night.Sorry Beresford but I wont be staying with you again, and wouldn't recommend it.

Very Small room for a double Stayed at the Beresford for 3 nights during a coach tour. We expected a small room but it was smaller than acceptable with only one bedside cabinet for what was supposed to be a double room. The phone was connected at the opposite side of the room and there was no clock/alarm. The room was very cold when we arrived and when we asked about heating we were told it can only be put on to heat the whole hotel. We got heating the following evening only.l No tea/coffee making facilities in the room either. The receptionist was rather abrupt and unfriendly. Good points were the hotel was clean, served a nice breakfast. had free internet connection for 15 mins at a time and handy for Union Square.

Great location, nice staff, hot rooms My husband and I live just across the bay and often go to shows in San Francisco and stay in Union Square for the weekend. This was our first stay at the Hotel Bereford. The hotel had a great location and was very clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and small, but who needs alot of room when y ou don't plan on being it it much! Only problem I had was there was no air conditioner or screens on the large window. We were on the 7th floor and had to leave the window wide open all day and night to get some air flow becaue it was so stuffy. If we had a child this would have been a big problem because the window started about 3 feet up from the wall and anything could have fallen out it since there was no screen. Unfortunately it was a loud night in the city and we did not get much sleep with the windows open. A ceiling fan would have been nice. We came back from a show around midnight and went into the White Horse Tavern attached to the hotel. It was a very nice English style pub but was unbearably hot and stuffy also so we decided to have drinks in our room.I would go back to this hotel but only in the winter.

Good Value... My sister and I stayed here for a weekend last November. The first thing I thought when I walked into the hotel was that it had charm and character. It is unlike the usual hotel chains in the US, more like a place you'd expect to find in Europe. My sister and I were first assigned to a room on the first floor, which looked like it had not been cleaned yet and smelled a little funny. The bathroom appeared dirty and there were hairs on the pillows in the beds, which obviously did not belong to us as we had just checked in. We went to the front desk and told them about our room. They were apologetic and switched us to a room on the 2nd floor, which was much more nice, cozy, and more importantly, clean, compared to the last one. The hotel is in a great location, just a short walking distance to Union Square and some great shopping. I don't know that I would stay here again, the only problem I encountered was the cleanliness of the first room. Other than that, the stay was perfectly fine, the hotel staff friendly, and the continental breakfast good. Over all, it was a good value for the price, just make sure you get a clean room.

Fabulous old San Francisco Hotel This old boutique Hotel was more than we ever expected for the price. The room was clean and well appointed, the Hotel Staff was more than accomodating including keeping our luggage after we checked out so we could enjoy the City for another full day and keeping our car also. They were very polite and helpful with any questions we had. The FREE Breakfast was wonderful in the White Horse as was the Fabulous dinner we had there the night before! We felt like we were back in Paris!! This is a TOP NOTCH Hotel in a wonderful city close to everything and within walking distance to Union square.
Great value, charming character       Two double beds and a dresser -- not quite enough room to open the door all the way.

Disappointed! We have just completed a two week tour of California and had stayed in nine different hotels / inns / motels. I can honestly say that the Beresford was the worst we had stayed in.Firstly, our room was freezing cold (as was the same with other guests on the same tour - especially the Queen Anne rooms) due to the bathroom window not shutting properly so had a hurricane blowing through making the whole room cold. The windows were glass shutters with a quarter of an inch gap in between each one of the panes. According to the reception staff all the Queen rooms were the same!!! After having spent a night in the room we asked to move as we couldnt cope with the cold.One particular reception staff was quite rude and abrupt whenever we complained about the room. Once we moved to a twin room, a huge difference, the room was lovely and warm.Appart from the problems, the hotel was centrally located and there was a free breakfast every morning.I for one though, would not be returning to the Beresford.

Excellent Value for Money We stayed for 3 nights in early March 2008. On arrival we were given a free upgrade to a suite which included kitchen (with honesty drinks in the fridge), dining area, living room area, 2 double beds and jacuzzi bathroom. It was fantastic. The hotel is victorian but had character. It was very clean and all staff were helpful. We had not expected breakfast so the coffee, pastries and fruit were a great bonus if you wanted to get out quickly. The wine and cheese were also enjoyable if you got back in time. There were 2 computers to use with free internet access (though no printing). The location was excellent, very near Union Square. For the price we paid it was extremely good value for money.

Great location, shame about the hotel... I have just returned from a week's holiday staying at this hotel. The location is fantastic, only a few minutes walk from Union Square and the majority of the staff are friendly and helpful. However, the rooms seem to be in need of repair- we stayed in two during our stay and the first had a broken television and window that wouldn't open whist the second had broken furniture, electric sockets that sparked when in use and a blind that fell completely off the wall in the middle of the night. While the rooms seemed clean there was a terrible smell of rubbish on our floor of the hotel (clearly from bins that had been left in the corridor after being removed from the bathrooms). The Beresford is also unfortunate enough to employ a couple of staff members who are rude, surly and completely unhelpful and are a discredit to those employees who were polite and accommodating to guests. Luckily we did not stay in the hotel much as we were out exploring for the majority of our stay, only returning late at night. But if you plan to spend a bit more time in your hotel then personally I would look elsewhere for accommodation. We will not be making a repeat visit.

Great value and location for the money we stayed at the hotel beresford for two weeks and overall enjoyed our stay there. the location is great and the hotel is worth the money. the building is quite old as is the interior. but it is relatively cheap, you get a clean room, which is not noisy and in a great spot.breakfast comes on styropor plates and cups, comprises of cereal, danish pastries and fruit, and is presented in a very simple way.we had no tv and there was no wifi available, but there was a computer with internet connection available for free next to the reception. however, this single computer was occupied most of the time so that we decided to take our laptops into the sugar cafe a few doors up the road which is a great designer cafe for coffe, cake and free internet.

good value for the price We stayed at the Hotel Beresford for 4 nights at the beginning of October. We booked far in advance which is a good thing since it was Fleet week.The hotel is very conveniently located if you are a tourist (as we were). The cable car is a 3 minute walk away and there are also buses running right past the hotel. Union Square is a short walk away and Chinatown is also within walking distance. There are lots of places to eat nearby. The hotel itself is good value for money. We were actually amazed to find such a reasonable place so close to the centre of town.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was medium sized and the bed was comfortable. We overlooked the back, so it was fairly quiet. But don't expect a view! The bathroom was OK, the minibar well stocked and not expensive and there was plenty of wardrobe space.Breakfast was served in the restaurant on the ground floor. This was quite ample by American hotel standards. Cereals, fruit, pastries, coffee - as much as you could eat from a buffet.There was a pleasant friendly atmosphere in the breakfast room with tourists from many countries, mostly of the 40-60 age group. Only thing we didn't like was the plastic cutlery and plates! This is something Europeans really have a problem getting used to.All in all, we found the hotel good value for money and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a small friendly convenient place and doesn't expect luxury.
Ottima posizione   showReview(18710259, 'full');

Not Bad But I've Stayed in Better This is a nice looking hotel not far from the airport. We stayed here for three nights while attending a family wedding and to get some quality time together.Check-InWe arrived at 9:00 p.m. after taking the shuttle bus from the airport. Unfortunately, only one person was working the front desk and a line quickly formed as there were ten of us on the bus. The sole person working moved fast and before we knew it, we were next.Unfortunately, the room we reserved (four months in advance) was not available. We had asked for a king sized bed with a view of the bay but were told the only thing available with a king sized bed was overlooking the parking lot. I asked for them to make that up in terms of rate but was told this was not possible as we had pre-paid for the room. No effort to make up for their error was made. We were told that our requested room would be available on our last night but we rejected that offer. Who wants to pack up and move to a different room for one night?At least the check-in person was polite. I can鈥檛 say that for some of the other staff but more on them later.RoomVery nice and it must have been recently renovated. The rooms all feature a huge flat screen television. The bathroom was nice and large with plenty of room. There were no scratches or dings of any kind in the bathroom or in the room itself. The bed, as always at Sheraton, was wonderful.We got our non-promised view of the parking lot. There was a coffee maker but our sole attempt at making any revealed that it didn鈥檛 make that great coffee. Even using spring water didn鈥檛 help.Not much in the way of storage or drawer space here. I think that was probably because most people only stay here for a night so not much would be needed.Housekeeping was fine. Plenty of towels left and the room kept spotless.Food and DrinksBig issues here. On our first night, we arrived at 9:00 as I mentioned. The hotel website showed that food was available there until 11:00 p.m. We were counting on this due to the late arrival of our flight. We arrived at the dining room right after check-in and were greeted by a sign telling us it was closed and to proceed to the lounge.We arrived at the lounge, took a seat at the bar and started reading menus. It was then that the bartender informed us that kitchen was closed as of 10:00. I looked at my watch and it showed 9:30. I then told him that I thought they were open until 11.He rudely responded that it was too late to order anything as the kitchen staff leaves at 10 and that he knew nothing about any 11:00 closing. Disturbed, we walked out of the bar without paying for the two draft beers had had poured for us when we sat down!My guess is that was quiet with food orders so they decided to close down early. I could tell from the bartender's face that what I had told him was correct.We then asked a staff member in the lobby where to eat. This guy suggested a restaurant that we had to take a taxi to. We remembered passing other hotels on the bus that were not far away. We took a walk down to the Red Roof Inn (around a 15 minute walk) and found a really good 24 hour diner. We ended up having breakfast there two morning and it was just fine. That place is good for both breakfast and lunch or a non-formal dinner.There is also a chop and steak house on the bay right behind the hotel. In the darkness, we could not see it on our first night but saw it the next morning and ate there on our last night. It was very good and highly recommended. I still wonder why the staff member we approached made no mention of that place but I am sure it was not an accident.The menu revealed pricy items so it was just as well that we avoided it after our experience the first night. The good news is that the hotel will give you a cup of fresh coffee for free. They don鈥檛 advertise this so just ask for one at the hostess station and they will accommodate you. One morning, that had a station all set up.Leisure ActivitiesThere is a pool here but I didn鈥檛 use it nor did I see it. Right behind the hotel, there is a walkway right along the bay. This is great for a daytime walk but it closes after dark. It offers nice views of San Francisco.Airport ShuttlePretty good and runs every 20 minutes or so. The bus is clearly marked. Good thing too as our driver when we arrived spoke English with a very heavy Chinese accent making him very difficult to understand. They will handle your luggage for you and the drivers were pretty polite.Overall Not a bad choice for a night or two. The rooms are very comfortable. The problem with the hotel is that it鈥檚 isolated and there isn鈥檛 much around. I sure wouldn鈥檛 recommend this place if you were staying for a week but a short stay or overnight is fine.
Had a great stay Good hotel: Nice, big rooms; good service; well connected with airport shuttles.Furthermore, special rates seem often available.
Renovated       Planes getting ready to land

Loved the room but hates the Service We recently stayed at this beautiful hotel, the room is totally renovated and the toiletry they have are provided by Bliss (some good brand you could find in Sephora). The shuttle that transfer guests to and from the airport runs every 20 mins. and doesn't stop at other hotel which is good. However, they missed our morning call that we made request the time we check-in and they charge for internet usage.

Stay Somewhere Else As both a family and business traveler, we were very disappointed. In fact, so disappointed that we made a list of issues that we plan on including in a letter to corporate customer service:1) $10 a day to use internet in your room which didn't even work for 6 days of our 7 day stay.2) $18 a night parking. Ridiculous.3) Restaurant service was horrible. The servers had difficulty understanding English and we waited 10 minutes before we finally had to get up and find a server when the place was empty.4) Hotel staff (except for one nice younger lady), as another reviewer stated, were unmotivated and unfriendly.5) $15 a night for a mini-refrigerator. Ridiculous.6) The room was dirty. There was a dead fly on the windowsill and left over food on the carpet.7) Could hear everything the guest next door was doing in his room. Shower curtain, sink, toilet, coughing, sneezing, everything. Walls much too thin.Overall, this hotel was a thorough disappointment and we will stay somewhere else next time.

Good quality hotel - shame about the front desk staff We needed a cheap one-night stopover just outside San Francisco as we had to drop off a hire car early the next day and transfer to a hotel in the middle of SF for a longer stay.The Sheraton was showing the cheapest rate on expedia of all the big name airport hotels so this was perfect for us - we only paid around $100. The hotel has just been refurbished and is easy to find right off the 101. Plenty of parking, although you do have to pay $18 a night but its the same with all the hotels in this area.The rooms themselves were lovely - huge beds with fresh, comfy linens and pillows. An enormous flat screen TV set in the wall, refurbished bathroom and nice toiletries from Bliss.So the rooms weren't the issue here...unfortunately it was the front desk staff. I checked in and with barely more than a glance I was handed my keys. The lady then went straight back to her computer. I paused, hoping she would then go on to tell me where the lifts were and the usual things they tell you about when you check into a hotel (like check out time, breakfast etc). But no, I was left looking a little uncomfortable wondering where to go.After a minute of me still standing there a bit awkwardly, she looked up and said 'what?' I said, which way do we need to go and she, still tapping on her computer and not looking at me, directed me to the lifts. I'm not very fussy and I've stayed in plenty of hotels but I found this whole episode so rude and unfortunately put me off the hotel. The housekeeping staff, by the way, were lovely and always said hello and were quick and efficient when I rung down for some extra milk. It strikes me that all the big chain hotels are trying to dumb down guest/staff contact - I didn't even need to check out as my bill had been slipped under my door and my credit card charged. I was only directed to the key drop bucket by the front door - so no thanks for staying, how was your stay or anything like that. On a brighter note, room service was quick and delicious - and a much better option than Kincaids and Sizzlers down the road.
Great Stay Nice Rooms, wonderful beds and linens, Well thought out Ammenities, like to 42 plasma TV and lots of plug in's for your accessories. A wireless hot spot, great view and walking paths.

Great Hotel The hotel has a very nice and elegant lobby. The rooms were very modern and comfortable ( 42 flat screen televison and plush comforters) with a great view ! The club lounge was very nice as well! The airport shuttle provided by the hotel was on time and reliable the staff was very accomadating and friendly. Actually the only small complaint we had was the vending machines on the floor as they were not working. There was also a trolly that came by the hotel and took you down town Burlingame which was nice. I would highly reccomend satying at this hotel!!!!

Park in the back We got a good price through Priceline.com. It was in the 80 dollar range but you have to book 3+ weeks in advance to get it. Parking is expensive, 18.00 per night! If you park across the street it is 9.00 per day but no in and out privileges without paying each time. Now if you park in the rear of the building then you can park for free, at least I did during my stay. I was there on a Friday and Saturday night. It may be different during the week. Thanks Jorge (night desk) for that bit of info.

too expensive for what it gives It's not really bad, but does not give value for money. When arriving at SFO airport, I called the shuttle line and was told that it would take about 10-12 minutes. I have seen all other hotel shuttles twice, before the Sheraton one arrived. The staff is friendly enough. I had diner there too, which was quite good, but the temperature in the restaurant was rediculously hot.

More like 2.5 star hotel This place does not deserve the 4-stars; I've stayed in nicer 3-star places in Palo Alto and Los Angeles. While I liked the bed, comforter and pillows and the large flat-screen lcd tv in the rooms; everything else was just not-so-great. The door to our particular room got stuck, so you had to shove your body on it to close it. You had to pay for parking in their lot. You had to pay for internet in your room (although there was free wireless internet in the lobby of all places). Minus one nicer Asian gentleman, the staff at the desk were all unfriendly or unmotivated or both. There was no fridge in the room and the shower pressure was pretty terrible. I paid around $80/night for this hotel on Priceline, which is relatively cheap so far as hotels near San Francisco go, but I still feel like I overpaid.

Comfortable airport hotel Close to the airport, and if you get the right room, beautiful views over the bay. Enough double glazing to keep out aircraft noise. Rooms are comfortable with all the stuff you need; i stayed in a preferred room which had a 42 inch plasma TV, which was very nice! On the plus side, comfortable rooms, all the standard business facilities, good size bar/restaurant. Close to the airport, and close to Interstate 101, so handy for most places in the Valley.On the down side, the fitness centre is pretty small, and so is the pool. The aircon system in the room was very noisy; not sure if this is deliberate to drown out the planes!One big negative - if you have a car, it's 18 dollars for overnight parking. Considering the cost of the hotel, that seems a bit steep.Overall, not the best in the area, but not the worst by a long way!

It's just an airport hotel I have mixed feelings about this place. After staying here many times, sometimes I like it, sometimes I don't.LOCATION-Nothing special! It's at the end of a street with really nothing around. There is one higher-end restaurant next door and a diner maybe 1/2 mile walk. You are pretty much stuck at the hotel. However, it is right on the water and there is a nice bike/jogging path that runs toward the airport.PROPERTY-Yes, this hotel was recently renovated. The lobby (esp. the front desk) is impressive and unique. It's sort of W-ish. The pool isn't so hot...only indoor on the 2nd floor. No outdoor patio area or anything.ROOMS-The rooms are definetly renovated and very, very nice. Very modern with flat-screen tvs, high-end bedding and a very nice desk. My bathroom had a drain that would not stay open. So most of the time I was standing in 2 feet of water. Annoying. Very, very, very nice Bliss toilitries that I really liked.SERVICE-They renovated the property, but not the staff! They aren't rude, just standard issue blah-ness. Their attitude doesn't match the beautifued property. No enthusiasm whatsoever.This place is fine, but I'd probably check out the Westin, Marriott, or Hyatt if you need an airport hotel. If you get a good deal and don't expect much in service, you'll be happy here.

Excellent I booked a last minute one night stay on my day of arrival in order to catch an early morning flight the next day. When I arrived, a king size bed was not available and I was upgraded to the hotel's club floor. The room was recently renovated and extremely clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing accomandations near the San Francisco airport.

Great pillows! The Sheraton Gateway at SFO was a very comfortable place to stay for one night. The beds and especially the pillows were exceedingly comfy. Rooms were spacious, attractive, and very clean. We also had a beautiful view of South Bay out our window. Since we stayed here for only one night before an early flight, we did not get to experience the restaurant. Otherwise, everything was very good...service, staff, and facilities.
Just Renovated Brand New equipment. Huge Flat screen with plugs for the laptop.very spacious room with good sound insulation.

Perfection! I can't say enough good things about this hotel! From the airport shuttle that seemed to always be waiting at the door to the super comfortable bed, the large HDTV, the elegant and inviting euro-style public areas and the cordial/responsive restaurant staff I could find absolutely no flaws in my recent 4-day stay here.I'll definitely return.

Great Stay The hotel was very accomodating. They allowed us to check in early. When we arrived, we weren't disapointed. The place is exactly what it looks like from the pictures they show on their website. The beds were a bit soft, but comfortable. And the remodeling seems to have been finished, bec. we didn't hear any noise, as I had read from other travelers. The pool was disapointing-- cold and dirty.. but that's ok. it made up for the jacuzi and their gym. The customer service is also excellent. Staff were warm and friendly. They really try to make your stay as comfortable. Loved the Flat screen TV and the HD on some of the channels were excellent. Bathroom was also spacious and very modern. We really enjoyed our stay.

Stay away....Poor Service and a worse GM Please look elsewhere for a good night stay. Where do I start..A 45 min wait for a hotel shuttle that never came, a missing package that was never sent, a GM who refused to address or acknowledge any issues or give a Platinum member a call back after numerous call..The hotels resolution was...1,000 starwood points and they paid for my cab to the hotel. Nothing to address the issue or the hour and half wait at the airport and cab ride. Keep them...Learn how to treat your guest. There are many quality options in the area.

if you have an early morning SFO flight, stay here My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton by SFO because we had to catch a very early morning flight, and were very impressed by this hotel. You would have never known it was an airport hotel.We booked the hotel through Hotwire for something like $90.Stayed in the Starwood Preferred Guest floor rooms... The rooms were fantastic, newly renovated and included a big flat screen tv. Big sized with several amenities including a TV channel with all the flight information.The hotel is about a 10 min ride to the terminals... free shuttle available even at 4 am!If you've got an early morning flight in SFO, highly recommend staying here.Only negatives - $5 parking  the dizzying wall behind the front desk.

Beautiful We stayed here just the night before our flight left SF. It was a beautiful place and my only regret is that we got there late and left early. The room was gorgeous - very modern styling, flat screen tv, wonderful amenities. Our room was quite and clean and comfortable. I'm sure there is cheaper near the airport but maybe not as lovely.

Very Nice Bed, Clean and Close to Expressway We had a really nice stay with a beautiful view of the city/water from our room. The bed was firm, sheets were nice and soft and pillows were soft but firm enough. Bathroom was clean and the complimentary toiletries are good quality. Hairdryer is a regular, 1875-watt and dries hair faster/better than the usual small, wall-mount hotel ones.Starbuck's coffee in room with a very nice desk/sitting area for working and really bright, cheerful with light let in by the large windows.Has a flat screen TV and is centrally located to highways and airport. Complimentary airport shuttle.I had a problem with the room service staff bringing my coffee at the wrong time and then the room service manager did not not want to bring me a fresh pot-- she quibbled with me over the course of 4 different phone calls, all over a $6 pot of coffee.The front desk person during the day was very lackadaisical and did not send up a staff person to clean my room when I asked her to, when I left for the day. I used the room to work and even though I hung a sign on the door, housekeeping staff knocked repeatedly and called the room to see if I was gone yet. So, my room was never cleaned and they said it was my fault because I was in the room during the day. I left around 3-4 in the afternoon, and I assume there was at least *one* housecleaning staff who could have made up the room and emptied the trash.
Superb Sheraton near San Francisco       Bed  View

Unexpected WOW I booked this hotel for one night since I had an early flight out of SFO the next morning. When I arrived at the hotel it was 10:00 PM and I couldn't see much of the outside although it is located right on the water. I first noticed that the hotel is finishing its makeover so the lobby is a bit hidden.Upon checking in, I was given a preferred room on the 11th Floor. I will tell you that this room is one of the nicest I have EVER stayed in due to a recent renovation. It had a very large flatscreen TV with HD. The amenities and furniture were very modern and comfortable (including Sheraton's new Bliss line of bathroom amenities). They even had installed a complete technology box with multiple plugs for computers and a number of other gadgets. Although I didn't get to enjoy it, I will absolutely stay here the next time I need an airport hotel in San Fran.The most important thing to know about this hotel is that they run a complimentary shuttle to the airport 24 hours. Before 5 AM, they run every 30 minutes. After 5 AM, they run every 20 minutes.I can't tell you what the standard rooms look like, but the higher floors were incredible.

Renovation noise and a staff of liars After arriving close to 1am, the construction noise began before 8am. It was so loud that it sounded as though it was next door. I called the front desk and they said they would check on it and call me back. They never did. So, I called again and I was told that a disclaimer about noise was clearly visible on my hotel confirmation. It was not. I asked why I was not put on a lower floor, away from the noise, or even been given that option, and they said no rooms were available. LIE! The hotel was virtually empty as evidenced by the lobby, and the nearly empty parking lot. The restaurant had 2 people in it at 8:45 am. Instead of offering some sort of compensation, they offered repeated lies and extremely condescending and insincere apologies. They gave me a free continental breakfast. I honestly have had much better breakfasts at the Comfort Inn. Everyone was so unprofessional and disinterested in the guests, especially for a hotel that is supposed to be of a relatively high caliber. I think I'll chose JW Marriott next time.

Best hotel bed I've ever slept on I decided to go to California to drive down the coast, but my flight from MSP didn't arrive till late in the night. I decided to find a hotel near the airport to get some sleep before hitting the road the next day. Found this place with a good price and location. Took the airport shuttle back to the hotel and checked-in. The lobby was nice, and front staff helpful. My room was nice and clean, with a view of the bay. I had a queen size bed and it was by far the most comfortable bed I've slept on. The sheets were soft, and the duvet plush, unlike most hotels which feel like sandpaper. After a good nights sleep, check-out was quick and the airport shuttle took me back to the airport so I could get my car rental. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again.
Nice airport hotel, wished the Club Lounge had more to offer       Morning View from the Club Lounge

Don't do it! Super small rooms. Nothing fancy. Noisy all night (Gunshots, Sirens, Garbage Trucks). Did not like constant smell of fried food from the liquor store next door that sells fried chicken. Breakfast was cereal, toast, coffee, etc. Would not stay here again.

Would definitly stay here again. Great location. My husband and I travel frequently for pleasure and do not like having to pay more than about $150 a night. This place was a great bargain and if you check out their rates even without going 'Hotwire', they have some very fair prices. We stayed two years ago at a hotel nearby, it was $115 then, and that same hotel is now over $300 per night! Hotel Bijou was nicer, rooms were plenty big, extra pillows (sheets a little starchy, but clean and new), adequate closet space , extra pillows, and nice clean compact bathroom with quality toiletries and a great pleasant housekeeper to boot. Very accomodating - put us in a quiter room near the center of the building, when I asked for a room away from noise. (You don't want to be near the elevator by the way, it sounds way too noisy). Yes, of course there is street noise, sirens etc. this IS a major city after all and the up-side is that you are close to all the great restaurants, pubs, entertainments and transit to all over San Fran, including BART to the airport. The only suggestions I would make would be to add some fruit to the otherwise adequate breakfast and/or maybe some yoghurt. But it's FREE, and for those who just want juice, muffin, O.J and some flakes or instant oatmeal it's more than enough to hold you until lunchtime. Also, an extra shelf in the bathroom for personal stuff would be nice. We didn't need air conditioning because of the time of year, so outside noise was not much of a factor, besides they supply ear plugs. And yes like several other people suggested, stay away from the side street- the Eddy Street liquor store has some real chatty characters hanging around most of the day and evening, but they seem only interested in talking to each other....we never had a problem, as we always walked on Mason St towards Union Square and avoided that corner and that street in particular. Again, it's a major city and has it's fair share of street people and pan handlers like most others. Don't let it get in your way of having a great time, this is a wonderful city with lots of fun activities. If you like fun pubs, don't miss the piano bar at Lefty O'Douls just a short walk away. Lots of tourists but great fun.

Great Hotel I had read a lot of reviews about this hotel before booking it and I have to say I don't know what a lot of them were on about. We stayed here for two weeks: it was in a great location, very near union square, breakfasts were great and it was extremley clean.It is on the corner of tenderloin but we never had any problems, we always walked towards union square and we heard no noise in our room at night.It is very close to some great places to eat and the cable car stop which takes you all the way up to Fishermans wharf.The only downside is the price of the phone calles from the hotel. Our final phone bill was $350 and we only made about 8 phone calls. The internet cars are $10 for an hour but there is an internet cafe straight across the street which is $3.50 for 30 mins so is a lot cheaper.I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone wanting to explore the city!!

Great but expensive stay We stayed at hotel Bijou for three nights when we first arrived in het USA. To our surprise the hotel was, although very centrally located, easy to find by car from the airport. There is no parking place at the hotel it self so you can choose from valet parking to other local parking places. Either way it costs al lot of money (expect 24-29 USD per 24 hours). That was the only downside.The hotel is very centrally located and a perfect start to explore San Francisco. The rooms are small but clean. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. We left very early ( 06:00 am)at the last day and we could make our own breakfast to take with us. Breakfast is good but simple.If you're looking for an average but very central accomodation don't hesitate.

Street Noise Very close to Union Square and start of the cable car line, good central location. The cinema theme is a great idea with San Francisco made films showing in their own cinema e.g. Dirty Harry, View to a Kill, although the jet lag meant we couldn't take full advantage. However, there were a significant number of loud street dwellers gathered outside the local liquor stores which meant almost contant noise apart from a short break around 4 - 5 a.m. There was no air conditioning and the windows needed to be permanently closed.To be honest, I expected more for the price we paid.

Recommended This is a great choice if you need a cheap, central place to sleep. Very friendly staff and easy to get to. It is 3 minutes from the main shopping district and within walking distance of lots of restaurants and bars. Breakfast is very basic, but there are some great diners very nearby, if you need some eggs or pancakes! My main negative comment would be the lack of air conditioning, as our room was very stuffy. Also, avoid the rooms overlooking Eddy St, as it's pretty noisy at night. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a cheap base for a great city.

All you need for a short stay city break Was pleasantly suprised with Hotel Bijou. It's in a good location, right in the centre of the shopping area and has a Metro stop within walking distance, which was handy as we caught the train from the airport.Breakfast was basic, but if cereal and toast are enough for you, you'll be fine hereI stayed in a double room which was large and well cleaned every day. Bathroom had a bath/shower combination. A few toiletries were provided. Hairdryer was sufficient enough.Internet access in reception. It cost $10 for an hour's use, which you don't have to use up all in one session.Helpful reception staffDeli's/ convienience shops close by.No in room safe or mini bar/fridge in room, which we could of done with. But you do get a complimentary bottle of water.Plenty of space to hang up or put away your clothes. Clothes hangers provided.The hotel shows films free in their petite cinema every eveningI didn't notice any noise from the street as my room wasn't on that side of the hotel. For a low cost hotel in a good location, Hotel Bijou catered for all we needed.
great hotel great low budget hotel in the center of the city, some street noice but that's what you get in the center.Nice and helpfull staff, great continental breakf, nice rooms en bathroom.

Horrible experience! Terrible customer service, terrible billing, they lost my reservations and even when I provided a copy of their email with my reservation number, they still could not locate the reservation in the system. Consequently, the billing was totally messed up and they took no responsibility in it. On top of that, the hotel is dirty, loud and hot.

Not a bad hotel but not the best We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights, which is probably enough. Yes, it is close to some of the dodgier areas but it is also close to Union Square and other, more accessible areas (you could tell where you should and should not go). We did have some problems: on our arrival at the hotel we were told that they did not have our booking鈥?Fortunately it was soon discovered but we were told that (despite it being 2.45 pm, with check-in at 3.00 pm) the room was not ready and asked to come back in an hour. After a 10 and a half transatlantic flight this is not really what one wants to hear. We returned after an hour and the room was still not ready. They did (eventually) assign us a room (directly next to the elevator shaft). Yes, there was some noise from the street (it being a busy city I expected it) but there was a construction site next door that started work early. It was clean and good as a base to explore the city.

Beware of noise and bad neighborhood. This hotel is located close to Union Square, but also to a neighborhood that isn't very nice for tourists at all.The rooms are small, but okay if you'll only have to stay here for some days. There are no A/C in the rooms, which can be quite annoying since the hotel is heated constantly. The frontdesk staff is really helpfull and gives you good advises for nearly everything in and out of San Francisco.Be aware of the noise in the nighttime, since you have to sleep with the windows open. Dont know if we were unlucky, but we slept in two different rooms, one with windows to the street and the other with windows to the backyard, and both rooms where so noisy that we had to use the ear plugs that the hotel gives to you.The breakfast was nothing special, but it was free.Only two stars from me because of the noise in the nightime, making us sleep some hours in daytime, cause else you wouldt get sleep at all.
Best hotel in San Francisco for tourists       doors

Good Bargain, I'd go again We visited San Fran at the end of March 2008 and booked a last minute hotel through Hotwire. I was somewhat concerned about the pick after I read the reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised.No the rooms don't have A/C, yes, even in March it got stuffy and we would open the window. I loved the charm of the fire escape from one of our windows (lots of bird poop though). We were in a corner room which I understand is larger, but probably also noisier - much more so with the windows open. We didn't use the earplugs once... the noise didn't bother me. The rooms were clean and very adequate. There was an incident one afternoon across the street, several police officers had detained a woman that kept yelling Where's my crack pipe!? It was more comical than anything. However that does lead me to the fact that it is in a semi-questionable area of town. But in a group I felt safe. There are homeless people in all areas of SF, it was no different here. The breakfast was meager and carb laden --but free!. The coffee was nasty. They did have hard boiled eggs. The movies at night were OK (VHS TV surrounded by curtains), we watched one for 15 minutes and then got bored, but the night guy was super nice and even popped us microwave popcorn for the movie. In fact I found all of the staff to be very pleasant. Maybe you get what you give?We had a great stay, I loved the location so close to the cable car line and great shopping. For the price, I'd definitely stay again.

Pretty Great Hotel! I stayed at this Hotel a while ago, but I never had the chance to review. The Hotel is located right in Union Square and about a 1 minute walk to the BART. The rooms are very clean and the decor is cool. Very old Hollywood glamour. I really enjoyed my stay there. The staff was friendly and helpful.The only downside is it's a block away from the Tenderloin district which is very sketchy, and can get a bit loud outside. But I'm a city girl, so I'm not too bothered by it. However it might really bother some. So you might want to book a room away from the street.

Disappointing Pretty much same review as Keduf. I had to drag the guy away from the TV to check us in, he wasn't happy about being disturbed. We had booked 2 double beds but got a room with 1 double bed and no light in the room. I went back and got another room that ended up being 2 single beds. We settled with that for 6 nights. The ear plugs they supply were essential. We had asked for a higher room or a quieter one but eventually thought ourselves lucky to get one with 2 beds. Very very noisy, there are fire, police, and ambulance sirens going all night.Hot water for tea also cold. It wasn't even a cheap hotel, our travel agent must have pocketed a lot compared to the price of it and what we paid. The only positives: it was clean and a good central location.

Book with caution I arrived in this hotel and was at first very happy that the hotel was situated in walking distance of Union Square and the shops.However when I arrived, the hotel was busy and disorganised and we waited a long time to checked in. All the patrons were getting angry because the hotel was over booked and they kept transferring patrons to this other hotel.The hotel overall was ok. The rooms are tiny and the facilities are average. From all the hotels that i have stayed in, I thought this hotel was out dated.The beds were so uncomfortable and not sturdy. The rooms were stuffySome sheets had holes in them!The rooms were also so noisy. The first room we got placed in was horrible. Word of warning do not get a room that faces Eddy Street. Try to get a room facing Mason Street.Our first room was on this street on the 3rd floor and all night to morning we heard loud music, drunks, gunshots, etc. It was horrible! We couldn't sleep. I was told by some locals that Eddy St is part of the dodgy part of town called Tenderloin (however spelt). I would recommend you stay away from this area.After complaints, a staff member Letica was very helpful and moved us to the 6th floor to room 600, which was less noisy and slightly bigger. However it was still noisy!The continental breakfast was boring.. only bagels and hard boiled eggs etc.. nothing great.Overall I would not partically recommend staying at this hotel. The service is not up to proper standard and the rooms itself are average.. The only thing going for it is the fact that it is close to shops..

A jewel of a find This was a last minute idea to stay in San Francisco on a holiday weekend (Memorial Day), searching for a good priced hotel near Union Square the night before we wanted to go. We got lucky with Hotel Bijou and a AAA rate of $117 for a Saturday night. I read the reviews and felt ok about booking it. We were not disappointed! The hotel is very clean and looks like the rooms were painted and updated not too long ago. The bathrooms are very clean and sparkling. The front desk people were very helpful and friendly. We were so close to Union Square, right behind the Hilton, but it's not as noisy as if you are right on Post. We did not hear any street noise from our room (212). They do provide ear plugs if you need them. The room, at first, felt small but really was not. The bed is right there when you open the door but there is plenty of room to move around and get ready. There is a closet inside the bathroom area. The bed was a bit hard for my boyfriend but good for me, I prefer a bit harder bed.The location is very good, just a block up and a block over to the main shopping and Union Square. It's very easy to get a cab from this location. We did drive up and had the car parked with the hotel at an adjacent parking garage (they provide valet for you) and you can leave your car until 6pm the day you check out so you can leave your bags with the hotel and go play in the City and pick your car up by 6 to drive home.I would definitely recommend this to friends and would stay here again.

Very disappointing but hey, you get complimentary earplugs!!!
