Tres bien situe   showReview(19298579, 'full');
Parfait pour une famille   showReview(14172216, 'full');

Okay for the price I found this motel via the internet-it was our third trip to SF and we decided to try something different than our first stay, which was in the financial district (second visit was a one day trip). The website was very well written and the photos were very enchanting. We were a bit disappointed upon our arrival. Not having much knowledge of the area, we did not realize the motel is right on a main thoroughfare; very busy with traffic. The pictures on the website and the customer reviews create this image of a motel nestled in a quiet corner of the Marina district, but this is not true. The room was quite small but okay for the two of us. We were right next to a room which allowed pets and the walls were very thin, so we heard the dogs barking for 5 hours straight one night because they left them unattended in their room. We almost called management but it was our last night, so we didn't make a big deal about it. Also, we could hear the neighbors coming in and out each and every time. The room was clean but they had a very old style heater in the room and it only heated the top half of the room. So, when we were on the bed watching tv, we would be cold but when we stood up, it would be toasty warm. It was okay for the duration of our visit and for the price, well, we got what we paid for, in our opinion. The website and the pictures are in a way, deceiving because there are no cobblestones in the courtyard and it wasn't really a quiet stay. I think if they included a picture of their neon lit sign, which is conveniently left out of the pictures on the website, people wouldn't be so quick to fall in love with the place; sight unseen.

Quaint and charming I reserved 3 rooms in this sweet little motel on Lombard Street for my family. Each room was clean, no smells, and well equipped with the usual necessities. My room faced the street and was indeed noisy and shook with the big trucks but this did not bother me at all. It was just part of the city. The other rooms were interior courtyard rooms and were very quiet. There are window boxes full of colorful flowers and there is a little interior hallway  The staff was very friendly and helpful both in booking months ahead and while we were there. Talk to them about the room noise if that is a problem for anyone in your party.  This motel is in the Marina district which proved to be perfect. It is only a short walk to all kinds of restaurants and shopping. We also walked down to the Chrissy Fields Beach one morning. We easily caught the bus to go down to the wharf and another day up to Golden Gate Park. Easy to go anywhere on the buses and trolleys from this motel. There is free, free, free covered parking as a big bonus and the room rates was exceptionally low.

Great Location for a Quaint Hotel The last few reviews are fairly accurate. We had a Lombard-side room which was fairly noisy. Lombard is a major throroughfare, so there is traffic at most hours of the night, with just a small decrease in the wee hours. Had we know, I certainly would have requested an inner courtyard or east side room. Also, the DVD player on our TV had tape over it, which seemed a bit tacky.That said, it is a sweet place in a great location. The room was comfortable and well-maintained. The same family has owned/managed the hotel since it was build in 1939, which says a lot. You can see they put some care into the maintenance (they were painting garden scenes on the walls during our stay). There's lots of stuff within walking distance (Presidio, Chestnut St., etc.) or bus line (Alcatraz trip, Embarcadero). And the price is quite reasonable for SF. We would definitely stay again assuming we could move the room.

Courtyard Room a Must The Marina Motel has a great location and is within walking distance of some great restaurants, shops, cinema. 10 minutes by bus to Fisherman's Wharf, free parking..... all as per the Motel spiel.However, unless you are used to traffic noise, I implore you to book a room off Lombard Street in the courtyard. We took sleeping pills to help us get an hour or two of rest, but still found it difficult. We tried to change our room, but the Motel was fully booked, so we decided it was easier to stay for our remaining three nights than to pack up and try again. It did mean we spent every waking moment away from our room. We crammed a lot into our 5 days in San Francisco!!

Good value-not perfect My mom and I stayed at the Marina Motel recently. I brought my small dog along too and we stayed for 3 nights. Overall, this was a good place to stay, despite a few flaws. It seems there are trade-offs with every place, so this was no exception. The Chestnut St. neighborhood has a lot of good restaurants and shops (including a couple of pet-related shops and Peets Coffee), and we liked the proximity to the Palace of FIne Arts, Crissy Field and the Presidio. It's close to the Golden Gate Bridge. The motel is also within walking distance to a neighborhood called Cow Hollow. So, the location is one of the best things about the motel. We liked the fact that we could park underneath our unit (most of the time), and the motel setting is very pretty with lots of bouganvillia, fuschia, etc. Cheerful. A real plus is that they allow pets and don't charge you an arm and a leg to stay there. The rooms weren't perfect - the windows had a mind of their own and the radiator was unpredictable and noisy. The door could use weather stripping. It was really nice that there were windows on both sides of the room. The beds were okay - we had 2 full size beds and one of them seemed newer because it was quite a bit firmer than the other one. The room was pretty clean and the staff friendly. One corner of the carpet smelled a bit like pet urine. The bathroom had a window which was nice and the shower was roomy and everything worked well. You aren't supposed to leave your pet in the room alone, which we obeyed, but our neighbors left their dog in their room alone and it barked often. The TV was a modern flat screen. Would I recommend this place? Yes, definitely, despite a few minor flaws.

Not the Ritz, but a decent place to stay We found the place thru Frommers and it has already been mentioned that this place is not the Ritz. We got a family room. Which is 2 rooms and a bathroom. The front room is facing Lombard, so it is very loud, but our kids sleep like bricks, so they were fine. The back room was alittle quieter, so that worked better for us. If noise is a problem for you, I would not recommend the rooms that are up along Lombard. Ask for the rooms on the back side of the motel. But this worked fine for us and the fridge and microwave were useful.The rooms were both very dated and tiny. There is barely a foot of walking room around the beds. The bathroom is actually spacious in comparison even though very dated.The rooms are kept clean and the maid was always done with the rooms before we came back around lunchtime. There are so many great places to eat on Chestnut street, this was a great location. Alot of sights are within walking distance if you don't mind hiking it. But there are bus stops all over the place and you can get anywhere if you hop on the right bus. It did take a bit to figure out the right bus though, so I suggest you look at the routes online before your trip, or use their free wi-fi when you get to the motel. Or I imagine you can pick up a bus schedule somewhere. Bus 39 on Chestnut went everywhere though: Fisherman's wharf, Little Italy, China Town, Financial district. Or ask for a transfer when you board the bus. Also, the bus drivers were all very friendly if you need help.Overall, the price was nice compared to other places in the area and the free parking would make it a steal if you have a car (we just walked everywhere though).Take advantage of the BOGO breakfast coupon from the lobby. The prices were high, but if you're buying just 2 dishes, then the free one makes up for the overpriced first dish. But be ready, everything in San Fran is expensive, so this is not a bad deal at all. Also, check the times on the coupon before you go. I think Sundays had a time restriction.

Sleep tight...but be careful in room 28 We are frequent travelers who look for the best value for the money- the Marina Motel seemed to fit all of our requirements- reasonable price, good location, parking included, kitchenette, free wi-fi. With three people in the party we tried to book a room with two double beds, but they were already booked, so we had a double with a rollaway cot- ROOM 28. It was a very small room, but adequate and on the inner courtyard to reduce the noise from Lombard Street. The location is around the corner from Chestnut Street which has good restaurants, a market for groceries, and a stop for the bus to go downtown. All in all we liked it except:After a couple of days, we discovered some strange bugs on the walls and bed-we did an internet search and also took a couple of them to Heidi, the manager, who confirmed that they were indeed bedbugs. She was very proactive and called Terminex immediately, but they could not come until the next day- in the interim the staff vacuumed and cleaned the room thoroughly. Being a summer weekend in San Francisco, with most hotels filled, we did not have many options other than giving them a chance to try to eliminate the problem. However, when we returned to the room after Terminex had been there and steam cleaned, there were still bugs in the room, and the rollaway was too wet to sleep on, either from the steam cleaning or something being spilled on it. The night clerk was less than helpful, seemed to be a surfer dude/space cadet- he did not want to contact Heidi and told us we could bite the bullet and stay, or find another hotel ( not easy at midnite on Saturday). He did make a few calls to hotels, then said he couldn't help us anymore because he had paperwork to do. When he was finally convinced to call Heidi, she was of course very upset that we still had a problem.  We were able to make reservations elsewhere for the remainder of our stay, but one of our party came home covered with terrible bites, requiring a day off from work for a doctor's visit and steroid prescriptions to alleviate the inflamation and itching. Overall, there were a lot of things to recommend this motel, but under the circumstances it was a disastrous stay, and knowing what we do now, we would have moved out immediately upon finding the first evidence of bedbugs.  We know that this can happen at any hotel and we thought Heidi was very friendly, responsive, concerned and cooperative, but we heard from one desk clerk that this had been a problem in this room before- if that is true, they need to be more agressive in their monitoring of the rooms. Also, a certain desk clerk needs to be a little less laid back and more customer friendly.

Unique Personality You can see what we mean by unique personality from the photographs on the Marina Motel website, www.marinamotel.com. The Marina Motel is an excellent value in a good location for anyone who enjoys walking in San Francisco neighborhoods, such as the Marina, and along the edge of San Francisco Bay, which is just a few blocks north of the motel. There are many good restaurants, coffee shops, and other neighborhood commercial establishments nearby, especially along Chestnut Street behind the motel. Although the rooms are small by today's standards, keep in mind that the Marina Motel is a motel of the late 1930s in style and layout, which owners have taken care to respect while modernizing in other ways for visitor convenience and comfort. Although not within walking distance to SF downtown (Union Square area), it's easy to get there by public transportation or driving your own car. Likewise any other SF neighborhood of interest. Wherever you want to go, you can count on the people at the front desk to help you find your way. We look forward to our next visit.

Great Place What a great find, we had a nice room off to the side of the flower filled courtyard. They do a really nice job of keeping the place clean and comfortable.There are no frills in this charming place but they like dogs and the price is great, the location is also excellent and very safe.You can walk to the Presidio in about 5 mins and there is a small dog park just through the entrance. I would stay here again , choose a room thats not facing Lombard as I imagine they would be quite noisy.

A Great Bargain for San Francisco I have stayed at the Marina Motel many times. For one thing, parking is free in individual covered spaces. That's no small deal because a typical hotel will charge $20 - $30 per night for parking in San Francisco. If you are looking for a Holiday-Inn-style place this is probably not your motel. This is a 1930's vintage motel and that's part of its charm. All the bathrooms have been modernized, and the staff keeps the place very clean. If you can get one of the rooms with a kitchen, it will really help you keep your expenses down by eating a few meals in your room. There are a bunch of great restaurants at various price levels within walking distance of the motel. The staff at the motel are really friendly and extremely helpful. One caveat, I always request a room that is away from Lombard street because it is a heavily travelled street with a lot of noise.

Good value for your money This was the 4th time in about 6 years that I have stayed here. It is a room to sleep. It can be a place to call home for a few days if you wish to have the room with kitchen. They would then set you up with all cleaning items and utensils that you would have at home. I think it is a great place to stay. It is not the Hilton or the Fairmont, but then the price is not as well. It is so convenient for the Chestnut St. shops and restaurants and just a couple of blocks to all that Union St. has to offer. I know some other person had complaint with staff, but I have never found them to be less than helpful. I can't say enough about how pleasant my stays have been here.

Great value, great area in San Francisco I was a little skeptical about booking this motel after reading some of the reviews, but I'm very happy I chose this motel. My husband and I stayed here for two nights with our two small dogs. Although the room was small, it was clean and had an large dresser and plenty of closet space. The BEST thing about this hotel is the location. It's just a few blocks away from the Marina which me and my husband love, especially with our dogs (there are walking/running paths, a dog beach and spectacular views of the Golden Gate Bridge). The motel was also a block away from great restaurants and shops on Chesnut street where we could eat outside with our dogs. The free parking is also a major plus. I recommend this hotel if you don't want to spend a lot on a hotel, but want a great San Francsico experience.

Think again Hello, I wanted to express my dissatisfaction for our stay at your hotel over the weekend. We found that the lack of room service was horrible. I ordered the deli plate, since that was the only food besides cheese on your menu, the turkey was rotten. For $21.00, that is definitely something to talk about when recommending to friends. We also were surprised about the implied Valet charge. No where on the web site or when I spoke with someone at your hotel regarding the reservation did anyone tell me that there is a $26.00 Valet charge and it is mandatory. In addition to all of those items being below average quality, today when I checked my credit card, there is a pre-authorization for the wrong amount on my card. I have already called and spoke with John in the accounting department. He has been the most helpful and informative. He is going to take care of this for me. I will say that we were there due to a holiday party that we were invited to; I will make sure to tell the business that arranged it so that they never book with your hotel again. I would suggest expanding your room service menu, OFFERING Valet - not mandatory, and post a notice for the procedures for credit/debit card transactions in your lobby for your future guests. These are basic ways to increase your customer satisfaction.

IWe live in the Cayman Islands  We booked online having requested a list of 4* hotels in Beverly Hills or Santa Monica. We do not think it is 4*.On arrival we were a bit disapointed by the dirty carpets and the old, rather tired room, also by the lack of a restaurant. However, the staff were friendly and helpful and the location was good.I do not think we would stay again because the breakfast was poor and we would have really liked to have been able to have room service. Beds v comfortable.We did not hire a car because of the $26 per night parking charge but there were always taxi's available which were good, if slow ,due to demonstrations in progress!

Nice Hotel I stayed at The Tower for six nights in September 08. The staff were very friendly and helpful although as has already been said numerous times, the decor is a little bit dated. There is a supermarket across the road and restaurants in the local area. It's about a 20-30 minute walk to the Rodeo Drive shopping district but about $25-30 in a taxi to Hollywood.Overall, I've stay in far worse places than this so I would recommend it to those who want to stay in the Beverly Hills area.

The pretty hotel time forgot This is like the hotel time forgot. It is very pretty in a Beverly Hills way -- lots of pink and gold. The staff was great. But it feels like people used to stay here, and the hotel never modernized to this century. For example, you have to use valet parking, although there is plenty of parking. It is $26 a day plus tips. Our car was parked 10 feet from us and we had to have the valet move it to us.Also, there is no restaurant or room service. There isn't even a soda machine, so you have to go to the bar and pay $3 plus tip for a soda.The movies on tv are expensive and you cannot pause them. Everything is antiquated, but looks nice.

pleasant stay at the tower beverly hills stayed in the tower beverly hills for two nights as we found a very competitive rate on the internet for this 4 star, very well located hotel. fortunately we were travelling with a car so we didn麓t have any issues with regards to public transportation. the hotel is slightly aged but this is hardly noticeable. its a clean and well kept hotel. the pool area is rather small though and the chairs  beds there clearly have seen better days. when we arrived at around 2pm they didnt have our room available but offered an upgrade for about 30$/ night. our friends ended up taking the upgrade but it seemed as if they got the same class of room as we did in the end.the hotel room we had was spacious with a kingsize bed, a small seating area and a nice balcony with a great view. the staff at the fornt desk was very friendly and accommodated all our needs. they recommended us a very nice bar in the area for example and helped us plan out tour around la. the bar staff was slightly rude though when we tried to order a drink slightly before their closing hour. they offer valet parking for about 26$ a night but it seems there is parking available just right around the corner, so that might be worth checking out. we didn麓t have breakfast in the hotel so i cant really say anything about that. they have a couple of pc麓s near the lobby which have access to the internet for free. overall a pleasant stay at the tower beveryl hills!

Not even close to 4 star. Good luck if you cab it! The Tower was supposed to be a 4 star hotel and had the price point that was in line with that rating. Unfortunately, it was not even close to a 4 star. The only 4 star amenity was the valet parking and doorman. I chose to take a cab to the hotel as I was there on business. My cab driver had never heard of this place and my colleagues who took separate cabs experience the same thing. Fortunately I had a map printed and could direct him to the hotel, eventually we discovered together this apartment style building in the midst of a residential area that was well removed from the rest of Beverly Hills. On another night, returning from LA my cab driver claimed to know where the hotel was, but we ended up circling the neighborhood for an extra 10 minutes well I tried to get him to the actual location.The room was quite large and had a nice balcony and a Tempra-pedic bed. However those were the only positive room features. The bedspread had many stains and the furniture was nicked and scraped all over. The bedding package was quite plain (about what you would expect from a 2.5 star hotel) and the bed was very low to the ground.This 4 star hotel's only restaurant was a sports bar with limited hours. A continental breakfast was available on the top floor and was overpriced at $18 for cereal, yogurt, and an egg dish. There was no service whatsoever other then to collect your money.If you are looking for a true 4 star Beverly Hills experience and amenities such as a real restaurant and/or room service I would select another location.

Shabby room I was very disappointed in the room at The Towers. It looked like it hadn't been refurbished in many years! The bedspread was spotted, the carpet was worn looking, the wallpaper didn't match the curtains and the carpet didn't match either the walls or curtains. I was told the hotel had been spruced up in the last few years, but you couldn't tell it by me!! The gym was a joke. It had 1 treadmill and 1 elliptical machine! It cost a lot of money to valet park the car every day with no street parking. So I had no choice! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Old but Good.. I booked this hotel by name your own price on priceline.com, at first I saw their website and was amazed and happy thinking it was a high end hotel.. Well then I started reading the reviews and they were not so great. Well here is my experience..1. parking is $26.00 a night-- valet only (which means you have to tip everytime they get your car)2. When we checked in, they offered to upgrade us for only $60.00 a night so we said no, so then the guy said how about for $30.00 a night so we still said NO.. then he said ok here are your keys and I went ahead and upgrade you guys anyways for FREE.3. We get to the room we got one in the 9th floor byt the cleaning closet and stairs (so we were like Ok.. ) We saw our balcony and it was huge. So it was ok.. 4. My first impression of the room was WOW.. this is an old decoration!! The carpet was stained in the room and the hallway. The bathroom was ok.. To sum it all up, the room was decent but nothing like a four star hotel. I would of wanted a more updated, cleaner place!

Ok Hotel When we first arrived, we were laughing at the Valet parking. We pulled in and gave them our keys and they pulled the car 2 feet away into a spot i could have pulled into myself (and charged me 26$ per day to do this). The staff was very friendly. We were not impressed with the hotel on a whole. I would rate it 2.5 stars. The rooms were outdated and the covers on the bed were not impressive. We did like the tempurpedic beds but thats about it. There really isnt too much around to walk to except the Ralph's grocery store. We did walk to the mall but it was about .8 miles away. All in all L.A. really didn't thrill us. It is too hyped up. We enjoyed San Diego better and should have stayed there. P.S. the smog and the air from all the fires gave me an upper respiratory infection to bring home.

My worst stay I booked and prepaid through Hotels.com a night at this Hotel. When we arrived at 1AM in the morning, the hotel was sold out and they had no room available. This is great after a 5 hour flight and 3 hour time shift. I know that this can happen. Some Guests did not check out. However, when we arrived, the receptionist STARTED to make calls to find a different room for us, although they had already known after check out that they were overbooked. She sent us to a messed up motel somewhere in LA. I paid $235 for this night. When I asked for a refund, Hotels.com contacted the hotel. They were not willing to refund any money, because they paid that night at the motel ($120). Good deal for them. After I complained and called 4 times, finally we got the money back.I was really frustrated how badly the Tower Beverly Hills handled this situation when we arrived and it was even worse when we tried to get the refund. I can not recommend to stay there, or try to stay there...

Front Desk Was Very Rude Front desk was very rude. Did not want to honor online below market rate that I booked room at. They had an attitude problem. Hotel is nothing special and parking is very expensive. Advice - stay elsewhere!!!!!!!!!

Wonderful Time- great staff My daughter and I had planned a special holiday to California to celebrate the end of my treatment for breast cancer and her finishing her undergraduate studies during a very trying time. During my treatment we spent a good deal of time watching T.V and decided we would both love to see California and stay in Beverly Hills. We were extremely happy with the Tower Beverly. the room with a view of Beverly Hills was lovely. We walked to Rodeo Drive every day, we had no problem being picked up and dropped off for daily tours. The staff were exceptional, the valet service was friendly, helpful and welcomed us with a smile every time we came back to the hotel. The hotel had no way of knowing how important this trip was to us and made us feel very special. My daughter and I enjoyed our stay so much we would recommend this hotel and look forward to returning to California and staying at the Tower Beverly.

Needs a serious facelift Parking is very very high, and there are no alternatives in the area. When you add it to the cost of the room, it is not be worth staying there, even at what I thought was a good room price.The only thing good about the hotel is the bed. It is very comfortable, everything else about it is cheap and old. On the site I reserved the room, it said 4 star. Not even close, it is 2.5 star tops. It is so dated. There are a lot of great, and yet affordable hotels in LA, and this is not one of them.

Good location but fading 4-star, staff with attitude Good location less than one mile from shops on Rodeo Drive.Room was nice size, clean and comfortable, but without the luxury feel. This used to be a Loews, but is no longer. Minus for charging for internet access in the room.Small pool area next to busy road. Bar was not much to write home about.Typical (but nonetheless unacceptable) Beverly Hills attitude of front desk staff: Tried to check in at 2:15pm, but told it was just not possible until official check-in time at 3:00pm. Also told at check-in that a room facing away from Pico Blvd (heavy traffic) would require a significant extra charge. Had not been informed of this anywhere.Bar was also closed at this time, so nowhere to wait. All in all, only worth it if you get a rate well below that on their own web site.

Lovely all around The Tower is a beautiful hotel near to Wilshire and Robertson Blvds and a quick walk to cafes (and Pinkberry!) on Beverly Dr. The location was easy to get to and from, the neighborhood very nice, the staff were so kind and the room was superb.A few disappointments were that the hotel has a bar but no real restaurant or room service and the valet-only parking rate seemed a bit high (but, I guess what do you expect in BH). In-room internet incurred a daily fee (a practice I find pretty offensive in this day and age) but the hotel provided two terminals in the lobby area, including a printer which gave free access to the web and free printing.Overall, I would highly recommend this for anyone who wants easy access (by car, of course, this is LA after all) and navigation to Beverly Hills, Hollywood, Downtown and Santa Monica.

We loved everything about our deluxe room except the beds! We stayed here from March 23-26. We were greeted warmly at the front desk and the concierge was very helpful. We were not impressed with the $30 a day parking or with the idea of paying $12 for a continental breakfast! Luckily the first night there we found a nice place to eat (Factor's Famous Deli), good prices, selection and good food.We loved everything about our deluxe room except the beds! I picked this hotel for it's location and Tempur-Pedic beds, as I've read good things about these beds. After 3 nights, me, my bf and our 7 yr old son all had extremely sore backs. As for the location, we paid 45 bucks to get back from the Whiskey a Go-Go on the Sunset Strip. It was also quite far from Universal Studios. Drug store and Ralph's across the street, coffee shop a block away.The rest of the room however was wonderful. Very clean, decent tub, Rush toiletries, beautiful view of Bevery Hills and the Hollywood sign, nice furnishings, and big balcony! We used the free internet in the lobby a few times, 20 minutes per person was more then enough to check email.

The Terrible Tower Our stay at the Tower began badly and ended worse! After confirming twice (and in writing) that my 18 year old could check in without me, the rude manager would not let him, even though the room was prepaid and my son had a credit card with his name on it and id. I had a written note from the front office saying that it would be fine. After an argument , she relented.Then the wake up call and LA tour that my kids booked through the concierge never materialized. My husband and I had a confirmed reservation to meet up with my kids but when we arrived at 3:30 am, the hotel said they did not have a room and sent us 2 blocks away to an inferior hotel. The front desk of the other hotel told us that the Tower overbooks on a regular basis.Finally, we have been trying to have some valuable items returned to us that my kids left and have made 4 phone calls to the hotel. We are told that they have the items and will send them but it has been almost 2 weeks and we have not received them. The rude manager has not returned my call. Would never go back!

Nice boutique hotel Small boutique hotel, recently renovated with fairly big rooms  nice decor. Clean! A good deal for $170 per night.No restaurant on premises. The bar next to the tiny pool serves bar food though. If you are starving, try the Fish Grill in the small shopping mall across the street for fish tacos. One block down the street is a Coffee Bean shop. You'll need a cab/car for Rodeo Drive etc. Valet parking is $26/day.

Disappointment How do I start? We stayed three nights at the hotel. When we arrived we were greeted at the front desk by a pretentious staff member who seemed extremely self absorbed. I did not have a good feeling from that moment on... When we got up to our room we were extremely disappointed. We had read the reviews on this site and I have picked many hotels based on it. This time I regretted it. The room was drab and almost dingy. It needed a serious facelift. The bed was hard and uncomfortable. We faced Pico Blvd and a strip mall. Considering this is an incredibly busy street we heard everything. Car horns, emergency vehicles, you name it. Another thing you should know before you book is the cost of parking. There is valet service only which costs $26 dollars a day!! It is not the money but the principle!!! I have been to Beverly Hills many times but this was the first and last time I will stay at this hotel.

Nice hotel, good location I booked this as part of a package with Expedia  got a cheap rate for our 4 night stay. I stayed here with my 2 teenage daughters who are celebrity  shopping obsessed  this proved a great base from which to indulge their obsessions being close to Rodeo Drive and a short drive or bus ride to Santa Monica in onde direction and Hollywood in the other. We didn't eat in the hotel but there are various places to eat nearby. The room was nice  had a great view from the balcony. We were on the quiet side of the hotel (not facing Pico Blvd) and we were able to use wifi with my laptop in the room but there are also desktop computers in a room off the reception area which are free to use for guests. Being a caffeine addict I was glad that the hotel had a coffee maker with supplies of coffee, though there is a coffee shop just around the corner if you prefer a capuccino first thing in the morning. All in all we had a good experience at this hotel. The one downside is that parking cost $26 a night, but apart from that we really enjoyed our stay here.

Classy hotel in great location We spent two nights in this hotel as part of our honeymoon. We loved it! Huge room with enormous comfortable beds. We had a room with a balcony facing the HOLLYWOOD sign which was fabulous considering it was our first time in LA.We had a car and used the valet parking ($26/night) at the hotel. This is kind of non-optional as the hotel is in a residential area there is no on-street parking. We just paid it and enjoyed the service.Hotel is an easy drive to all the sights and shopping in Beverly Hills/Hollywood.Reception and concierge were super helpful and recommended some fabulous restaurant suggestions. We would definitely stay here again when we are in LA.

Loved it We stayed at The Tower for 5 nights. The best mattress, the best sleep I've ever had in a Hotel, despite being on the noisy side (Pico Avenue). Loved having a balcony and internet access in the room (for a fee of course) but well worth it. The pool is rather small but adequate, warm and clean. I would not recommend eating in the pub as the service is extremely slow. We ordered sandwiches and we waited 45 minutes for the food to get to our table. Room is good sized, nice bathroom, maid made sure we had new toiletries, coffee etc. every day. Staff all very friendly and helpful. We did not have a car, so relied on taxis, which I would not recommend as they are very expensive, instead use the limo service and make sure you ask for Vladimir - he is great. (not Boris). There are many restaurants nearby, a huge drugstore across the street where you can buy water, groceries etc. We would stay at this hotel again.

Not so great The staff was not very accomodating. After traveling across country (NJ) with a layover in between we were not permitted to check in when we arrived. It was only an1 hour and 30 min before designated check in time on a Thurs. afternoon! He was not very friendly or sympathetic and mentioned we could check-in now only if we upgraded (surprise, surprise). Also, overnight parking as a guest was $25 dollars per night! It seemed they charged you for everything that was advertised as complimentary (i.e. continental breakfast and internet in the room) The hotel was in a good location but I would search for another hotel before I returned to The Tower Beverly Hills.

Fun weekend at The Orlando! My friend comes into town from SF for work often and usually stays at The Orlando. On his last trip, I visited with him for the weekend and we played tourist, which was fun since the hotel is located right where everything is. We even walked across the street to a store to buy ice cream at midnight! The staff is so friendly and are always helpful. The valet guys were also helpful as we had two cars and were trying to figure out where to park the other one, etc. One day, I went to the pool area to sit outside and work on my laptop in the sun. Ahhhh..... just lovely! And, the beds are super comfortable too! I would highly recommend this property to anyone who needs to stay in LA but doesn't want to deal with a huge mega-property. It is so easy to get in/out of and I love that the whole building is wireless.

Cozy, comfortable, and cool area, I will be back. The Orlando was an awesome surprise. I was in town for a couple of nights on business last minute, and my travel agent got me an affordable room at the Orlando. My stay was extremely enjoyable, and the location, (in the 3rd and beverly area) was in walking distance to the bar I was meeting friends at, and on Sunday, close to the Fairfax flee market, which was also a great plus, as finding a place in walking distance to anything in LA, can be hard to come by.

Do not waste money on Orlando The Orlando turned out to be a great disappointment. The hotel does not have a sign, so it took several rounds of going around the block before finding it. The staff is extremely fake when pretending to be friendly and helpful. I had to give repeated instructions to the valet guy and the bellman about their own jobs. I would say the rooms are at most 2.5stars. The TV and the alarm clock did not work and when I called the staff about it expecting someone to come up and repair it, all I got was an insincere We're sorry, we don't have anyone available to fix them. I was shocked at the level of indifference and lack of professionalism. The breakfast was at best mediocre. We were told not so sit outside because it was going to be cleaned, which turned out to be a lie to cut down work for the staff. The only good feature of this hotel is its location. But there are several other hotels in the area with far better service.At first I thought this was general LA culture but after transferring to a different hotel, I realized that the horrible service was unique to the Orlando. Do not waste your money on this hotel.

Great place to stay, AWESOME location !! Really a great place to stay.I wouldn't call it a five star hotel,it has been updated, but they cut corners in some ways.Nothing major, they just could of done a better job,it looks like they used staff or a handyman to do lights, faucets, etc. Besides that, the place is great.Friendly staff, nice rooms, super beds.I have stayed there 2 times in total.I will continue to stay there.The price is right, the valet parking is nice,and the location is the BEST.You can walk to the Grove from there, and a ton of other stuff.Alot of cool stores, and great restaurants within walking distance.Very cool.

soft towels and delicious chocolates The title points out my favorite things about the Orlando but I enjoyed the entire experience. It is definitely a place for those looking for a small, homey experience. The staff was friendly and helpful and everything was extremely clean. There have been some comments about the dated bathrooms but ours seemed to be newly renovated so I would suggest asking for a room with a new bath. I would call the room decor Crate and Barrel, more contemporary than traditional.Loved the neighborhood! It was within walking distance of the Farmer's Market and the streets were filled with boutiques and many small, reasonably priced restaurants.I was pleasantly surprised that it had a (small) pool and fitness center, a free computer for use in the lobby and wireless access in the lounge.All in all, a good experience.

Great location but "interesting first experience I stayed at The Orlando this past weekend and echo most of the reviews that have been written -- great location, nice rooms (except bathrooms which need to be updated further) and good service. However...I was booked at the hotel last month and arrived late morning to drop off my bag then go about my day of business. When I arrived just after 9 following a business dinner and long day, I was told that because a couple of people didn't check out of the hotel, they didn't have a room for me.I was told that I had been booked in a Ramada 10 minutes away on Santa Monica Blvd. Hmmm. A Ramada on Santa Monica Blvd? This could be bad. Really bad. Turns out the room was fine and the hotel was on a decent part of SMB. Plus, The Orlando paid for the cab ride to the Ramada and paid for my room there. I've never had something like that happen to me in my career. However, it was disturbing that a man was checking into the hotel as they were wisking me out the door and into a cab. Why a room for him and not me when I was there first?Everyone deserves a second chance so I stayed there this weekend. Best part of the hotel is definitely the great proximity to shopping, both along Third Street and on Robertson.

Not what I expected I travel to LA for work once or twice a month and my usual hotel was booked so I had to find something new (not a bad thing as I like trying new hotels). I chose the Orlando as it was close to my meetings the next day and I like staying at small boutique hotels. The website is designed very well but unfortunately the hotel is not. This is essentially a refurbished hotel that is trying to be a boutique but I thought it was dark, shabby and uncomfortable. I was not expecting the Ritz Carlton but at $300 a night, a little more attention to detail and cleanliness would have been nice. The bed was uncomfortable, the bathroom was half-renovated and the entire place felt odd to me. However, I am giving it two stars as I am very picky and the front desk person when I checked in was nice...

Great Friendly hotel in perfect location I reported before that the vallet parking was $12 per night - just checked my records and its actually $26 per night! But other wise the hotel is great, a fantastic location and good value so don't let this put you off!

European Style in Beverly Hills So it was our son's 30th birthday last week and we were surprising him with a sumptuous surprise party. Therefore, we needed a place to stay out of his view. After much careful research only a marketing maven such as myself undergoes, I opted for the self-described small European style boutique Orlando Hotel. What a delightful gem in the middle of Beverly Hills!Arriving late into the evening, we drove up in our rental car to be greeted without any wait by friendly attendants. Upon entering, the lobby was awash in candlelight, as votives were lit on nearby tables. Check in was a breeze and before we knew it we were looking out over the surrounding area twinkling as only L.A. does.Service here, while California laid back, was excellent. We called down for extra sugar and creamer and it seemed he was waiting outside our door - it was so quick. In fact, our every request was met with courtesy and superb promptness. The room reminded me of the Swissotel in London. It was clean, modern, and with all the creature comforts including robes (heavy), slippers, in room coffee, hair dryers, and a very nice bathroom vanity which was supplied with Bulgari toiletries. The bed was plushly adorned and very comfortable and room service did a great job. In room TV is a wall mounted very large screen and local and national newspapers are available every morning. This place is intimate, modern, clean and delightful and worth every reasonable penny.Now for the best part - we booked our room at $299 a night for a king sized bed, which also included breakfast in thehotel restaurant downstairs. It's small and delicious with fresh fruits, eggs done-any-style and more. Parking was $26. Now even better - this was all in the heart of downtown Beverly Hills...so close you can walk to everything or take a very short drive to Melrose for even more fantabulous shopping which a good New York girl like me did!I highly recommend this jewel. At this price, with breakfast and reasonable parking rates, you are treated like a celebrity without the celebrity prices. Enjoy!

Do not miss the Orlando Just returned from 3 days at the Orlando with my teenage son and husband. This is a great hotel and a fabulous location. The room is large and very comfortable, the staff very helpful. (The valet managed to have our car ready for us in minutes each time we needed it.) The location is central for getting around LA, but the real highlight is that there are many fine restauarants and stores within walking distance. Our first day we dined at a Japanese place about 4 doors away that turned out to be one of the best meals of the trip. The nearby stores were some of the most interesting I've seen anywhere. I have stayed in Century City, Beverly Hills and Santa Monica in the past, but will return to the Orlando for my next trip.

Perfection at The Orlando Just spent 3 days there on business and was thrilled with my stay at The Orlando. I prefer smaller boutique hotels. The room was large, the bed comfortable and came with a complimentary full breakfast. Great and fast service in the restaurant, at the front desk and also the valet. The location was perfect -- lots in the neighbourhood within walking distance including excellent restaurants and shopping. The farmers market in The Grove was a nice find. The location was also central to my business calls within the entertainment business. I will absolutely stay there the next time I'm in LA and will recommend it wholeheartedly to my colleagues and friends.

Delightful Hotel Just spent 3 nights at this hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting lovely accommodations in an excellent location, 2 blocks from the Beverly Center surrounded by several great restaurants, including Ortolan (Michelin 1 star) , cafes and boutique shops. Our room was ready on arrival on the 5th floor, which overlooked the pool, was modern, spacious and very clean. All the conveniences were included such as plasma TV, mini-bar and comfortable bedding. We slept exceedingly well-no hotel noise or street noise. The bath is small but nicely furnished with Bulgari bath items. Valet service was excellent, quick and professional. We had breakfast in the restaurant, served buffet style, all the items offered, cereals, yogurt, breads/pasties, deli meats and cheese, eggs, etcs were fresh and service was good. We encountered no problems at all and recommend this hotel for its unpretentious flair, great value and location-amazing boutique hotel that will get my business again.

Great boutique hotel I loved this hotel so much and will definately return! The bed was so comfortable. The rooms were clean and the service was fantastic. The concierge was extremely helpful. We requested to dine at various hot restaurants and he took care of it all. The area of this hotel was great. I am so happy i chose this hotel for my first visit to LA.

Nice, small, clean and great location Nice, small boutique style hotel with a great location for Beverly Hills and City. Only 9 miles from LAX. Clean rooms and very helpful responsive staff. Restaurant was very good and excellent selection of other restaurants with easy walking distance.

Snazzy and Comfortable The Orlando has real style mixed with real comfort. The rooms are large and bright with windows that open. We have stayed in 2 rooms there and both had nice seating areas and great beds. On the 3rd Street side you can see the Hollywood sign but pay for that with a bit of noise. Bathrooms are motel quality except they have very nice products. It is located in a great area with lots of restaurants and shopping. Staff were very nice and helpful. As only in LA, we saw Peter Bogdanovich catch an elevator in the lobby.

Love this hotel!! My husband and I have stayed at The Orlando five times in the past two years as we go to Los Angeles often to visit ourchildren. We plan several trips this coming year.We love this hotel and really look forward to our stays there! The rooms are very roomy and comfortable and quiet-- beds are greatt!! In fact, after our last visit we returned home and bought a new mattress because theirs was so comforable. We asked what it was and looked for the same brand.The staff is outstanding!! Always friendly and ready to answer questions and help. And they always seem to remember us and welcome us with a smile.The location is terrific. Close to the Beverly Center and the Grove but on a quiet side street off Third Street. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. And great shopping too. We love the European buffet breakfast which is a realtreat and very unusual, and, again, the staff here is friendly and we enjoy visiting  with them.We have never used the pool but it is a nice extra. It's a quiet little oasis in the city.I travel often and wish other hotels would feel as comfortable and welcoming as The Orlando. We look forward to our visits there.

The best Hotel in Los Angeles, and that ain't no lie! The Orlando is one of the best hotel's I have ever stayed at and I am very picky coming from a hotel background myself. First of all I stay here for business every month and everytime I come back the front desk staff remembers me and has my keys waiting. The room product is very modern with chocolates hues and all the latest gadgets, including a flat plasma tv! The mini-bar is fully stocked with things I actually enjoy....try the Musha-nuts, you'll love 'em! Room service comes a from a restaurant in the hotel and it is outstanding. I crave the 7-oz rib eye everytime I stay and it id the first thing I order before even putting my bags down. I will not stay anywhere else when I come to LA, the Orlando is top notch! You will not be disappointed!

Absolutely adore this Boutique Hotel I have been meaning to write about the experience we had at the Orlando Hotel for our family and friends that we put up there for New Year's Eve. We have used this hotel always for friends and referred business associates as well. I absolutely adore this hotel. The rooms are spacious and charming, the staff is top notch and always delivers exceptional service with a smile. I know hotel prices in LA are climbing as they did in New York. A lot of people do not like that and dish the hotel in defiance. You get what you pay for and it's worth every penny at The Orlando and compared to other hotels in the area that offer less for more $$$ it's the best value. I know, because I shop around!
Buen Hotel y muy buena situaci贸n       Executive Garden Room
Petit hotel sympa tr猫s bien situ茅   showReview(21200451, 'full');

Not what it used to be I have been to the Grove Isle 3 or 4 times. It started out as a luxury hotel.I loved the rooms, the staff, and the overall ambience of the property.This year, as in past years , my husband took me there for 2 nights for my birthday. They seemed to have changed their clientele from couples to families.At the pool, there was children screaming and running(with no supervision at all).Even when we went to the small beach that says ADULTS ONLY!-THERE WERE KIDS.I did tell the staff about it, but they didnt seem concerned. I still love Baleen, that is still very good food, and a really great vibe.We were there when Miami Spice was available(where you can get a 3 course dinner for a fraction of the cost normally.I told people about it that we met at the bar,but when we were seated, I had to ask the waiter for that special menu, as did the out of state couple who we met.If the hotel has changed its atmosphere and the people they want to attract, they can't bill itself as a romantic getaway.Unless your idea of a romantic weekend is a pool full of kids.I couldnt even speak to my husband without yelling.I love my own kids, but sometimes when you want to get away from it all-there is a time and place.I do hope they go back to the hotel I once loved.I'm sure there are other hotels around that fit my bill

An oasis in Miami We love the Grove Isle Resort. Just returned from something like our 10th time. It's a great oasis from Miami traffic and has beautifully appointed rooms, excellent staff and service, and amazing food! We usually bring our kids, and although the hotel is a small, boutique style hotel and spa, it is perfectly accepting of children. It's so nice to be able to have luxurious accommodations and resort atmosphere, and have our children get to experience this as well. We will be back again and again!

great hotel / poor food. My wife and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary for 2 nights.The hotel itself is very nice, great balcony and view from our room. The rooms are nice but I would not rate them as 5 star. Possibly a 4 star at best. Mostly due to the bathroom which was tired and very simple. You would think there would be a jacuzzi or something special. It had one of those bath / shower combos that you would not expect in a 5 star hotel. It had a huge flat screen HD TV that had not been wired up for HD, so was terrible quality. It only had about 4 basic local channels anyway, that all seamed to be showing baseball all the time (Not good for a romantic getaway!). Even a Days-Inn has HBO. Everything else was pay per view, even the TV shows. Anyway, we didn't go there to watch TV, so not a big deal. The hotel location is really amazing with great views from everywhere. The pools, deck and bar area were very nice. It is part of a condo development so does have 3 or 4 large building behind the hotel but they don't seam to affect the view. I just thought I would mention that because the website gives the impression it is this little private hotel on an island.The staff were all exceptional. They were extremely friendly, professional and always knew my name. The Spa was fantastic. We had a couples massage that was worth every penny. I would definitely go back just for that. Now the bad news...The restaurant has to have one of the most romantic settings in Florida. Our table was on a wood deck, right on the bay. However they seam to have forgotten about the food. I made a point to call a week before our stay to say my wife was a vegetarian and was contacted back to confirm what she could eat. I was told that the chef would prepare something special. When I told our waiter, he said they have something amazing.WELL... she got a plate of veggies. 1/2 roasted 1/2 boiled. With no sauce or flavor of any type. Honestly, she could have got the same meal from Boston Market for about $4. The table next to us seamed to have some socialite, food critic or something because she had the attention of the chefs and food/Bav managers all night. At one point had 5 staff buzzing around her delivering little dishes of everything. They didn't seam to care too much about anyone else's food. Not wanting to complain and spoil our evening, I decided to just fill out the review card and leave. My fish was ok, but nothing special. Overall the dinner was very disappointing. I would not eat there again. Do yourself a favor and go eat at Nobu on South Beach instead. The next morning we ordered breakfast in bed. It took over an hour to come and was stone cold. We were too hungry to care (from the night before) so just ate it. One last complaint was the Coffee. The coffee in the room and the stuff we ordered with breakfast was truly disgusting. You would think that in a 5 star hotel, they would give you real milk/cream in your room, not that powdered creamer stuff. My overall opinion is that the hotel layout, location and staff are fantastic. However, the hotel is not what I expect a 5 star hotel to be. The food was very disappointingly.

Flawed Paradise Spacious rooms with great water views and comfortable beds are this hotel's strong point. The bathroom was on the small side with a cracked sink and faucets that were difficult to turn off and on. The room balcony had comfortable furniture but the noise from what I'm told was the air conditioning system made it unpleasant during the day--at night the system noise cut out. Speaking of noise, at 10:00 am Sunday morning, hotel maintenance decided to run some kind of equipment (possibly a leaf blower). Nobody who wanted to sleep in could do so without earplugs. Housekeeping showed up at a little after 3:00 pm--just when I returned to my room and was desperate for a shower.The pool deck had definitely seen better days but they had a nice adults only section with a view of Biscayne Bay. They also had circulating staff offering free ice water and frozen grapes--a nice touch. Hotel offers tennis and spa services which I didn't use but their fitness center was clean and well equipped.The island itself is rather nice with a walkway along the seawall which ends in a tiny beach. A young boy was fishing in front of the hotel restaurant and actually catching small snappers which he threw back.Reception staff was very nice and even let me stay in my room an hour past check out.

Overpriced, Understaffed, Well-seasoned travelers know that Miami is notorious for their poor levels of service so I'm not going to disparage Grove Isle in that regard. Its level of service is on par with what you'll get anywhere else in the area (from the Delano to the Loews to The Setai.)My only complaint is that the rooms are a terrible value. I stayed here for almost a week due to a friend's wedding. My rate for a room facing the bay with a balcony was almost $600/night. There is no beach at this resort. Housekeeping frequently didn't make up our room until dinnertime. The service at the restaurants was absurdly slow. The pool is decent but the seating gets filled up quickly. Spa treatment and tennis lessons booked in advance were cancelled by the resort without advance notice. They always seemed to have an excuse for everything. For the same price, I should have stayed at the Four Seasons or The Mandarin Oriental, and then just driven over to Grove Isle for the wedding events. Never again. P.S. Don't believe the photos on the website. They make it seem as if the resort is on a private island. In fact, the layout is very strange. Although it is an island, it's also a massive condo development encompassing several enormous high-rises. Many of the resort facilities (like tennis) are actually shared with the condos.

Great location-great views We just return from 4 nights at the Grove Isle. This was our second visit and we felt pampered. The hospitality and service by the staff is at the highest level. Check in was extremely smooth-using a wireless device in our room. Our room had a great water view, excellent balcony for relaxation. We also had a seating area and flat screen TV. Housekeeping was excellent-we are water drinkers and requested 6 bottle of house water each day-no problem. The only issue we had was the backup alarms from the delivery trucks. This sound seems amplified by the shape of the hotel-very distracting in our room.The hotel never seems crowded; this could be because of the extensive security required to enter the island as the hotel shares Grove Isle with three large buildings of condos.While there is a Spa and exercise facility, my wife swam laps in the outside pool each morning and I walked into Coconut Grove and back-50 minutes.We had breakfast each day in the hotel and it was nice, good selection and good service. However we found some great restaurants near by. First in Coral Gables, 15 minutes away is La Dorado-great fish. Then for authentic Cuban food, we loved Las Culebrinas, 2890 SW 27th Ave-also 15 minutes away. We were one of the few Anglos there-food is great. Then for lunch, best Cuban sandwich ever-Villa Habana at 34th and Coral Way-again authentic.On our next visit, we play to stay at Grove Isle.
Sapore tropicale nel Grove   showReview(21599553, 'full');

Good location and shuttle service Miami: Red Roof Inn Miami Airport: Good location and Shuttle service.Date: November 25, 2008Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Bruges, Belgium.We just stayed 1 night in Red Roof Inn Hotel, Miami airport. This hotel is good if you need a room 5 minutes away from the airport. We slept very well and did not hear an airplane. The free shuttle of the hotel works very good. You don't have to give a phonecall on arrival, because every 30 minutes the shuttle goes to the airport for pickup, excepted some hours in the middle of the night. In the morning we had to go to the office of Avis for pick up of our hired car, and the shuttle brought us to the entrance of the office, so very convenient. The room itself was clean enough, but does not look as nice as on the pictures on internet. In the corners were some big holes in the wall and the bathroom lacks some finishing touch. There is no coffeemaker in the room. Breakfast has little choice, but enough to start the day and there is a nice terrace at the breakfast area, so you can take the breakfast outside if you like. All by all a good hotel if you just need 1 night close to the airport.

Depressing hotel Depressing rooms, worn out with the smell of smoke that 200,000 smokers were in the room at one time. Decent price for an overnight but not worth the dark experience. Next time would find some thing better or sleep at the airport on the rug at a gate.

Not a bad place to stay. I stayed @ this Red Roof Inn and I rather liked it. No big whoop and really, who needs a fancy shmancy place to lay his head anyway?It's not exactly a destination point now is it?For me..just a stop between home and the Caribbean.I had a good time swimming and laying in the sun.I walked over to a fast food joint which served interesting Caribbean fare.I also walked to a nearby gas station for snacks and drinks.I found my 2 days there to be pretty relaxing.The desk clerks were friendly and helpful.All in all it was a good stay at the Red Roof Inn. Dig it!As a matter of fact, I will be staying there again this December.So, I say go ahead stay there and remember 'A good attitude goes a long way'.Satisfied guest.

Dirty, Filthy Flea Bay of a Hotel Booked this hotel for a pre-cruise stay for our group of 52 people. Our travel agent suggested this hotel as reasonably priced. IT WAS AWFUL. We had quite a bit of luggage for our cruise and only one elevator was operable. The rooms were gross. They smelled nasty and were dirty. No hair dryer either so a lot of our party looked a bit different the next day. Bennigan's next door was o.k. Shady characters hanging around.Continental breakfast was pretty much non-existent. Coffee and juice machines were empty or broken. The few muffins that were put out were pre-packaged frozen muffins. Those were gone so early because they probably put out a dozen and that was it. I specifically checked on the availability of the shuttle service to the port since our group was large. They told us it would be no problem and that we should be ready at the pool at 11:00. Only 12 or so people could go on each shuttle trip and there was only one bus. By the way, the bus had a flat tire and the driver drove us all around town to try and fill up the tire. We were the first group to go to the pier. The rest of our group had to wait almost 3 hours to get the pier. The bathroom in the lobby ran out of toilet paper and these poor people had to sit out in the hot Miami sun for a long time with no water or anything. It was a joke.I called the general manager of the hotel when we returned from our cruise. He denied any problems with the hotel. After months of wrangling with the general manager and the corporate office, we were able to get a refund for all of our group members.Very poor service and dirty rooms. Never, never, never would I stay here again nor would I suggest it for even one night.

Worst place ever We stayed at this hotel pre cruise for one night. We never did get a room key, they would have to walk us to the room and open the door. The room was not very clean. We only had 1 towel, and we were not able to get more until the next morning when housekeeping got there @9:00. We also ran out of toliet paper (before housekeeping got there) and asked the front desk for more and they told us to use the bathroom in the lobby. The shuttle list for the cruise was very long and they only had 1 shuttle, so the wait was a while. We took a cab. The coffee machine which made regular coffee (not flavored) was not working. I will never stay here again. We brought this to their attention, but they were not interested in helping us at all. Many other guest were complaining also.

Disgustingly dirty and badly maintained The desk clerk was solo and did his best to help us. The first room was filthy with dirty sheets on one bed. I asked for fresh sheets and the clerk had the security guard watch the desk while he ran them to me. I stripped the sheets and found that the mattress pad beneath was stained all over and the bed was broken and lopsided with an old, dirty, sagging mattress. The carpets were dirty and the walls ewre marked with stains on the upholstry and carpets. I asked for a new room and he obliged. The next room was similar but not as bad. One bed was sagging and unmistakingly broken. The property in general is run down with dirty, unvacuumed flooring, pizza fliers littering the halls and insides of rooms where they have been shoved under doors. The doors slam all night as there are no door stoppers and it is noisy. Based on the price and other comparably priced satisfactory hotels in the area one would expect a much higher standard of service or at least a clean room!!!

Great for the price and location I'm no professional hotel critic, but after reading all the negative reviews I expected it to be a dump, but it was a pleasant surprise.Free shuttle came every 30 minutes to the airport, just make sure to flag it down because it doesn't have a designated stop anywhere.The room was clean and the pool was really nice.The only discrepancies were with the staff...which there primary language was spanish but they did speak english. It was just hard to communicate some things I was trying to say exactly, but got the overall message across.Also the continental breakfast was doughnuts, muffins, and apples. They also had coffee and hot chocolate.Besides that it was a good overall experience and for only staying one night for a grad interview, it was everything I expected.I would stay there again.

Reviews are pretty much accurate I wouldn't stay here again. The rooms are plebeian, and the free continental breakfast is a joke. We had good luck w/ the shuttle from the airport, but the line for the port was very long; we opted for a taxi.I noticed that some people were able to pay $85 for a night here. That sounds about right for the experience. Unfortunately, we paid $180 for the Saturday night of Presidents' Day weekend; the hotel certainly isn't worth that. Benningan's is right next door and serves good food, although their signature sandwich, the Monte Cristo, really can't be finished by anyone who's not a glutton. Good for transients, but you wouldn't want to spend more than a night here.

Not Great, but OK for the price Was OK for a cheap place to stay before a cruise. Friendly, complimentary shuttle from airport and to the port. We stayed in one of the newly redecorated rooms out in the back building. Clean and comfortable for our group of 3. Continental breakfast not so great. One of the friendly staff recommended a cuban cafe a block away to get some really good sandwiches. Pool area really noisy with airplanes flying over, but couldn't hear them from the room.

online-booking in vain I booked the Red Roof Inn via RatesToGo, because they offered a real good rate. A deposit was paid by credit card, I got a mail from HotelClub confirming the reservation with a booking ID. The rest of the money should be paid directly at the hotel. When I arrived at the Red Roof Inn they couldn't find anything about my reservation. I showed them the mail from HotelClub I had printed out but it was rejected - quite unfriendly - with the wonderful argument a booking ID is no confirmation. I had no time to look for another hotel so I took one of the last available rooms which of course had to be paid in full and at a much higher rate.The room was clean and simple and would have been absolutely okay for the rate that went with my booking - but not for the price I finally had to accept. Maybe the problem was not caused by the hotel, but still their handling of the whole thing was pretty poor.PS: It's more than 2 months now, but I'm still trying to get the deposit back.
nasty       this is the sanitary napkin that we found in the ice bucket

The worst hotel I've ever stayed in, in my life!!!!!!! I've stayed at some bad hotels but oh my goodness... this one takes the cake - BY FAR!!! We arrived to stay the night in Miami before flying to the Carribean. We chose Red Roof Inn because it was 5 minutes from the airport. The ONLY good thing about it! When we checked in, they gave us a room that was 50 degrees in it! I'm talking, the AC was on full blast turned to dark blue cold! They switched us to another which wasn't really better. We asked for a non-smoking room, but there was a muggy, stale smoking odor in the room anyway. The shower  tub was in bad condition, leaky  rusty. Hot water didn't work very good. We worried about sleeping in the bed, wondering if the sheets  covers were clean because there were women in the hallways trying to get customers (meaning prostitution). When we walked past 2 rooms on our floor, the smell of marijuana filled the hallway. The entire night we did not sleep. There was loud noise from the pool area, loud noise up  downstairs, the room's smokey odor made it hard for me to breath while I TRIED to sleep (cause I have astmha) and it was pretty much a nightmare. We even heard the front desk people chattering to eachother, using profanities while we were walking our 3 year old out the door. Totally unprofessional  a total SLUM is the word. PLEASE, do not stay here!!!
Mediocre but close to airport if needed       Red Roof Inn 3

great beds - nice hotel we had a 1 night stay here before boarding QM2 for a cruise.after a long flight it was great to crawl into the most comfortable bed i have slept in!!! lovely room overlooking the harbour.fantastic. lovely staff.very very clean.would stay here again - even for just a good nights sleep!!!

Theft and bad experience I had a very bad experience in Mariott Biscayne Bay this time in Miami. I am a Mariott member and also Starwoods member. I travel a lot and prefer Mariott, but after this incident this time, I am never going to stay in their property and also recommend others not to.I had to park the car in their garage parking and had to pay 24 bucks per day but there is no security, someone broke the window glass and stole all my belongings from the Car and Mariott claims to be not liable for any of these.They say they cannot take care of any criminal act..The stay was also not comfortable because its an old property, water leakage all over and then my head still ringing from the heavy construction noise. Its a terrible hotel.If the brand cannot maintain its properties, I wont ever go to this brand.I would also log this complaint with my employer who has thousands and thousands of employees travelling everyday to Mariott because of Corporate tie up.If there is no security and comfort, then what makes it different from a roadside Motel?

Not a relaxing stay Overall this was a very underwhelming experience for a Marriott.The hotel is undergoing a significant refit internally and externally and there is constant noise and drilling from 9 to 5 Monday through to Saturday. There is no warning of this on the hotel's website and it came as a shock upon arrival.Got a nice room on a high floor only to discover that due to the construction the window was covered in muck and a struggle to see out across the bay. The restaurant service was poor and abrupt. This again was a disappointment compared to the many Marriotts that I have stayed in. The lounge is small and not anything special. The only redeeming point was the location, the comfortable rooms and a nice pool area with quiet areas to relax (but only on a Sunday).However overall this place is one to avoid for the next few months until the work has finished.

Good hotel overall, a few hangups.. Well, my bf is really good at getting hotel room upgrades. We were scheduled to have a suite, however as he came back with the news that we had been upgraded to thePresidential Suite it got even better! The hotel overall was a bit dated including the pool area, however the views are out of this world  it's only a short taxi ride over to South Beach. Service across the board was friendly  efficient. Everything was super clean, bed was awesome blah blah... typical nice experience stuff. The only bad parts were that they don't offer 24 hour room service  after reading all the pizza hut pizza options to be delivered before 11pm via room service it turned into torture! In addition, the balcony railing was to say the least not secure. Also we had a mishap with the concierge, they assured us they would send out a package to arrive in PHL next day, however they never called to have the box picked up!

I probably won't go back Before going to Miami, I read just about every review about this hotel that I could get my hands on. None of them were favorable, however, our friends were also staying at this hotel and we all wanted to stay together. I won't be going back to this hotel. The room was old and outdated. It also had a sliding door leading outside that didn't work, and an extremely small bathroom. In spite of the room, the hotel staff were all very nice and helpful. The best part of the hotel was that it was connected to some small shops and small restaurants. Unfortunately, they all closed at the same time and I missed dinner one night because of it.

My head still ringing from the construction noise Was definitely underwhelmed. Choose this place if you like a) construction noise, including a drill that started up in the room directly above us, b) cheesy decor, c) disinterested staff, and d) lame location in a city with so much to offer. My wife and I switched to the Palms in South Beach and only then felt like our vacation had actually begin.

A Wonderful Experience!!! WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE! My wife and I had booked a 4 day cruise to celebate our 25th anniversary and were looking for a hotel close to the Port of Miami. We planned our flight into Miami the day before the cruise to relax and celebrate without having the hassle of rushing from the airport to the cruise ship.When we checked in, a very courteous staff member welcomed us to the hotel and asked if we needed anything special. We asked if she could recommend a nice place to have a dinner to celebrate our 25th anniversary. She smiled, congratulated us and set up a contact with the concierge to arrange a dinner for us. She also set us up with a free breakfast buffet on the 30th floor for the following morning. Our room was on the 22nd floor. The room was wonderful, newly redecorated with a large flat panel TV, a controllable digital thermostat, a very comfortable bed and a great view overlooking the arena and the port of Miami where we could see our cruise ship dock the following morning.Five minutes after arriving at the room, there was a knock on the door. Imagine our surprise when we found out the hotel had arranged for room service to bring us a complementary tray containing a chilled bottle of sparkling wine, a bowl for large, fresh strawberries, some chocolate sauce, whipped cream and flowers to help us celebrate. What a thoughtful gesture this was!There were some areas of the hotel that are still under rennovation and were closed. The pool was being serviced but the hotel had arranged for us to use the pool at the adjacent hotel and appologized for the inconvenience. Even with the remodelling, the hotel arranged for any work to start after 9am so as not to disturb the guests.We would definitely stay there again. The location is great, many restaurants close by (we didn't have a chance to eat at the hotel but it looked very nice) and the price was around $150 using our Marriott rewards card - similar rates for AAA and some other deals. One of the best night's we have spent away from home!

Good Location and Quality Stayed at the Marriott for two nights and was quite happy with that stay.The room was nicely renovated with the very comfortable Marriott bedding package, new furnishings and a huge flat screen TV with the new plug-in panel. Very nice idea Marriott came up with there - making it easy to connect your MP3 to the TV to enjoy your own music. The room offered a small balcony and some good though partial views of the Biscayne Bay.Service seemed efficient and up to Marriott standards. Easy check-in and check-out with friendly staff. I did not try the restaurant on site - but there is one if you need it. There also is a very nice little Deli with good take-away right next door in the Doubletree hotel - directly connected to the Marriott. Otherwise the public areas seemed rather unimpressive. The location was very good - only a short cab ride or drive from downtown and bayside as well as Miami Beach. The area directly around the hotel though I found to be rather drab and nowhere I would really like to walk around. Overall quite nice with nicely renovated rooms and not far from anything but certainly not directly in the best neighbourhood so that you need to drive everywhere.

Very nice We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, and found it very comfortable. The view from the window was stunning, as it looked out over the bay; no balcony (although I hear there are balconies on the other side of the building). We stayed 4 to a room, and found that we were not too over-crowded as the room was large and had two double beds as well as chairs, desk etc. Bathroom was clean, and it was all tidied daily.The food was adequate; despite having to pay extra for it. It was not the cheapest I've ever had but it was nice food. The waiter service was poor; we were left waiting to order for a long time each morning. The location is fine - closer to the centre would be nice, but we had a hire car so it did not matter to us. However, the cost of parking there is ridiculously high. If you go without a car, apparently there is a good train system nearby which can get you anywhere you need to go.

Good Hotel for Pre Cruise stay When we arrived at the Marriott Hotel for our pre-cruise stay, the service was GREAT... Starting with the bellman, ready to provide service and making sure our bags were delivered to our room right away. The clerk at the service desk provided excellent service. Our room was located on the 30th floor; the derco was very inviting, the flat screen TV and bathroom, made the stay more pleasurable. And the VIEW from the sliding door balcony, over looked the bay, Port of Miami was more that we expected. We had a clear view of the cruise ships and all of Downtown/ South Beach area. We wanted steak for lunch and the bellman suggested a great resturant in the strip maill on the first floor near the Doubletree hotel. THe FREE train rail system was a block away, which took us all over miami... Only small issue was the moring noise from the construction work on site., very minor... We enjoyed our stay and will return if in Miami again.C. Moore Los Angeles, CA

Great location An excellent pre cruise stay of three nights.Excellent location overlooking the cruise port with a small marina infornt of the hotel courtyard.The hotel was clean and the staff helpful and polite.Hotel room was large and comfortable and once again very clean.A small pool area with hot tubm with adequate sun deck.A small shopping mall located under cover between the Doubletree Hotel and Marriott was a great bonus with a small number of restayurants and bars offering a choice of good food options. Would recommend the hotel and will stay again.

Great Stay My husband, daughter and I stayed at Marriott Biscayne Bay. Our stay was absolutely great. The staff is very nice to the vistors , they are also very helpful. The rooms were very clean and cleaned everyday. I recommended this hotel to a friend who would be staying there in August 2008. Whenever I come to Miami I would definetly stay at Marriott Biscayne Bay.Raquel Trinidad

Great views We stayed here for the last night of our honeymoon and were very pleasantly surprised.
