Nice lobby and pool area, great location and friendly staff.The euphoria ends when you enter your room. The rooms whilst large are dated, dirty and badly in need of renovation. This is a pity, as the hotel has potential.I paid $260 for a double room for one night through the hotel web site. This price included a resort fee ($10) and valet parking ($15). Better accommodation is available locally for this price.I would not stay in this hotel again, unless the rooms had a complete makeover.
horrible We had a reservation here. Cancelled it by phone in advance. Full charge appeared on our charge card . They state that we never cancelled which was totally untrue.

WHAT A WONDERFUL TIME! I was spending springbreak with my daughter and one of her friends. After getting on line to check reviews, I was scared to death because I was flying in from Ohio! IT WAS ALL WONDERFUL! We rented a 2 bedroom, oceanview/pool view. The room were a great size for what we needed and the staff was very accomodating. Ricardo and Matt (don't know their last names) were always around to answer questions. Is anything perfect? No. I would highly recommend this hotel and if you have children it would be a wonderful choice. There is a gentleman that has activities from 9 or 10 am until 5 for both children and adults. Guests also played sand volleyball, jet skied, frisbee throws, balloon toss and many more. Don't let other reviews scare you. Route A1A and route 1 will keep you on the true beauty of Miami. South Beach is about 20 minutes south of this resort.

The Worse Place I've Ever Stayed At! This resort typically goes for $899 a night to stay in the standard room which was extremely small compared to the deceiving picture on the website. We got a deal through Orbitz that included round trip airfare and a 4 days, 3 nights stay at the resort, but we still were expecting the same great service they boast about on the website. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable beds Ive ever slept on at a hotel. Ive slept on better ones at the comfort inn in Tulsa! The front desk service was rude, the woman checking us in wouldnt even look me in the eye, or say hello, or inform me why she needed my credit card when everything was already paid for in advance through Orbitz. She finally explained in a hateful tone they have to hold onto it until I check out. I was fine with this but it took her nearly 20 minutes to check us in which i felt was ridiculous since everything was already set up. Once we got over how awful our room was-nothing like what they show on the website-we tried to make the best of it and go to the beach. well thinking its a resort with a private beach we thought we could lay out wherever we wanted on the beach. nope. they set up big orange cones dividing a small square where we were allowed to stay and it was after spring break and super crowded. it was about a quarter mile stretch of sand we could all lay on. they did not raise the purple flag on the day when there was dangerous sea life out at sea so my boyfriend goes out swimming in the ocean and is swarmed with jellyfish. he comes back to shore and we walk back to the resort and there are literally dozens of jellyfish laying on the shore where we are walking! i dont understand why they have a flag for dangerous sea life when they dont use it! someone could have got seriously hurt. thinking its a resort we figured things would be more accommodating. room service was mainly what we did for food and had to order several times til they got the food to us. 2 pieces of cheesecake came to $26! and took 45 minutes to get to us when the MAX time they say is 20 minutes. this place is so OVERPRICED. one pina colada cost $8! there is no continental breakfast, just a restaurant that serves the exact same menu thats on the room service menu...kind of strange to me. the concierge man told me the front office opened at 7am and i had a flight at 8:15am the next morning to go home so i barely made my flight waiting til 7am to check out when all along the front desk is open 24hrs. so the concierge man lied to me. most importantly, the one thing that made this trip a total nightmare, was the fact that when i returned home i checked my transactions on my card that i had originally given the front desk lady to keep before i checked out. My transactions showed on two of the days while i was at the resort, Newport Beachside Resort tried to withdraw $100 on the first day, and $100 on the second day. Then on the 3rd day Newport Beachside Resort tried to withdraw $700 from my account. That's $900 an employee who had my card information from the resort tried to steal from me. Thank God I had taken out all the money from that account and just kept the cash. My report said all those attempted transactions were declined due to that of course, but still!!! I cannot believe an employee tried to use my card to steal from me. Overall the people there are very rude, shady characters and our stay was completely unpleasant.

Good location, needs some care and attention. I stayed at this hotel towards the end of last year. The good - large, welcoming lobby; helpful and friendly staff; large rooms; good sized bathroom; comfortable bed; nice pool area with separate pool for kids; on the beachfront; bus stops going south to South Beach and north to the Mall right outside; plenty of shops and restaurants nearby; ATM in lobby.The bad - decor a little shabby and outdated; windows badly needed a clean; room service food a little bland; entertainment a little cheesy!The ugly - one window in the bedroom had a large crack in it, and noise in the evening was often very loud until 9/10pm.Overall I had a good experience here. Some attention to cleanliness and decor would improve things greatly - but good value for money and good location - so I would recommend this hotel. Excellent for lying next to the pool/sea and passing the day away...

Great Beach Location.... The lobby was a tease to the actual state of the rooms. While clean and acceptable, they were dated, the wallpaper in the entry didn't match the wallpaper in the part of the room where the beds were. The tub was a little dingy. We had an ocean view balcony and the wind was making all this stuff on the balcony above us fly around and make noise, so we phone front desk to access the situation, they never called us back, it was a fitful sleep, but in their defense there was a tornado warning so winds were high. The lobby is beautiful though, but don't expect the rooms to match the decor. For the price and location I would definetly stay again, but with lower expectations upon entering the lobby.

Great place to stay with your family This is a great place for families to stay. It is right on the ocean. The pool is well lit and had activities to keep kids busy. My son never wanted to leave. We had booked a hotel closer to South Beach for part of our stay and after a couple of night cancelled the remainder of the reservation and came back here. Rooms were large and clean. A little outdated but the atmosphere, pool area and staff more than made up for it. Across the street to the north are couple of strip mall style shopping area with a great mix of inexpensive fast food type places and a couple of higher ends eating establishments.

Big Bang for the Buck! This is not a fancy hotel. However, we thought it was clean, safe, and friendly. There were a couple of minor snags and the management was quick to correct each problem with a smile. The location is wonderful (no need for a car rental) walk to CVS, Marshalls, Subway and Einstein's Bagels. The hotel restaurants served expensive, bland food. We recommend rooms facing the ocean. Poolview rooms are noisey 10am - 10pm!
I loved this place!!       gorgeous sunrise from our balcony

Get ready for lots of Families  We stayed at the Newport Beachside Resort from Jan 24-27, 2008. We asked for an ocean view room (highly recommended). The room was supposed to be a suite however the hotel pictures we saw were somewhat deceptive - maybe they were taken with a wide angle lens!!?? The murphy bed in the 'sitting area' was perfect for our 2 year old, while the queen bed was fine for my husband and I, but this left no extra space for moving around.On a scale from 1-10, we gave the room a 5 for cleanliness. The room was tired, the decor was seriously outdated (hello 1980's and Miami Vice) and there wasn't much as far as amenities (we had to ask twice for face towels...)The hotel is right on the beach - for $10/day we rented a thatch-roof 'hut' that provided us with a break from the sun - it was much needed. I highly recommend securing one first thing in the morning (around 8:30am) so you've got it for the day. (There are only about 20 of them for the entire hotel.)If you're travelling with kids this place is ideal - lots of kids running around, there's a kids pool (and adult pool adjacent to the kids' one) and a play area with slides and stuff to climb right on the beach along with daily family and kid activities (bingo, treasure hunt, etc.).The location of the hotel isn't great. There's lots of construction nearby and not much to walk to. If you want a restaurant or place to shop you either have to drive or take a cab.We spent a cloudy afternoon at the nearby Aventura Mall - lots of terrific upscale stores for shopping.Many pictures show the famous pier at the south end of the hotel's property - don't count on walking along it any time soon...it's still closed. Apparently, has been for almost a year.Although it met our needs, we won't be returning any time soon.

Not So Bad Of A Hotel My husband and I stay in this hotel as well as my one year old. Overall i think our experience was good.we stayed mon-fri. when it is not as crowded as on weekends. i booked this hotel through expedia.com and got very good rates (about 1/2 price of what the hotel charges) check in was smooth and very soon we were in our one bedroom ocean view suite, the suite was small, but big enough for us. loved the heated pool and the ocean was so beautiful and shallow with some seaweed. there is lots of activities for children and there is always something going on at the hotel, we personally didn't participate in any, by choice, but saw many people having fun. We were just happy relaxing under the little huts (on the beach, that can be rented for $10 all day) staff was nice and helpfull, we rented also a car and used the valet parking for $15 extra a day, not so bad. hotel is very centrally located, near restaurants, shops, cvs pharmacy within walking distance. Overall i would definetely stay at this hotel again if I can get the same price a paid for it which included the extra daily $10 fee the hotel charges on top of your room rates. Paying full price is definetely overpriced.

Real great customer service Well I recently stayed at the Newport In january of 08 and let me tell you is looking great. When I first arrived at the hotel I was greated by Pedro front desk supervisor how wonderful he was he accommondated me and my family as i expected great smile and great custermer sevice luckily he checked us out as well. But my over all experience was great the hotel looks fabulous. The one thing am concerned is the food at michaels to price and food is not all that. Well am looking forward in staying again somewhere around april keep up the good work and best regards to pedro great job..

very bad experience I took my daughter and twin neices (all 14 years old) to this hotel for mid-winter vacation. I want everyone to be aware that the housekeeping staff enters your room at any time of the day. While I was in the bathroom one morning, I heard my door opening. I called out  asked who's there, they said housekeeping. I asked her to come back later. Again, less than 5 minutes later it happened. When I came out of the bathroom, I saw my wallet on the vanity. I did not put it back in the safe yet because I was still in my room. When I checked my wallet, my money was gone. To make a long story short, I spent a great deal of time of the rest of my vacation dealing with police reports and the incompetent housekeeping staff. The only person who sympathized with me was Armondo, one of the managers, who claimed that it was really out of his control. I had to beg to have my room cleaned (even though they entered and left my room many times without barely a knock on the door) and each time I needed towels they made me ask housekeeping to bring them to my room. At one point I was even able to prove to the housekeeping supervisor (via a machine that registers everytime a guest or staff member swipes the door with the key) that the maids had entered the room when she was told not to come at that time. I strongly recommend anyone thinking about this hotel to have second thoughts.

Worst experience ever!! I don't know where to begin except to say BEWARE!!!!! Don't expect a room when you arrive. I was a travel agent for 8 years and I have never had such a bad experience. We booked and paid for our rooms online only to be told they didn't have any when we arrived.The manager lied to our faces and told us the hotel they were sending us to was as clean and nice as the Newport. I had checked online for days to find a non smoking hotel since many of us had allergies. The hotel they sent us to had no non smoking rooms and was full of mold. We had to sleep under an open window just to breathe, and ended up leaving the room at 5am because we became sick.This was the day before a cruise---what a great way to start a vacation.It never ceases to amaze me how unscrupulous and greedy some people are. They purposely overbook their hotel, then not caring at all about anyone else but themselves, send you off to what they know will be a bad experience. I cannot say enough bad about this hotel. I hope you will all just choose another one, they don't deserve to be in business!

Basic but clean I stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of January with my boyfriend. It was a last minute trip so we didn't do a lot of research. The hotel itself was very welcoming. We checked in and went to our room on the third floor. On entering the room the smell of stale cigarette smoke wasn't so welcoming and the noise from the air conditioning vent was loud. We went back to reception and advised the receptionist I was a light sleeper (slight non truth) and got moved to the 10th floor in a much newer/ cleaner looking room. In all the hotel is good if a little tired around the edges. There isn't much to do at the sunny Isles end of the beach apart from the beach itself. The staff were typical American 鈥榮mile have a nice day鈥?types and were very accommodating when I needed a plug adapter and when we asked for directions and things we should do information.The concierge was a bit abrupt but we did take one of their trips which was a sight seeing round Miami and boat trip ($50 each). Which was very good if you鈥檝e not been to Miami before we did it on the first day and it really helped us get our bearings and decide where we wanted to go back to.The public bus system is fantastic and took us everywhere we wanted to go for $1.50 each per trip. I would recommend, if your budget can stretch staying further down the beach towards Ocean drive where all the action is at night (and day) as a taxi costs $70 each way!Apart from that good hotel! It seemed to have lots going on for families, i.e. kids clubs and evening entertainment.We didn't eat in the hotel as it seemed over priced for what it was. There is a Denny's 1 mile down the road which we walked to for breakfast. As the buffet in the hotel was $15 each.

An identity crisis... We stayed at the Newport for three nights for a friend's wedding in January (this is the hotel they recommended for guests to stay). Overall, it was a fine experience, but the hotel suffers from a major identity crisis. When you walk in, the lobby is very contemporary and nicely decorated with tropical decor that is subtle and classy...not tacky. The restuarant/bar off the lobby is very contemporary, as well, and has obviously been recently renovated. So, a very good first impression. However, once you get off the elevator to head to your room, it's as though you are in a totally different hotel...one that clearly has not be renovated in at least 20 years. The rooms, while clean, were so outdated it was laughable (my favorite were the bedside lamps that were shell-shaped glass bases filled with sea shells topped with teal pleated shades). On the plus side, we shared a two-bedroom, two-bath suite with another couple and it suited our needs both space and privacy-wise very well. One bedroom was larger than the other, but even the smaller one was fine, considering there was also a spacious shared living area (that included a murphy bed, great for kids or an extra adult). Incidentally, the bride stayed in one of the executive suites, which had been updated. It had a living area and kitchen in addition to a separate bath and bedroom. The decorating was tasteful, though nothing spectacular. There was a nice flat panel television. I was in the wedding, so I didn't have as much time to enjoy the hotel amenities as much as I would have liked, but they seemed nice. There is a nice pool, and of course, the hotel is right on the beach, which is a major plus.Overall, this is not a hotel I would have chosen, but it was a fine for our needs. Rooms were clean, the staff seemed nice, and the location is excellent right on the beach. Plus, it was nice to have the option of a two-bedroom suite...much cheaper than two separate standard rooms. Once this hotel updates its rooms, I think it would be a great place to stay. In the meantime, if you are looking for a good value and don't care so much about the decor, then this place would be a good option.

A wonderful place!! My husband and I stayed 6 nights. We had an oceanfront suite with a balcony. The hotel is much smaller than other places, but we liked that. We were on the 10th floor, which was just right to overlook the beach. I loved watching the palm trees swaying in the breeze on the beach, which is lit up at night and people are out walking and fishing off the shore at all hours. The pier is now closed except for the restaurant . Every part of the hotel and beach was spotless! There were daily activities for kids. I have never seen that at other hotels. Housekeeping and other staff were friendly and helpful.The Ocean Reef Cafe had a great buffet every morning. Their food was excellent. Michaels was pricey, food was good,(I've had better for the price) and probably wouldn't go there again. We ordered room service after 6pm and would sit on the balcony to eat. Another good restaurant is at the nearest mall, w/i walking distance. It's called San Telmo Parrilla, an Argintine steak house. I reccommend that place. I can't understand why anyone could possibly say this place was bad. If you do book here, get a room with a balcony. You won't regret being able to sit outdoors either overlooking the beach or the pool. Have a great vacation!!
Don't waste your money!       The unkempt beach

worst experience ever First my guaranteed reservation was GONE! I was sent to another hotel for one night.  My mistake was going back to the Newport. We were told they would have a room when we got there. NO! Then they said after lunch. Which turned into a SIX hour wait. By the time we got our luggage and room the sun was setting. And even then the room was not exactly clean. And people walked in the door and had their room ready before ours!!My advice would be to spend your money elsewhere. You will be happy you did.

Perfectly fine hotel I stayed at the Newport Beach hotel with my husband and my 1 year-old and 4 year-old. The lobby was lovely. We had no problem with the service IN GENERAL. We asked for an extra blanket twice and it finally came a few hours later. Other than that people were pleasant. The room was ok - we had a standard room, not much of a view. There was a park for the kids to play in which was great. The major problem was that there was a shadow over the pool which made it a little chilly. It was also cooler than usual that week. We ate at the pier a couple of times which was nice since it is outside. However, don't expect Ritz Carlton service there. We really couldn't figure out when the main dining room or lounge was open so we skipped it.We valet parked the car and never waited long. Overall it was a good experience and we got a fabulous rate on Priceline so it was well worth it.We would go again (in April).

Hotel is ok I just got back from a 4 night stay at the Newport Beachside Hotel. We celebrated my grandmother's birthday with other family members who also stayed at the hotel. (I did not choose this hotel). I would say the Newport is a decent value oriented hotel. I am used to staying at 4-5 star hotels, which of course are much more expensive. So, as you can imagine, this hotel is in a completely different league from what we are used to. I will give positives and negatives of the hotel:Positives - Great location, friendly staff, heated pool, nice beach, nice lobby areaNegatives - Rooms, food, valet - sometimesI would say the biggest disappointment are the rooms. They appear extremely dated, and have a weird odor. There is noticeable rust in the bathroom as well. The windows were very drafty and loud, as it was very windy outside. We asked for extra blankets, which looked so old and dirty.If it wasn't for the rooms, I would rate the hotel 3 stars. The valet also took al long time sometimes, as the hotel seemed to be extremely busy with cars coming in and going out. To save $5, you can self park accross the street, but you can wait a long time for the traffic light to change to cross the busy street. Keep in mind, you are crossing over a very busy Collins Ave. All in all, a decent value oriented hotel.

pre cruise stay We stayed for 3 nights prior to a crusie. After travelling around the USA for 6 weeks, it was exactly what we were looking for. I must admit on the drive in I was a little disappointed when we first pulled up as it looked run down in comparision to other hotels in the area. As soon as we walked into the lobby we felt relaxed, the music and summer feel was great. We didnt like the room we were booked into as we didnt want a carpark view when we had wait so long to be in miami! We payed extra and had a room overlooking the pool and beach- so worth it! hearing the music, watching all the activities was great. The kids loved it, swimming in the pool and the sea, and having a bar by the pool was good as we could sip on cocktails while the kids swam. We had grand plans of seeing miami and south beach there was so much we wanted to do, but after a 6 weeks tour of USA we were so happy to stay at the hotel the whole time. We did walk to the shops near the resort and bought up a storm prior to our cruise. The only downside to this stay was a grumpy old woman in the gift shop....we waited 10 mins while she was on a personal call- we gave up and went back later and as my son walked in she pushed him out and slammed down the door. He didnt end up getting the book he wanted to take on the cruise. Oh and the italian resturant was good too!

Good, but not great... I went down to Miami Beach with my 18 year old daughter for a little bit of sun and relaxation since she is on break from college. We had a decent time, but this hotel left a lot to be desired. Firstly, there is no airport shuttle, and the cost of a taxi from Miami airport was a flat fee of $52.00, so be prepared for that... We only had a standard room, and it was definitely just that. My daughter was disappointed because the website said that there was a jacuzzi bathtub in every standard room, and... there wasn't...:( It did have a refrigerator and microwave, which was nice. I do not think the A/C was working at all. I had the temp. set on 40 degrees and the room always felt stuffy and warm. Didn't bother to complain cuz we don't like the room cold anyway... but still, would have been nice to have it a bit cooler in there... Also, the maids seem to have a problem replacing towels. You're supposed to have the OPTION of using your towel more than once... if you put them on the floor/in the tub, they're supposed to be replaced.... they never were. They would take the used towels and leave us with only one towel in the room! We had to call for towels one night, and the next time I made sure to leave a note asking for new towels. Jeeeez! There is no nightlife at this hotel, except for live music in the lobby. It would have been nice if there was a club with a DJ, so that adults could have some activities at nighttime. We were able to take the public bus right to South Beach for only $1.50 each, which was great. The buses run 24 hours, and it's easy to figure out which bus goes where. You can also catch the bus to the Aventura Mall, which isn't far away. All in all, we had great weather... we sat on the beach, shopped, got plenty of sun, and came back well rested, so we did enjoy our mini-vacation. I probably would not stay at this hotel again, but it did serve its purpose for us.

Great location, but a bit dated We stayed in one of the cheaper rooms (ground floor, parking lot view) and set our expectations accordingly. The room was large with dated decor and very loud air-con. There was also a lack of hot water for showering. We felt that the place had an air of faded glamour to it and hadn麓t quite kept up with the times.It麓s clear that the Newport is very family friendly and the location is excellent being right on the beach. It麓s also not far to the Aventura Mall, the largest mall in the area. Against this it麓s not close to the main action of miami beach (Lincoln Drive etc).The pool was a good size and there were always activities laid on for kids and adults alike. The lobby was nice and we found the staff to be helpful and efficient.Overall this place was fine, and no doubt you get what you pay for, but I didn麓t feel it lived up to a lot of the other reviews for this hotel.
Great location but watch out for extra charges!!!       veiw from our room

Great for the family. We came down for the Superbowl last year and stayed at the Newport. The only thing I have bad to say about the trip was the weather wasn't good for 2 of our 6 days there. The staff was helpful. The food was good. Activities like poolside bingo, cookie decorating, and all sorts of things for all ages. The kiddie pool was nice for my daughter, and the big pool was good for me. The beach, the pier, the tiki bar, everything was perfect. We'll be back soon.

Not so nice I went to Miami on a business trip in Mid-December and stayed at the Newport Beachside for one night. After a hard days work all I wanted was a nice hot shower. The lobby was beautiful but when I got to my room it was not so nice. I must say it was very spacious but very Miami Vice and had a lingering stale smoke smell. That was the least of my problems though, once in the shower the water started to fill up fast and not drain. Ten minutes into my nice hot shower I was knee deep in water. Yuck, Yuck, Yuck. One of my biggest pet peeves in my own shower at home let alone a shower that millions of people have used. After reading the reviews I am surprised I had such a poor experience. Maybe for families it is different but if you are alone or on business I do not suggest staying at this hotel.
Wonderful Hotel!!!       View from living room into one of the 2 bedrooms

Loved the Newport Beachside I was very impressed with the friendliness of the staff from the time I checked in until the time I checked out. There were several activities for adults only including wine tasting and an auction. Michaels Restaurant wasn't open yet but all the other restaurants had excellent food and service. They are doing a very good job of upgrading the rooms and the only complaint I had was that our room could have used a new couch. I liked the fact that you were within walking distance of other good restaurants and shopping. You can catch a bus that stops in front of the hotel and takes you to South Beach or downtown. I would definitely stay there again and have recommended it to friends.

best vacation ever what a treat!!! great family vacation will be back next year. staff was SENSATIONAL, True family resort, great activities for kids probally the only resort on Miami Beach that has great activities for kids and adults too. everyone was friendly since I am in the hospitality business I found no flaws with this one, every one was great and helpful especially under the holiday pressure.The rooms were great and clean the pool and beach were great also, very reasonably priced. big deal about the 15.00 valet service beats walking across street for a savings of 5.00.To the hotel staff thank you soo much for making our vacation one of the best ever.the corson family-seattle washington

Had a great time This was the 4th straight year that we have stayed at the Newport, and although we have enjoyed our stay every year, this year was it was our best experience by far.From the accomodations, to the beach area, to the friendly and helpful staff, everything was great.We look forward to returning next year!

Great Family Vacation! We have stayed at the Newport several times and we are always very happy there. It is a tremendous value for the money and a perfect hotel for famlies. Our 2 kids-6 and 9-beg to go back every year. They love the pool, the activities (bingo, arts and crafts, etc), the charming birdcages in the lobby, and the HUGE rooms! The staff is friendly and the service is fantastic. The beach is beautiful and the amenities at the hotel are fantastic-from the gym to the spectacular new MICHAEL'S KITCHEN, the new GORGEOUS restaraunt inside the hotel. The food is amazing and the presentation is incredible!The newly redone lobby was a surprise this time-it looks beautiful and it is lovely just to read a book and relax there! My kids love being in the enormous pool all day and going to the playground on the beach....we rented jetskis which are located right behind the hotel-a huge bonus! The area is also perfect for families-plenty of shopping, restaraunts for kids, and many activities and parks as well.I look forward to going back soon and often! Fantastic!

Wonderful and relaxing This was one of our best vacations. It was such a pleasure to walk out the door and in 30 seconds be at the pool and another 30 seconds be on the beach. Although the fishing pier was closed due to construction, there was so much to do. The activities coordinatorwas great with the kids. There was something to do every hour for kids or adults..We go a great price too. Very convenient to 95. No complaints. Not a place for singles or couples without kids. Lots of food places in the area.

Great Rooms ! Great Staff ! Great Breakfast I am a travel agent and I had the pleasure of staying at the Embassy Suites. The staff was the best that I have come across in many years. They were courteous and always ready to assist. Hats off to Aldy and Nicole. Embassy Suites should be proud to have staff as great as these young ladies. They really should be in management or training other staff on how to treat guest at the hotel. I will alway try to stay at this property when I am in Miami as long as they keep this wonderful staff. Thanks!
A Comfortable Stay       The Bathroom

Good choice for pre cruise We stayed two nights pre cruise in November and found this hotel a solid choice for the money. The positives: Very large, nice but not great rooms. They include comfortable beds, large living room which has space for a table for 4, and three sinks total. Room was quiet except for some planes taking off (we faced the airport. The staff worked hard including fast check-in (still busy at 1 AM), and helpful in setting up port transportation for 23 at $10pp. The pool area was nice, although the pool was cold, and the workout room was first class. The grounds and lobby are in nice condition. The breakfast was good although large lines formed later in the morning. This is a large hotel which I suspect is very busy every weekend so expect large numbers at breakfast. The staff worked hard and seating was adequate. The negatives: The hotel is located in a no man鈥檚 land. The only possible place to walk to is a Bennigans, which I would not recommend going to after dark. We ate at the restaurant for lunch and the food and service was good, although we were the only customers. At dinner, the staff and cooks were terribly understaffed. It took forever to get our food and it came out randomly. This is with only half the tables filled, and people were waiting to get in. I would just order room service, which should take about 45 min to an hour. Towards the end of the free drink time, the line was huge with 25-30 people waiting. The two bar tenders were working hard but could not keep up with the demand.Overall a good hotel, just don鈥檛 get to dinner or the bar line late.
Not a great Embassy Suites       Koi Pond

Good value for an airport hotel. This is a great place to stay if you are just passing through or have a car available, though parking is pricey for an airport location at ten bucks a day. What makes this property most enjoyable is the typical Embassy Suites very large room and the good breakfast. (There are free drinks at happy hour but we were always somewhere else at the time.) We had a very comfortable king bed. Easily the best value at MIA airport. You are NOT close to downtown, the grove or Miami Beach. The restaurant on premises is lackluster. During our stay the hot water completely failed, one elevator was out of service, our room keys were mis-keyed, the thermostat and tv remotes had dead batteries. It is rare for so many issues to occur at once but I will say that our complaints brought instant results. (Yes, we had warm miami showers that one morning but after we calmly expressed our disappointment we were given a generous discount for our troubles.) Positives: Eager to please attitude prevailed. Cheerful and efficient front staff. Large, comfortable rooms. Recently updated guest rooms. Very convenient to airport. Nice pool area. Convenient to EZ (on premises) and Enterprise car rental (walk across.) A very enjoyable full breakfast is included which is a good money saver. Negatives: Older property with some issues. No restaurants within walking distance. Pay for parking and internet. Poor sattelite TV reception. Van service spotty.

Stay at the Hilton instead Worst experience with this hotel. We used to stay at Embassy suites anytime we travel which would have been 5 different ones in 2 months, but this hotel changed our minds and our future reservations. Shuttle was great. We checked in and things were great, front desk staff recommended a few places to eat etc..... We decided to eat at the restaurant at the hotel (steak house)... big mistake. Food was great.... waiter was a total waste to include serving flat beer, having to ask for drinks to be refilled, asking for silverware, waiting forever for the food to clearly be able to tell it was cooked and ready and the waiter took too long to serve it. Waiter ruined dinner. We shook it off and went back to our room, watch a little TV, go to take a shower.....No HOT water and water was sitting in the tub? Can't be.... called front desk..Sending someone right up.....30 min later husband went down to front desk... moved rooms....still no hot water .....Now 10pm....changed rooms again.....no hot water, now 10:45pm. Was then told it was a boiler problem and should be fixed by morning, but we could talk to a manager... now what is he/she going to do about not having hot water boil me some and bring it to the room in sauce pans? We had to be at the airport by 5:30am could not wait until morning on a hot water and a prayer. Called guest services.... refused to give us the number to another hotel and did not have a phone book in room. I called the 800 number for embassy suites and they gave me the number to the Hilton. Then the Embassy charged us for each local call we made to try and find another room. Finally, husband was at his breaking point and calmly asked the front staff to get us a room at the Hilton and take us to that hotel. They agreed and had the shuttle take us to the other hotel. An unbelievable experience to say the least. The experience was so bad when we got home we cancelled our future stays at Embassy and booked with other hotels.

Aviod if you can Having stayed at Embassy Suites in Washington DC a few days earlier we were looking forward to our 2 nights in Embassy Suites Miami Airport, having booked an executive room with a Family Package of extras. We did not book the infestation of ants however, and the hotel staff were not helpful at resolving this just handing us keys to the adjoining room, which when we checked was also full of ants. Whilst waiting for a new room a maintanence man turned up and gave a half-hearted spray around with some chemicals without moving any of the tea/coffee making equiptment or cups out of the way first. All 3 rooms we were in had not had the linen changed on the pull out bed. Restaurant poor for both food and service. A big let down all round,
No Complaints here!       Room

Mixed review This is so hard. We stayed at this hotel twice during our stay in Florida. For 1 night on the 1st night then for the last 2 nights when TS Fay cut short our Key West stay.The one night stay was fine room fine, early to bed as usual when you arrive from the UK, big breakfast in the morning, no problems. Short taxi ride to Alamo to pick up the car then off to Orlando.Incidently if you choose Enterprise they are located directly across the street, and EZ cars have a office inside the hotel.The two night stay were were given an 8th floor room (we were on the 2nd floor for our 1 night stay) which smelt of damp. The second night we chose to eat at the restaurant. The food was good, expensive but this is a hotel.The restaurant staff were awful. Full of attitude. 3 side items were missing, but still appeared on the bill. When we queried this the girl took the bill and after a long talk with the manager came back to tell us the manager had agreed to removed them from the bill. 20% gratuity (we were a party of 8) some of the worst service we had in Florida. I think she was taken aback when we told her we had already the deducted the cost of the missing items and just walked away from the table leaving the money there.Back to the good. I wanted to send a parcel back to England, the security office couldn't be more helpful, the front desk were great, special mention to the girl who serves the cocktails. Perhaps she could train the restaurant in customer care.All in all I'd probably stay here again, but only for one night, its location for the airport and car hire are great and breakfast is great.Keep off the 8th floor and steer clear of the restaurant if you have a party (or split the party into 2 x 4 so at least they have to try for the tips)

Circus 2nd time to miami and decided to stay at the embassy, the hotel is stuck in the 80's era but the service from front desk is great and atentive. as for maid service it took 30 minutes for soap. i ate there 2 meals that were good but service stanck as the manager was talking about sexual objects with the waitress. check out was fast and smooth. won't come back again

View from a wheelchair We chose this hotel for an overnight stay because it was such a short distance from the terminal. I could not get into its shuttle, so we found a wheelchair cab and the hotel paid for it as well as for the one gong back the next morning. We were very surprised!The accessible bedroom was on the 7th floor and we were pleased to see how much space there was. In the bedroom was a basin - set much lower than the one in the bathroom, but I could not go near either of them because they had doors set flush underneath! How stupid is that?Otherwise, the bathroom was most acceptable and the suite was very comfortable.Breakfast in the atrium was a bit too crowded for my liking and if you are catching a plane the cooked-to-order food will certainly delay you. We stayed with cereal etc.

Florida atmosphere but service could be better The shuttle to the hotel was free and convenient. We rented through EZ car rental which is located in the hotel lobby. Our room was clean and large but nothing special. The bed was firm but adequate.One elevator was not working and getting to our floor was a pain. It is under contruction so try to book a room on a lower floor that you can walk to.There is no free internet. You have to pay or use the business center which was full of kids instant messaging, doing myspace, etc. The management makes no effort to limit time on the computers - I guess they want you to get frustrated and pay for internet.Customer service is poor, the staff really didn't seem to care. But the price is ok, we paid $140 per night, and if you want to be close to the airport it is fine. You will need a car to get around. It is tricky getting into the hotel entrance by car, in fact driving around in that area is tricky. Our garmin was even confused. We were going on a cruise and the cost of the shuttle to the port is $10 per person. The free buffet breakfast was good, better than most hotels.

Stress, Stress and more Stress If you are thinking of booking a hotel near the airport pre or post flight with the least stress factor, then do not book here.We actually stayed five nights and prepaid.First, without doubt, it is the longest I have ever waited for a courtesy bus from the airport to the hotel.One solitary front desk clerk was trying to book in several guests, so another prolonged wait.Of the five elevators (there appeared to be no service elevators, so maids and porters had to use the only ones accessible to guests), four were working. So to get to the seventh floor (where our room was) it often took 10 to 15 minutes. Multiply this at least five times a day and you can sense the annoyance.This was further aggravated when issued key cards mysteriously and frequently did not work which required another extended wait to get them re-issued.The lure of a 'cooked to order breakfast' had its booking attraction, but the reality is quite different. Every day we had to line-up behind 20 to 30 people and then scrable to try and find a clean unoccupied table.It did not seem to make a difference whether it was 7am or 9am.The noise generated from literally scores of seemingly un-supervised children in the breakfast room and lobby drowned out any jumbo jet taking off over the hotel. On our first night we tried the solitary restaurant (The Barcelona).After first being told we would have to wait as they were busy. We were seated some minutes later, only to count 13 diners and at least 6 serving staff.We gave up on room service one night as we could not get an answer from either the front desk or room service numbers.Two other nights room service worked well but be prepared to pay $2.50 delivery charge plus 20% service and then a tip on top.On our last day we had arranged for a late check-out only to have the room maids bang on our door at least 10 times.And finanally, after settling our extras bill, at 1.50pm we waited for a 2pm airport courtesy bus. When it hadn't arrived by 2.10pm, I questioned reception as to when we could expect it and the concierge stated with had missed the 2pm, despite being there the entire time.In hindsight, we had a choice of two hotels, Embassy Suites or the Sofitel. Next time, I will waive the 'free cooked to order breakfast' and book somewhere I can hear myself think and access my room in a reasonable time.

Fool me once... This is an older Embassy Suites. The suite layout is pretty roomy and fairly comfortable. The staff was friendly. There was a mustiness about the hotel and the greenery in the atrium was old and dull. What made my 2 night stay there a little crazy was that the hotel was near capacity with family reunions. The elevators were packed and slow. There was long lines for breakfast and on my last morning there I was unable to get a cup of coffee and a Sunday newspaper. Don't think I will return or recommend.
Excellent hotel for family       hotel garden area

Not up to Hilton Standards Embassy Suites Miami Airport is the worst hotel that I have experienced in the Hilton chain. Dead fish odor in the laundry room trash can. Fire alrm went off 10 times during the evening and night, TV and microwave did not work, did not have wash cloths and front desk sent up tan handtowels (rags) used by housekeeping to clean with to be used as washcloths. Rooms were filthy and food and cosmetic remains of previous quests were evident everywhere. Complaints went unanswered.

Great experience overall except for the location Great experience overall. The only real negative is the location. There's not much out there within walking distance or is the neighborhood really conducive to walking. You really need a car to go anywhere.Staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. The breakfasts and mangers receptions are great and way above your standard complimentary breakfast deals.A minor negative was the room was a little dirty - neat and tidy but the cleanliness could be improved, e.g. felt like there was sand on the sheets underneath the cover and there were pubic hairs in the bathroom and bathtub.

Needs updating Beautiful old building. Indoor garden very nice. Rooms very out dated. Full size bed was at best oversized twin. Airconditioner very loud and draining from ceiling into kitchen area sink. Micro-wave disfunctional and everything very cramped. Very disappointed.

Typical Embassy Suites We stayed for two nights in May/08 before heading out on a cruise. Our entire family of 5 agreed that it was pretty much a typical Embasy Suites. The pool and fitness area were nice. Very close to MIA airport. Would stay there again.Have a good tripD. T. Cruzzer
Great airport hotel!       Room 809

Perfect for a airport hotel We stayed here as a overnight prior to our trip and overnight at the end of our trip.Great airport hotel, we enjoyed the free breakfast and the free evening cocktail reception. We found the best rate by contacting the hotel directly. We chose this hotel because it offers hotel pickup and drop off 24 hours, going every 20 mins, and also offers a shuttle service the Dolphin Mall. Just outside the property and walking distance of about 5 mins is Bennigans, which we ate at, the food was great and service and price was good.It was good value for money and I would stay here again.

Great building, pity about the rooms Fantastic looking building even though it's close enough to the airport to see (and hear) the planes take off and land. Despite the beautiful courtyard with palms, waterfalls and even some caged birds and the restaurant, which was not half bad, the rooms and other services in the area were lacking. Problems in room included a faulty toilet that sounded like the wall was going to come down each time you flushed; an airconditioner that leaked water (and it puddled) on the carpet in front of the fridge. When the AC was turned on it sounded like a V8 engine coming through the room. Also, had to call twice for toilet paper to be delivered to the room.The microwave did not work and of the two TVs in the room, one did not work (had a line running across the screen) and the other's remote was broken. Also, after sitting in the lounge area of the room for an hour, bug bites appeard on our legs - not sure what they were, but it was disgusting.As for services, do not use the gift shop or room service. Two diet cokes (10 oz bottels) cost us $9.00 - room service, while the gift shop was overpriced beyond belief.I always stay at an Embassy Suites, but will never stay at this one again. Two nights was bad enough.

problems in paradise I was travelling on a family gathering in Miami, and my family booked at this hotel previously. I arrived at 2230 on a Thursday and Friday morning enjoyed the breakfast they offered, subsequently we left the hotel around 1430 on Friday and returned at 1600, on return luggage from our room had been stolen. My major concern was the way in which the hotel handled this, the first question they asked was should we call the police? I also noted that on return at least 3 room doors were opened by housekeeping and the rooms unprotected by employees, thus violating their own policy - to get into this hotel you have to go through a gate into a secured compound. My warning is this: the hotel accomodations are nice and pleasant, be very careful about your possessions and use the safe!
Amazing!       Embassy Suites - Happy Hour

I wouldn't stay here again...not bad, but... I stayed at this Embassy Suites last week for 2 nights on business. It was an average Embassy Suites... not great, not bad, but I'd stay elsewhere if I was staying near the airport in Miami. I've stayed at the Hilton, Marriott, and Homewood Suites and I prefer all 3 to this hotel. The good: Its an Embassy Suites... larger rooms, complimentary breakfast.The not so good: LOCATION. This isn't the first time I've stayed at an Embassy Suites that was inconvenient to other hotels and restaurants in the airport area. This one is close to a Red Roof Inn a gentlemen's bar and a bunch of rental car lots. It isn't close to every other hotel near the airport and it was a $15 cab ride for me to get anywhere around the airport.Cleanliness - It wasn't necessarily dirty, but I moved the couch away from the wall to plug in my computer and it appears that I was the first person to do this in a while. Clock radio was not working.At 11 PM, I had to call 3 times in order to get a wake-up call. You're a business.....answer the phone.

Not alot for the money!!! The hotel was neat and clean. We were able to check in 3 hours early which was great, because we had an engagement to be at during check in.The staff was extremely friendly and nice. The Manager's cocktail hour was great, and the breakfast was fantastic. The restaurant, while I didn not eat there, advertised Omaha Steak products of which I am not a fan of. The hotel is a little hard to maneuver into the first time, but you can get the hang of it after a few in and out trips, and it was nice to know my car was parked in a secured lot with 24/7 security.Overall it was great, it is just so expensive to stay there, I paid $160 and didn't feel like it was a great deal. But if you compare with other hotels in the area, it is the most affordable hotel without complaints of mouse droppings, so we were willing to pay the price. Wish I could have gotten more bang for my buck, Miami is just an expensive place to stay!!!

Great stay I recently stayed here to attend a conference at the University of Miami. Having flown into the Fort Lauderdale airport, the hotel is hard to find if you are not familiar with driving in Miami. Be prepared to make a few laps around the airport before you find the entrance to the Embassy Suites. If you fly into MIA it would be very convenient, as it is right next to the airport. Look for the big pink hotel... it is hard to miss!We had a king room with a sofa bed in separete living room area, typical Embassy Suites room. The entrance to the bathroom was in the bedroom, which I didn't like, though.There was an opening sliding glass door off the bedroom that had a tiny balcony. Enough room to stand, not to sit. Although it was right next to the airport, the glass is pretty soundproofed. The balcony looked over into the pool area and the airport.The pool and hottub area was nice and made to look tropical. Although they should do a better job of keeping towels stocked.There was a long line for breakfast, which can be frustrating. The Happy Hour evening drinks was a nice feature that we enjoyed, though.The internet service in the room worked fine, although I will be glad when Embassy Suites stops charging for this service.Room service is also available.It was a short (but harrowing) drive to many spots in Miami, including South Beach, University of Miami, Little Havana, and Biscayne Beach to name a few.Overall, I would stay here again if in the Miami area. It is a good central location and much cheaper than the hotels on the beach.

Nice Suites hotel with great breakfast. OK Area. This hotel was very nice on the inside with lots of very lush and tropical landscaping throughout the lobby. The breakfast in the morning was great, as it is with most Embassy Suites. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel itself was close to the airport and served its purpose. There was not a lot else to do in the area and the area is not very picturesue. You will not get a very Miami feel while staying here. Everything else was great!!!

Too Short a Stay for Too Nice a Hotel We stayed just one night in the Miami Airport Embassy Suites, and it was a more than perfect evening before our morning flight. Like most Embassy Suites built from the ground up, this one had ten stories of rooms, all opening out into an Atrium with trees, fountains tables and wireless access. Rooms are more than comfortable and they had the best flat panel TVs I've seen in a hotel yet. One in the master bedroom and one in the living room. They also have the best free breakfast of any hotel with an omelette station, tons of fruit and breads, pretty much the works. The onsite restaurant, Barcelona, has great steaks, reasonably priced. The desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly and even offered to pick me up at my car rental facility, so I could drop my car off and not have to deal with it before my early morning flight. Even though we had a panoramic view of Miami International Airport, we didn't hear a sound in the room. Embassy Suites aren't cheap, but they are worth it.

Disorganized breakfast, indifferent staff, airport location. I'm a huge Hilton fan, but find the Embassy Suites vary in quality. This is the worse one I've stayed in. Pros: Rooms recently renovated.Cons: 1) Line for hot food at breakfast exceeded 20 minutes on weekdays at peak hours, even if you just want bacon you have to stand in the same line. Very annoying for business travelers. Only on weekends did they bring out buffet hot food. 2) Waitstaff at breakfast were overworked or disorganized with items not refilled. 3) Hotel is right next to the airport, so unless you like hearing airplanes, it's not a great location -- nothing else around it, and South Beach is a $30 cab ride away. 4) Staff were largely indifferent to even basic questions5) I asked for a 5:30 am wakeup call and didn't get it. 6) Price not that cheap. 7) Co-worker found cockroaches in his room on the sixth floor. I hope I never stay at an Embassy Suites again based on this stay.

Great Stay, Excellent Breakfast I was traveling to Miami for fun in the sun, and wanted an inexpensive room, so I tried Priceline.com. They placed me at the Embassy Suites Miami Airport. When i arrived the front desk was very friendly and completly explained the workings of the hotel, When I got to my room it was very clean, but I did smell a strange odor, I think someone smoked in he room though it was non smoking. I opened the balcony door and the room aired out nicely so no complaints. I decided totry the Manager Reception, they offered great free drinks and chips and salsa. I was pleased with the quality of the drinks, mosy hotels water down even when you pay for them, but they did not. The next morning I went to breakfast. It was an awesome spread to be complimentary. I even commented to the manager how i enjoyed it.

Great value Big room, very friendly staff. We arrived at MIA at 12:50am Christmas morning. The Embassey Suites picked us up with a smile. Very good included breakfast, nice room, paper every morning. Easy to drive to many great Miami destinations from here. Got the rental car pakage with the room which saved us big $$$. EZ-rent co in the lobby. Gated parking $10 a day. Nice stay overall. Had a very good dinner at Bennigans next door.

Below par Needs renovation, more attentive upkeep. Older property, good location, next to MIA which leads to some noise issues.Burn holes on couch, dented beat up door, room service dishes sitting outside rooms for hours. Windows need cleaning ect..Needs better management, not enough help at front desk.If you have to be next to the airport, ok choice at best ,otherwise stay somewhere else in Miami.
super recomendable   showReview(22898055, 'full');

Pretty good all round Stayed for one night pre cruise. Mainly because we were tired, but also because the airport courtesy phone (only to this hotel) was out of order, we took a ten minute $14 taxi ride. The hotel, despite being in an office block commercial area is quite impressive with a nice lobby and the general areas, particularly the bar, where we had a decent snack and the restaurant where we breakfasted were very nice. Pool area was also well kept with an unusual waterfall feature.All of the staff we met were pleasant and very helpful, the concierge arranged a cruiseport shuttle bus for us at $10 per head, but be aware a cab should only be $24 anyway.The corridors and rooms were disappointing. Everywhere was very clean but with obvious signs of wear and tear. Airport noise was just loud enough to be annoying even although our room was on the opposite side. View of the lagoon was nice but a new building was going up next door. There is nowhere else within walking distance to eat, but there is a small shopping centre about four blocks away. I would'nt discourage anyone to stay here but I expect there is better to be found.

Very Good Close To Hotel I have stayed at this hotel twice in November for one night each time when passing through Miami.The hotel is very convenient for the airport, with shuttles every half hour (be aware that you should proceed to the arrivals level to find the shuttle bus).The reception you receive is very friendly and efficient and the rooms are very clean.The cocktail bar is relaxing and Breakfast is a pleasant experience.Good gym, and pool area. It is difficult (apart form the occassional noisy jet) to know that you are just 5 minutes drive from MIA terminals.Not the cheapest, but represents good value for money, and strongly recommended.Berkshire jpb - 11/08

Bed from Heaven! This is a very nice and hip hotel and it's close to the airport, which has its advantages and disadvantages. The rooms are spacious and well appointed, everything is clean and the maid service really pays attention to details (such as replenishing toilettries and decorating the tissue box). The swimming pool area is well-kept and the waterfall is a definite plus. The bar has great cocktails, always served with a smile and a variety of snacks, which is a nice touch. But the highlight of my stay was the bed, probably the most comfortable I have ever seen. The combination of down comforter, pillows and featherbed was just heavenly. I highly recommend the hotel for anyone who needs to stay near the airport. It is not convenient for the beach area though. Other minuses were the fact that you can hear the airplanes land and take off (yes, the windows will vibrate), and the lack of free wireless internet although they have computers next to the bar that you can use at no charge. They also charge for parking but if you don't have a car they offer a free shuttle to/from the airport.

A good choice close to the airport Clean, safe, friendly staff, very good location for shopping (easy access to main roads on the way to the best malls and even in the neighborhood), good parking. If you don't need to go to downtown it's a very good place to stay.The only problem was with the tap of the tub which was not working well and I had to ask three times to be fixed and finally get to use the shower comfortably. The price was excellent, considering the category of the facilities.

Good value This is a very nice hotel ideal for the airport, being fairly close by shuttle service. The room was spacious and very clean and although typically furnished, it is quiet which is very important especially so close to an airport. Breakfast was good and hot and served quickly as we has an early fllight to catch. Check-in was very effecient with a porter bring up our luggage. I did feel that the bar was slightly overpriced, but being a captive audience, I suppose you expect this sort of thing. For an overnight stay to catch an early flight, I would definitly recommend this hotel.
good Airpirt Hotel One of the better Airport hotels Enjoyed my stay

Great airport hotel!!! This was defenetly one of the best airport hotels i've stayed in!!! We stayed on one of the top floors and had a beautiful view of the lagoon. The room itself is very nice, rather modern which I personaly like. The bath is also very beautifull. The bed is incredibly comfortable!!!Room service is very good and friendly, as is the complete staff As we waited for the airport shuttle, the bellman gave us an ice cold water. The Starbuck in the loby is very handy and so are the computers with free internet. Didn't use the pool but it looked nice as well.Would stay there every time again!!!

Great hotel! My husband  I recently spent one night here  it is a beautiful hotel. We were in Miami the night before we left for a cruise. The hotel is 5-10 min from the airport and they run a shuttle from airport to hotel, which was very convenient. The concierge set us up with a shuttle from the hotel to the cruise ship pier which worked out very well. The property is beautiful and the staff was extremely nice  helpful. I highly recommend it.
Good staff, good rooms, good choice       View from our room

Great airport hotel We stayed here one night, having just flown into Miami and before driving to the Keys the next day. The staff were helpful, friendly and efficient and we were given a free upgrade.Our suite was clean and nicely decorated. The bed and specially the pillows were so comfy that we wished we could have stayed longer! Breakfast was very nice and we would stay here again.
Great Hotel and Service       Me enjoying the comfy bed

Overpriced and definitely not worth it. We booked this hotel for an overnight flight we had in Miami. From the website and reviews we thought it was going to be a nice trendy/new hotel, but it was far from it. You can tell it is an older hotel with a bad flip/lipstick remodel. Although they upgraded us to a suite complimentary, we didn't see it as an upgrade. Not only did it have a bad odor from the extremely old rug, it also wasn't completely furnished.Also, we wanted to order room service since we didn't arrive until late and had to catch the first flight out. They not only charge an automatic 19% gratuity to any order you make, but they also charge a $2 delivery charge. I can understand papa johns charging a delivery charge to cover the gas increase, but when it is room service, I think that is just ridiculous.Paying $120/night, this hotel was extremely overpriced for the quality.

Nice hotel near the airport Stayed here for just one night. The hotel is very nice; staff were very friendly and helpful.The bedrooms are very nice and one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in.Starbucks in the Lobby was handy for Jet Lag recovery.There is a complementary shuttle to the airport

Not all that I know this review is a bit late, but thought I'd give my two cents anyways. My sister booked 3 rooms at the Sofitel via Priceline. Reading the reviews/pictures, the hotel looked nice. We got the price of $120/night for each room. We were on a family cruise and the Sofitel was our post cruise hotel. It was a convenient location, free shuttle to the airport. the next morning for our flight back home. We got off the cruise ship and headed to the hotel in our rental car. The first thing we noticed was that you had to pay for parking! I did not think that was necessary in a hotel where there wasn't much around anyways, mostly office buildings and parking did not look like it was at a premium. We were early checking in and wanted to drop our bags off first because we were planning on spending our day at Sawgrass Outlet Mall (which is amazing!). It was around 12 and no rooms were available so we put all of our luggage/bags on one cart and asked the bellhop to store our stuff and when our room was ready, just to put all of the luggage/bags into one room and we would deal with it when we got back. We did tip him and he did put all of our stuff in one room which was great. We shopped all day and by the time we got back at the hotel after dinner, it was late. We decided to return the rental car instead and that way we did not have to pay for the parking. We were all so tired by the end of this and we still had to pack/re-arrange our luggage to make room for our purchases from Sawgrass. When I walked into the room, what a surprise. The room looked very old/worn, nothing like the pictures! The red door to our room looked like it was from the beginning of time! The carpet looked gross and dirty, the walls needed a paint job, the washroom did not even look that clean! There was actually a used q-tip on the floor under the sink! My brother took a shower and he said there was no water pressure and it was not draining properly, he was in 3inches of water while showering! I did not bother to even shower. We had 2 queen beds that looked very nice, presentation wise. I was looking so forward to just getting some sleep but it was the worst bed I have ever slept in! It must have been 20 years old! I was afraid to pull the beds sheets off the bed just to look at the mattress. It was so soft/un-supporting that I just sunk in. I woke-up with a sore back of course. I would not recommend this hotel, I think you would be better off at the Hampton Inn where you even get breakfast included with your stay. I was on the 9th floor, first room on the right - so if you get that room, try and switch!

One of the best we've been to....!!!! We were so overwhelmed by how good this hotel was that we are still talking about it. Great room with a fabulous bed we did not want to leave. We never saw a maid or cart in the hall, yet all was always perfect and clean. The staff above all were superlative. Each and every one was more than friendly and helpful. And the food, for fussy world travelers, was really delicious and beautifully presented. This hotel is way superior to most Miami Beach hotels and if you have a car the 15 minute ride to the beach is not bad. Besides, there is a fun pool at the hotel with a gigantic waterfall so you always hear the wooosh of water.

Great stay We were only here for one night on our way back from Costa Rica and REALLY wanted some authentic Cuban food. The staff was great and gave us directions to the greatest Cuban place and then directions from there to South Beach. They even highlighted the route on a map for us. Sounds like a little thing to do, but it seems hard to get anyone to do anything for hotel guests anymore.The room was very nice and the bed was so soft (especially compared to the ones we had been sleeping in during our Costa Rica trip).I would definitely stay here again!

Sofitel Miami= Amazing Service and More Incredible staff, amazing service from beginning to end. Had a suite with a Lagoon View, very clean, and an extremely comfortable bed. No airplane noise. Great late-night food at the bar, good and reasonably priced.

Perfect if you want to be close to the airport Very comfortable hotel with a nice bar area, free internet access, lovely pool and friendly staff. Only issue is that it is quiet a distance from south beach and the main tourist areas (30 dollars in a taxi). But overall this is a good airport hotel and would defo reccomend it

Pleasant staff and very nice My husband and I are very pleased with this lovely hotel. We were greeted warmly, even though we booked through a discount travel agency. Our room is large, king size bed and non smoking. The hotel has all the amenities we could want. (does not have a fridge, but we didn't need one, nor want one). I suppose a person could find minor flaws in the rooms, but really, they are minor!! Our room is immaculately clean. The bed is comfortable and cozy. The onsite restaurant is expensive and there isn't much within walking distance (so far I haven't found anything, but I'm still looking). We'll probably have dinner here. There is a lovely lagoon behind the hotel which can be seen from some of the rooms, I'm sure, but we have a front of the hotel view.The pool is really pretty and convenient. Exercise room is around the corner from the pool. Starbucks (mini) on site. They don't have the skinny latte's, which I generally get, but you can still order non fat latte's. (same thing without the SF syrups)We are staying one night at the end of a cruise with NCL. and paid $12 each for a shuttle from the port to the hotel door. Parking is an additional fee, I believe $8 if you have an auto. For the price we paid, ($119, $138 after taxes and resort fees) we think we got a great deal.

Pretty nice hotel. I liked the hotel. They added a lot of nice touches, such as the paintings on the walls and sculptures in the lobby. The pool was nice and clean, as well. You could tell in some places that the hotel had been renovated, but they did a good job. The only problem I found was with the cleanliness. The first room we stayed in was leaking water in the ceiling. It was raining in Miami. The toilet in that room was also not clean. The good thing is, before we could call the front desk to complain, the bellman had already told the front desk what happened and they called me and offered us an upgrade. That was good. In the new room, one of the beds had crumbs in it. When I called housekeeping to ask them to change the bed, they never showed up. We were late for dinner, so we left and came back later that night. When we got back, I called housekeeping again and the night shift was great! They came right away and changed the bed and even redid the bathroom and touched up the entire room. They were also very nice about it. I'm a travel agent and I got a good deal on the room at $199 a night. All in all, it was nice for a night and the staff were very nice and hardworking, except the day housekeeping staff.

Not as appears We thought this hotel would be convenient to the airport and looked exceptionally nice. We were kind of surprised to find that it was a longer drive than expected to the airport. It was situated near a runway however, and we heard planes landing all night long! Also, the photos on the site made it look MUCH nicer than the rooms actually were. Some have been fixed up and some have not. We got a have not room and it was pretty bad. There were hairs on the bathroom floors, beat up tiles, chipping counter tops, dirty carpets, etc. Yet it was $250 a night! What a rip-off. I would have left if we hadn't checked in so late. We complained in the morning and they immediately gave us $50 off room price. It was as if they are used to the complaints and have a policy in place to discount your room price by $50.I would not stay here again, no matter how close to the airport!

Not Great I stayed there mid March and it needs a big do over.The Lobby is OK but the room is tired. Holes in the blackout,louvre missing on the closet,curtains do not shut properly and the bath tub was plain dirty with mold and a need for regrouting.The amount of noise from a garbage pick up at 6 am woke up all the rooms I am sure.AAA should check this out again as it is not up to there standards

Nice stay at the Sofitel We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and booked it through Travelocity. It is very difficult to get a hotel in the Miami area at this time of year for just one night. We were leaving on a cruise on the next day. A hotel shuttle circles through the Miami airport every half hour. you just go out and wave it down. There is no charge for this service. While you are close to the airport, the rooms are very quiet. We got in early enough to use the pool area (where you sometimes did hear jets). Check in was quite easy, however I had to tell the receptionist that I was a Sofitel preferred guest. She did not see this on the reservation, even though I had specifically called the hotel with my guest number. She asked me for my number, which I happened to have on me. While I was getting it out, she found it on the original reservation. This entitled us to a free drink at the bar (quite delicious in a very nice setting). She also gave us a cork to use for a free glass of wine with a food order. We did have lunch in the restaurant. It was rather pricey, but it was convenient and quite good.The room was nice, much like the pictures on the website. The bed was quite comfortable. However, in a few areas, the wallpaper was beginning to peel away from the wall. The bathroom was very clean. Toiletries were from France. We took a cab from the hotel into South Beach. It was rather expensive. I think it was about $40 or $50, one way. The concierge told us that a shuttle to the port was available on the hour in the morning. he put our name of the list. Cost was $10 per person. It was there promptly at 12:00 p.m.Check out was easy and the bill was accurate.

Top Shelf We stayed at the Sofitel for one night pre cruise. This hotel is first class all the way. We were picked up at the airport by the hotel shuttle (that serves you cold bottled water) from a pleasant and helpful driver. The check in was quick and courteous from classy uniformed staff. The room was very comfortable, probably the best sleep ever. None of us wanted to get out of bed. The bar / common lounge allowed the entire family to sit and enjoy a drink and some appies prior to the excellent dinner we enjoyed. It would be nice if the pool was heated, but this wasn't a big deal.You won't be disappointed.

Excellent and good value We stayed one night as it's very close to the airport and we had an early departure. It's only a 5 min drive from the airport but you don't hear much plane noise.All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful.The room was a good size although the bathroom was slightly smaller than expected. The main point is that everything is spotlessly clean and very comfortable.A couple of things were missing though - no safe and minibar which I expect as standard in this class of hotel.We arrived quite late and didn't wander around the area but there is a tiny shop in the lobby for small items such as bottled water and crisps/chips.No complaints about the food as both room service and breakfast was good and reasonable value too.Strongly recommended

Slightly Below Sofitel Standards, but Still Good The Sofitel Miami is located just 5 minutes by car from the Miami Airport. Half the rooms offer a nice view of the lagoon.The rooms are very spacious and feature the usual Sofitel bed (my favorite). The bathrrom were OK, but felt more like those you'd expect from a Hilton or a Marriott.Those driving will find the parking lot in front of the hotel very convenient. You do howeever need to pay before exiting (like in any parking lot). The room service food I had was excellent and prepared on time. I enjoyed the outdoor pool as the gym is also convenient.The shortcomings of the hotel were the lack of minibars in the room, the Marriott/Hilton style bathrroms and the fact that ice cream (in room-service) was only available in pints (Ben  Jerry's). Also, I wanted a pair of slippers (not already in the room) to go to the swimming pool but getting the message across to the spanish-speaking maids proved VERY difficult.The staff was very friendly and helpful during my stay.

Decent, but not special Stayed at the Sofitel Miami pre-cruise for one night. Received a discount through a professional org.; wasn't dirt cheap but was much better than the advertised rate. Hotel shuttle from airport was speedy and we didn't wait long at the curb. Bed, as others have mentioned, was very nice. Firm, but not like a slab of rock. Our room was adequate, but kind of run down overall. Bathroom grout was stained and the bathroom sink cabinet was shabby and marked up. The TV speaker in the bathroom was a nice surprise. Kind of freaky at first, but then I realized how much I enjoyed being able to listen to the news while I was primping. Our room was really nothing special - didn't feel like a fancy hotel. Airport noise was not a bother. Service was prompt, efficient, and mostly friendly. Breakfast buffet was average - had some French touches (crepes, jams, fancy eggs). Coffee was served from a French press and was delicious. We noticed little bugs crawling up the wall by our table (we ate inside). None on the table, but that still gave me the willies. The shuttle to the Port of Miami was very affordable. I suppose I was hoping for something a little more special and distinctive when I booked the Sofitel Miami - we were celebrating our anniversary (hence the cruise getaway) and I wanted our whole vacation to be awesome. I didn't feel like the Sofitel met my expectations in this regard. It wasn't as lush as I had hoped and was led to believe.
Absolutely LOVED this hotel.       Bathroom

great stopover Having one night stopover in miami between flights it could not of worked better. Arrived at miami airport with no hotel booked and rang the sofitel from an ad at airport .The hotel told us to get on the sofitel bus which leave regulary from airport which turned up virtually straight away. The lobby and bar areas look fantastic with a stunning swimming pool directly outside. The beds were extremely comfortable and rooms a nice size with a great lake view. This is a 4 star hotel and a good one at that. Probably not a holiday hotel as it is not to close to beaches but very good value for what we paid i would definately stay here again in simular circumstances.
Found a great deal at a great hotel!       Very comfortable bed!

OK if you get it at a discount I had signed up for the Sofitel Priviledge program hoping that it would be the start of a beautiful relationship, but such was not the case. Arrived at 1:30 in the morning, which meant that I had missed the last airport shuttle and had to pay $15 for a cab. My request for reimbursement was met with a Gallic shrug. There was no indication that my room had been upgraded and no so-called welcoming gift. The sour faced bartender tried to cheat me by charging half price for the guaranteed free glass of wine. There were a few things that I liked: the free internet in the lobby, the quietness considering its proximity to the airport, the comfortable bed, the $10 per person shuttle to the Port of Miami and the relatively easy walk to nearby shopping, pharmacy, restaurants and manicure/pedicure. All in all, it was not too bad an experience and I would probably stay at this hotel again, but only if I got a steeply discounted rate through Hotwire.

A Fairfield Inn Masquerading as a Sofitel Prior to this stay, I had thought luxury when Sofitel came up. No more. While there were some nice aspects to our stay, we would not return and not recommend others go. Trip Adviser has stellar reviews of other hotels within walking distance. Our seminal experience was at Le Bar. Surly Sam, the bartender, basically told us what we could do with the TV remote. (Should he have taken the day off?) He had gone missing when a group of young men were seeking drinks. He showed after an 'underling' had appeared to take care of the men, and Sam treated his 'underling' as well as he treated us.
