I must admit he was upstaged by the cost of 2 drinks here. We were in South Beach one night and got twice the number of drinks plus some delicious bruschetta for the same price of two drinks here. Note that was in South Beach. However, if getting insulted and soaked is your objective, go to Le Bar!On a positive note, the lobby leads to a stunning seating area overlooking the lagoon. The concierge and bell staff is first-rate. Check-in and out was efficient and friendly. Going upstairs we found the hallways unexceptional to dull. The drab wallpaper was rippled or torn or scuffed. The room was OK. As a previous reviewer said, there is no sheet between you and the comforter, leading us to wonder if a clean comforter is placed on the bed after every guest? No mini-bar. The room was spacious with a nifty little alcove with chaise for reading or watching TV. The bed was comfortable. Nice closet with iron and ironing board. Room service for our morning coffee was always friendly and timely.So what else is not to like: the noise in the hallways. This is the first place I have ever encountered a dog barking in the hallway about midnight. Lots of talking and yelling back and forth several times. No fan in the bathroom, so you have to open the door to clear the condensation. The towels are thin and few. (We stayed at a Hyatt a couple months ago and had a towel rack full of towels in our bath. How can you wash your hair and get it dry with the same towel you have to dry yourself with?) As a final note of disbelief, our maid left us no wash cloths on our final night there. Why on earth do they have you come and go with an activated parking card when you can enter after a certain time without using it? When the woman at the gate tried to explain, we couldn't understand her, and she couldn't understand us. Yes, I know they want to extract their daily $8 but this system isn't reliable. We had the same lack of understanding with messages left for us. I love other languages, but the whole reason for speaking is to be understood. I've gone on more than enough. We wished we had stayed elsewhere. I later learned for the amount we paid (sorry it wasn't Priceline but through a travel agent), we could have had oceanfront at the Marriott!

Overnight stay Sofitel is 5 minutes from the airport and we used it as a stop over prior to our flight home after a cruise.The hotel is clean and tidy and good value for money, the restaurant is pricy but the food was off a high standardThe rooms wer large but basic, no fridge, tea making .The area around the hotel has no facilities so if you require food or drinks etc you are tied to the hotel which has a Starbucks but this is only open at certain times.The shuttle service is free and is very good.Would stay here again if i only needed to sleep and it was one night

Can recommend the Sofitel Airport Miami Excellent hotel from speedy check-in onwards. Only 5-10 minutes walk to local shops including Publix (open Sunday), restaurants and RC church. Rooms were clean ,comfortable and quiet, breakfast buffet good, staff helpful, pool area clean and uncrowded with lovely view of the lagoon. We didn't find the 24 hour hotel cafe until the following morning - not realising you have to walk through the restaurant to get there. Maybe it should be signposted? My only other adverse comment would be that the airport shuttle bus filled very quickly on Sat evening - we were lucky, but others at the second terminal were left behind. Still, at the price we paid on Hotwire I'd be more than happy to take a cab. I'd stay here again and recommend it to others
florida tour   showReview(22603156, 'full');
hermosisimo!!!       el bano, muy prolijo..
sympa pour une escale   showReview(20876257, 'full');
Buon hotel se si vuole restare in zona aeroporto   showReview(19873844, 'full');
Hotel lusso vicino aeroporto   showReview(17744336, 'full');
Hotel muy agradable y bien situado logisticamente.....J.R.H.,Tenerife,Spain       Habitacion muy comoda y amplia
Bon hotel d'aeroport   showReview(14927319, 'full');
Grand confort mais loin du centre   showReview(13866262, 'full');
Un tr猫s bon h么tel de transit       Le hall

Thumbs up on the staff! It was the staff at the Aqua Waikiki Beachside Hotel that made my two-night stay a good one! They were very helpful with an inquiry about snorkeling in Hanauma Bay and places to dine. The early check-in was greatly appreciated, too. Great service can really make a difference. Thanks guys!!!

Greatest Location on the Island!!! I was born on Oahu and know the Islands quite well. When a great deal came available, which included this hotel, we jumped on it! Positive things first: the hotel is in absolutely the best location in Waikiki. It is right on Kalakaua Avenue and looks directly onto the beach and the ocean, with no obstructions. We walked everywhere ... so easy to get anywhere, from the Moana Hotel (just a block or so away), to the local McDonald's on the corner. The staff is quite hospitable and goes out of their way to accommodate requests. We were especially pleased with Argie and Greg. The negative is that the hotel is really 'tired' ... the furniture in the rooms is old and scratched and dented, even though you can see, that at some point, they were lovely black veneer Chinese. The carpets are stained. The elevator is an E ride in Disneyland! We were originally assigned an oceanview room on the third floor, but after one night (and a request from us) we were moved to the sixth floor. You can tell that this hotel was originally a lovely boutique hotel, but needs some TLC (new carpets, furniture, paint) to get it back to where it might have once been. The rooms are small, but that was to be expected, considering the boutique atmosphere.If you are going to Hawaii and expect a 4* atmosphere, this hotel is not for you. If you have a good sense of humor about things and realize that you got a heck of a deal for a grand location and if you are out of the room most of the day and into the night, then go for it.There was nothing like waking up in the morning to the sounds of the birds in the Banyan tree directly across the street waking up, too. And at night, listening to the business of the street below ... and the feeling of the warm Hawaiian breeze ... well, we liked it ... and would do it again.

Best hotel in Waikiki for the Value! This was my second stay here. I had originally read a review about the staff being friendly and decided to stay here. Its the best hotel for your dollar. Its cheap, conveniently located close to everything. Its got the best price for being right across from the beach. The staff were amazing as always. I would stay here based just on that fact alone. The room attendants are very friendly and courteous. Trust worthy! The front desk staff are over the top. They will do anything for you. Greg helped us out both times that I stayed there and he was amazing. I cant wait to go back and visit. I would highly reccomend this hotel to everyone I meet and would definately go back. If you go ask for greg, he will help you out with anything you need.

nice but... Nice hotel for the price, great location but buyer beware on the cheaper rooms. Standard Interior Room means no windows! These rooms do have frosted jalousie windows in the door which opens to the hallway (which is tiny and open to the outside so there is a chance of fresh air while sacrificing security and privacy). Moderate Hotel Room comes with a lanai (balcony). Cool! Except the view is a blank concrete wall of the parking garage behind the hotel. Sound echoes off this wall into your room making it quite noisy with the door open until later at night when traffic dies down and the ac units are shut down next door. This is the room we had for three days. 'Partial Ocean View means no lanai/balcony and room on the side of the hotel near the back. Probably the best of the cheap rooms but it sure is nice to have a lanai in Hawaii. The best rooms are on the front of the hotel and have full ocean views and lanais. If you plan to stay more than a few days pop for one of these rooms and enjoy the sunset with a nice drink. I suggest a can of Pass-o-guava with vodka poured in... shake and drink... better than the candy sweet tropical drinks at any of the big hotel bars. Ingredients readily available at ABC stores which are about every 10 feet in this neighborhood.
Excellent for the price       This was taken from the beach, the brown building to the left of the blue signed building is the

It's what we expected...and more. Jeff G. Silver Spring, MD.What can I say? It was what we expected and more. The staff was amazing - from tips on food and hiking spots that only locals know, to being very friendly anytime day or night. Trevor at the front desk was the best and helped us beyond what he should have. If you are looking for a 5-star and book this one - you'll be dissapointed. If you don't mind a few cracks on the floor or a stained carpet (since you don't eat off it) this is your place. Central Waikiki, beachside and lots to do in the area. If you like a friendly place to stay and want to save a few bucks - you're at home. We stayed for 6 nights, had not 1 problem the whole time. Breakfast was continental - pastry, fruit, juice and coffee - enough to satisfy your hunger and get out into the fresh air. For our 1 year anniversary - I have to say thanks to the hotel and staff for allowing us to stay and spend our money on the rest of our trip and not the hotel. Sure, the room was small, but we didn't visit Hawaii to stay in the room. The shower was fun and we could see the beach and our TV from the bed. IF you let the little things in life get to you - don't stay here and take away a good thing with your bad review. If you like to take it easy and don't mind a non-perfect hotel - book it and have a great time where you want to. Just want to say thanks again and we'll book there next time we go back.

Great Hotel/amazing staff This is my second stay at this hotel in the last year, and I would stay here again no questions asked and would definately recomment it to family and friends. The staff at this hotel are amazing, I have never met a group of people that are friendlier then them. The room attendants always say hello when they see you in the elevators and the hallways and try to make a point of remember which room you stay in. The staff always greet you in a friendly manner when you walk past and always have a smile on their face. Although the rooms arent that big, when you are on vacation how much time are you really spending in your hotel room anyway. This hotel has the best rates that we could find especially since it is right across the street from the beach. Greg is one of the front desk staff and he has been there both times I have stayed there and he is always willing to drop everything to help you with whatever you need. Honestly if you are not looking for a room that is huge in size or a top of the line 5 star hotel I could not recommend a better hotel. I can't wait to come back to Waikiki and stay at this hotel again!

excellent location stayed one night at the Aqua Beachside.booked a standard room - got a room without a window. very small, but pretty. boutique style ... no window was a let down but it was okay as we only stayed one night. staff was extremly friendly and helpful.free breakfast every morning - only for one hour though.fruits, coffee and pastry.location is awsome. right opposite the beach.

Location, Location, Location! I stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Beachside from August 27th - September 1st. I do alot of research on hotels before booking online, and using Tripadvisor, I found the reviews for this particular hotel to be 50/50. Because of the great price I got through Expedia.ca, I decided to take my chances on the Aqua Waikiki Beachside and was not disappointed. First off, you have to keep in mind how many stars a hotel is rated, and what you are paying per night, and that way, your expectations will be realistic. I am a germophobe, so that is my main concern whenever I book a hotel. The Aqua is an older hotel as many in Waikiki are, however, I found it to be relatively clean, and the cleaning staff were very friendly and were helpful in retrieving items I requested such as sewing kits or extra toilet paper. Yes, the decor is outdated and the pink carpets dirty-looking, however, many people in Waikiki walk around barefoot, so I am assuming, after all these years, the hotel carpets must have absorbed dirt and debris from any feet that may have stepped on those carpets, along with normal wear and tear. I bring my own slippers when I travel, so I was not phased by the discolouration. Even if a carpet looks clean, I would never go barefeet on it because looks can be deceiving.When you book a room, be mindful of what type of room you are booking. I booked a 'moderate hotel room' which gave me a partial view of the beach across the street, but for more money, you could get a room with an oceanview, or for less money, an interior room with no windows. That might be a tad claustrophobic for some, so do take note of what you are booking and don't assume anything. If you are clear on the details, you will know what to expect.The room I got was not huge by any means, but was liveable for 2 people, and we did get a queen bed. I read some reviews where people ended up with 2 twin beds instead of a queen or king, but remember, your requests are not guaranteed especially if you have late check-in because like all hotels, rooms are based on availability. The type of room you book, such as an oceanview or partial view, will be guaranteed, since the prices are higher for those, but bed type might not be. Do always call or email the hotel to check or confirm if you have any concerns. Hotel staff are there to help. An added bonus is the small fridge where you can store leftovers or drinks. The hotel is not 5-star by any means, so you have to expect that you will not get 5-star service or amenities like you would at the Hyatt. The free continental breakfast is nothing special but is great if you want a quick bite in the morning and save some money on breakfast. It's free, so people should really stop complaining that it doesn't offer variety. You have about 4-5 kinds of pastries/muffins, 2 types of juice, bananas, oranges, and coffee and tea. i think that's pretty good for free. If you don't like it, then go buy a real breakfast. You always have a choice. The entrance is a little hard to find if it is dark or if you do not know where you are going, so make sure you check for the address and directions before you leave the airport. It's very close to the Hyatt, so if you see that, then you know you are there. The location is super because you are literally across the street from Waikiki Beach and the Police Station. You will be close to many shops, restaurants, International Marketplace, Royal Hawaiian Centre, etc. Kalakaua Avenue, where the hotel is located, is a major tourist hub, so walking along the street at night, you will see buskers/artists do their thing, and it is very safe. Downtown Honolulu and Chinatown are a little sketchy at night, and I would not venture out there in the evening, so if want to explore those places, do so in the morning. There is a free hula show at Waikiki Beach at 6:30PM every night (weather-dependent), and it is right across the street from the hotel. You can also catch the sunset around that time, as it tends to get dark fairly early there (around 7-7:30PM).If you are planning to do a tour of the island, North Shore, Pearl Harbour, etc., I would not buy tickets online beforehand, since when you get to Waikiki, you will notice tons of people on street corners handing out pamphlets for cheap tours. Do your homework and research though, or else you can get ripped off or take a tour that is not to your liking. Make sure you use a tour company that is legit and don't get sucked into those timeshare companies. Know what you want and ask the right questions. If you are to book online beforehand, I would use Discover Hawaii Tours site since I booked a tour with them through Expedia. Going directly to the source itself will save you some money, I realized later. If you go to International Marketplace or Duke's Lane for souvenirs, know that you can barter, and if you start walking away after they give you a price, it always goes lower. In fact, it can go down several times since every cart sells the same stuff, and you can always go to another vendor.If you are taking kids with you, the Honolulu Zoo, along Kalakaua Avenue, is one of the best zoos I've been to! It is not too big but has all of the cool animals that kids like to see (i.e., tigers, chimps, elephants, etc.). Plus, it's only $8 for adults, and $1 for kids under 13 or 14!! Can't get any better than that.Sea Life Park is overpriced for what you see, so I would not go out of my way to visit. The luau there has a fabulous menu though, but all luaus are cheesy and not worth the money. You have to go to one though when in Hawaii, so that one's not bad. Buying tickets through a tour company was $10 cheaper than what is advertised through the Park itself, so look around. Good thing about the Sea Life Park luau was that you get free admission to the park for use within 30 days after. That's how I found out the park really sucked, but at least I didn't pay for it.Anyways, hope all of this is helpful! Have fun in Hawaii!!

Oh My God....What a disaster Oh my god, what a disapointment. The photos on the internet were so misleading. We had asked for early book in but was told that that was impossible unless we upgrade. After discussing the price and rejecting the idea we were then told $50 cash would see us into a room. I know that this went into the guys pocket, but was desperate to get into the room after travelling from Australia. The upgraded room was smelly, very damp and had single beds, shower full of mould and strings of silicone where leaks had been resealed time after time....Back to the desk new guy on reception wh gave us another room marginally better....The included breakfast was limited and we never did see the promised picnic packs for the breakfast on the beach......I am sure that this hotel was top class in the 1960's but for 2008 it was old, depressing, dirty and the staff were just lining their pockets...wouldnt even class it good enough for back packers......we were supposed to be staying there on the way back to Australia but thank god for my travel agent who changed our hotel booking to a fabulous hotel for the same cost......The minute we stepped into the reception area and saw the dust, and dirty ornate mirror we knew we had made a mistake. Dont rely on internet photos...read the reviews....C. BaileyMelbourne Australia
budget motel with great location Pro;Great LocationHelpful StaffsCon:Dirty room (my room is 1108,don't know it is renovated or not)Slowest evelatorLess choices and supply breakfast

Amazing, Cute, Tacky and Cheap I recently stayed at the Aqua beachside with my best friend. Neither of us had ever been to Hawaii before.. I just have to start by saying that the staff at the Aqua beachside are amazing!!! The front desk guys are all so friendly and helpful, anything we needed they did for us and any where we wanted to go, they helped us get there. At first glance the Aqua beachside is definitly tacky.... the pink carpet, walls and even pink fabricated head boards are a little out of date but they are working on doing renos. We later realized that even though it did seem tacky at first... its actually a really cute and has a ton of character. IT may not be the newest or the nicest place Ive ever stayed but it was super cute. Besides the staff the next best thing about this hotel is definitly the location... literally across the street from the beach! You couldnt ask for a better spot. Our first day we walked out the front door a watched a surf competion right on Waikiki beach. So if your looking for a place tto stay that is friendly, cute, cheap, clean and a great location then this is your place. If your looking for somewhere high end, classy, and romantic.... try the Hilton. I have nothing but good things to say about the Aqua beachside and its staff......Hi Trev and Greg!!

Looks like it was a nice hotel...once upon a time I knew a bit about the hotel before heading in, so I wasn't overly disappointed. However, there are some things that the hotel could be doing to make a more pleasant stay for their guests, that they're not doing at the moment. I and two others stayed in two separate rooms for 4 days this July.The desk manager was very polite and helpful...and a looked a little overwhelmed at times. I knew the rooms were on the small side before booking, so that wasn't a surprise. However, I was somewhat surpirsed to see the run down condition of the place. The shower lining was old and leaked, cabinets were chipped, wall paper peeling, etc. Still, for the location and a decent price I can get over that. Other than a filthy looking carpet, the rooms were clean. The decor throughout the entire hotel looked like it was probably FANTASTIC once upon a time, but has since really deteriorated.Housekeeping was hit or miss. Sometimes they'd clean in the bathroom, sometimes not. Sometimes you'd get a replacement washrag and hand towel, sometimes not. When we called the front desk asking, eventually they said they were out. Yet we discovered later....by being nosy and looking in cabinets on our floor...that they did indeed have washrags... ;(I think what bothered me the most was the used mattresses piled in the 2nd floor hallway and also in the outdoor eating area. Not only was this really tacky looking, it could be a potential heath hazard as the rain creates mold, etc in/on the ones outside. It's probably expensive to dispose/move them out, but shouldn't that be a high priority for the owners if they're refurbing? Most people eat the continental breakfast out there on 3 tables that aren't buried by mattresses.One HUGE positive to this hotel is location. It's literally across the street from Waikiki beach. If the current owners stick with it and put the funds into the hotel necessary to bring it back up to the level it once seems like it was, WOW. Right now, if you don't mind clutter, marginal housekeeping, I'd say it's ok for you. Otherwise, pay a little bit more for the other hotels on the same street.
So happy I ignored the bad reviews!!!!       park across from hotel

Great Deal!!! We felt a little duped last week when we arrived in Hawaii last week and checked into the Aqua Honolu Prince Hotel. The bones of the place are pretty gross and I can only imagine we selected that hotel based on the wrong review or something. Fortunately they were kind enough to allow us to transfer over to Beachside. For $20 more we went from a bad motel to the cutest little hotel right there on the beach. The room was slightly aged but had a charming historic asian design to it. We were staying only one night before our cruise started but we were so thankful to have stayed there. I would have been fine spending the whole week at Beachside.

Budget Hotel w/a view to kill! Ok, so here is the deal, if you are look for a luxury expierence......this is not the place for you! However if you are looking for a clean room, KILLER views (floors 6 and up are best) and within walking distance to all waikiki activities.....this is your place. We knew starting off that we would not be spending much time in our room, so we went budget and we are sure glad that we did! The staff was awsome, front desk was sooo helpful (call hotel directly for room upgrades. They will beat any advertised price and check for daily parking rates, we paid at check in and saved 60 dollars!) The continental breakfast was basic, but did the trick. I would definatley suggest this property to friends and family. Keep in mind, the rooms are small, too smal for kids! But perfect for 2 people trying to get away for a relaxing vacation who are also on a budget...

Fab Location Literally across the road from Waikik beach, easy walk to all Waikik has to offer. Understand hotel has recently been bought by Aqua chain and looks as if it will be undergoing renovation in the near future - scaffolding all around hotel during my stay with workmen there friom 9 - 5. Interior does need updating and is rather worn and dated - however, location compensates for this.Breakfast is a bit of a joke though and unless you are there when it goes out forget it, my 1st morning there I arrived at about 8.15am to be told there was nothing left! Even when there there is food left it's poor quality muffins only.

Great Value for the Money My adult daughters and I stayed here for 4 nights and found it totally charming. It is an older hotel that has been remodeled and updated. If you look close, you can tell it's been around awhile, but everything is clean, fresh and updated. The room is amazing. It comes with three queen beds! The bathroom was adequate, but the shampoo and conditioner was out of this world, made with local ingredients. The room was extremely large and very clean, with a small refrigerator and microwave for our use. We were lucky enough to have a corner room so because of that, we had two balconies, one overlooking the busy street (great for people watching) and one that you could get a glimpse of the ocean from. The hotel is a few blocks from the ocean, but well worth the walk. Close to restaurants, shopping and just about anything that you could ask for. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would definately stay here again.

The biggest dump with the best view This is the dumpiest room I have ever stayed in. The room was tiny and the quirky oriental furniture very worn. But nothing could out do the horrible dirty worn carpet. It was supposed to be pink but it was grey in path areas. The bathroom had been redone and was great. Other than the worn icky conditions, the linens, etc were clean. The hotel is being refirbished, which was not a problem....but they really should not rent out those rooms until they take up that carpet. We were too embarrased to have our other family members up to our room. Now the view was spectacular. Full front on view of wakiki beach....amazing. And the location is fabulous. I wouldn't stay at this hotel until ALL the work has been done....especially the carpet. The rooms don't look anything like the online pictures. The staff was nice. I really felt sorry for those people who had booked a room with a view of the wall.

Average Hotel We booked this Hotel via their web site with a package including parking at $10 per night.On arrival we were placed in a room with a stunning view of a concrete wall which blocked out everything including the daylight! i asked for another room only to be told that ours was the only one available. The room was shabby  dimly lit which helped to hide the poor condition of the furnishings. The bed although comfortable had a large piece of hardboard under the matress to support the springing  the carpet was old  deteriorated. The bathroom was of a better standard with an excellent shower!!On the upside..the staff were very friendly  helpful with advice on things to see  do.The only other moan is that upon check-out we were charged $18 per night for car parking  not the advertised price of $10.. I think that the new owners would be be wise to close the hotel down until refurbishment is completed rather than try to mix guests with building work  so risk a bad reputation for the future!!

position is everything position is everything with this hotel so expect to pay for it.!!!!My husband and I stayed here Easter 2007 and hope to return one day soon. I found the staff very willing to serve when approached with respect.? I drink lots of tea and it was never a problem when I fronted up at reception with my mug and tea bag for the staff to get me some boiling water.We had been given a top floor sea view room but a lower floor room was requested and it did not matter that it was a garden view. In fact it was nice to be able to sit out of the direct sun on our balcony.This is a basic hotel so please do your homework before booking.I have traveled all over the world and it is unusual these days to get a double bed but it is easy to check this before you leave home. Honeymooners beware!!!I hope this hotel has not changed much now it is under new management as I hope to return .

Disappointment I never added my comments before but I was so disappointed with this experience I just had to let others know. The day we arrived the hotel was in in their first day of new ownership by the Aqua group. When we were checking in I had requested a room with a view, although the reception person didn't answer me, it appearred that he heard me. He advised us of all the extra charges at that time. Using the safe $100, local phone calls $1 each...This hotel is quite old but clean  neat. The room that was assigned to us had a beautiful bathroom, glass shower... 2 single beds  the view was a cement wall, but we did have a patio. When I called the desk to let them know there were single beds  my reservation said double bed. I was informed that you cannot request what size of bed you get. I asked the attendant if it seem right that a married couple should have single beds, anyway, I asked to be moved to a room with double bed  view as my reservation stated but he said there were no rooms. I attempted to use the phone after speaking to the desk but now the phone wouldn't work. We decided to try to make the best of it  go for a walk on the beach. The beach was right a cross the street from the hotel, beautiful sand, easy to get in the water there. Local renting surf boards, burger shack, lots of people. When we returned from our walk I asked if the phone had been fixed yet but no one seemed to care. I had had enough so I asked to be moved to another hotel. They moved us to the Aqua Palms  Spa. This hotel was exactly what I had requested, view , king bed, staff were absolutely wonderful. We stayed there for three nights. I would definately recommend this hotel.
Excellant raport qualit茅 prix   showReview(18684596, 'full');
Good Value at the I'lima       Cloudy morning along the Ala Wai Canal - great for walking and jogging!
Older but Nice       Bed  Balcony

Loved the Ilima! I stayed at the Ilima for 8 nights in a studio superior room with my husband because of all of the positive reviews we read. We stayed in room 901, which had a beautiful view of the mountains, the Ala Wai Canal and the Ala Wai golf course. This hotel is a great value for $115/night with the 5th night free! I'd highly recommend this room because of the view. Plus, it was very quiet- street noise was not a problem with the balcony door closed. The room was impeccably clean. Make sure you request a mountain view when making your reservation because some rooms only have views of the street and other buildings. Noise might be a problem on lower floors, but it wasn't an issue on the 9th floor. I was extremely surprised to read some other reviewers complain about rude staff because every staff member I encountered during my stay was very friendly and helpful! One staff member offered to lend me a beach umbrella for the week when I inquired about where to buy one. Another staff member suggested a great alternative to the nearby expensive supermarket and gave us detailed directions. The location (10-minute walk to Waikiki beach) was fantastic. The pool was very warm, but refreshing in the evenings when it was a bit cooler outside. The lobby is very pleasant and attractive. I highly recommend this hotel for budget conscious travelers who do not require room service, concierge services, etc. Save your money and stay at the Ilima! This is a hidden jewel!

Just what was needed The last two days of our Hawaiian holiday were spent here and we couldn't have chosen better. Having the car park was great, nearness to the shops and restaurants was a bonus, the rooms were large and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Would always try and stay here, if I ever have the chance to go back

Great for families I picked this hotel from reviews I read here, and they are spot on. The location is great, with a small grocery 3 blocks away so one can take advantage of the kitchen facilities. The room is spacious (much bigger than our company-paid room for the other half of our trip at twice the price). The firm beds took a little getting used to, but were fine. The extras like the chocolate-covered macadamia nuts for check-in and the shell leis at check-out were nice. When we arrived Friday morning during the sing-along, we were still able to check in, and although our room wasn't ready yet, we were still able to get towels from the desk and go to the beach. The free parking in the small garage was never a problem, although we did make it a point to be there by late afternoon and do our evenings on foot. The safe was big enough for the laptop. The only minor disappointment was that the pool was closed for repairs when we were there, but these things happen. I would go back again, and heartily recommend it to anyone with kids. If you want valet parking, spas, onsite gourmet meals, etc. go elsewhere. Check the hotel's website (and keep checking back) for great deals.

Great hotel! We've been to Waikiki several times and stayed in a few different hotels, but this is one hotel that we would love to go back to.The hotel is located about two blocks from Waikiki beach, off of Kuhio Avenue, where there are tons of restaurants! Upon checking in, they gave us Hawaiian cookies. That was nice. Our studio room was nice, clean, and very spacious, especially for our family of 4, which included 2 young kids. We liked the free parking, and if you come back early enough, there wasn't a problem getting a spot. My husband had difficulty one night finding a spot and he simply parked on the street. The bathrooms were modern, the beds were comfy. They had coin operated washers and dryers, and sold detergent for a nominal fee. The rooms had kitchens with a full size fridge which was convenient. With all the restaurants surrounding us, we never cooked. The hotel offered beach towels and beach mats, which is a nice touch. They also gave us newspapers every day. Upon check out, we each received a shell lei.We got a great rate off of the website. I thought it was great value, a nice place, and an extremely convenient location.

Very Pleasant Stay If you're looking for a boutique hotel or 5 stars with room service and a restaurant, keep looking. The Ilima is a nice spacious studio with everything that an independent traveler needs. The rooms are simple and clean with a generic d茅cor and firmly comfortable beds. With a fridge, microwave, stove, pots, pans, coffee maker and coffee the only thing you need is your own food. There's a coin operated laundry room on the property. The hotel staff seems to work hard to keep things in good order. There was a problem with an appliance in my room and it was fixed immediately. There is a small pool and dry sauna. Parking is free and I never had a problem finding a spot. All of the staff were cheerful, knowledgeable and professional and it made for a pleasant stay. Thanks Ilima.

Happy to stay here We had a quick two-night stay at the Ilima to see Pearl Harbor and recover from the jet lag before continuing our trip. Friendly and knowledgeable staff, clean and comfortable room (we had 3 adults and 2 children in a 2 bedroom suite with kitchen) good location (a block from the bus to Pearl Harbor) with the International Marketplace, Waikiki Beach and several good restaurants close by. It was a pleasant start to our vacation.
Value for money, highly recommended!       View

Great SDtay Stayed in room 909 (from previous guest recommendation since we are smokers) and we loved it..Large rooms and comfortable beds with a full kitchen and large refridgerator..Kid friendly..Kind and helpful staff..Jack in the box around the corner and Macdonalds across and down the street..Perry;s 3 blocks down is worth the buffet price for picky kids and the Galaxy across from starbucks had a good $3.50 breakfast..The small TV was hard to get going and I did see only one roach by the front door. Nice small pool and they will provide matts and towels for the walk through the International market on Dukes Lane to the beach..We did not rent a car but parking was free and the BUS was down @ the corner. We felt safe walking @ night. The only problems we had were calling Waikiki Shuttle (also knows as Kahula five star). We took a bus to the Capitol and the bus drivers were rude and did not help us with where to get off and we got lost and spent a lot of time..We thought the 1 1/2 hour Bus ride to the Arizona would take too long but this shuttle drove around Waikiki hotels for 45 minutes and then took people to the airport (the ad only mentioned the arizona and the Swap meet)...The driver was very rude.. ..We were forced to pay round trip and though they advertise a shuttle every 30 minutes, we waited 1 hr and 10 minutes..I called twice and was screamed @ and hung up on...($24 for 3 people)..Several Buses left and we made a mistake with this as it took 2 hours to get there and 2 hours to get back...Also, we wanted to surprise My Granddaughter with a limosine back to the airport and Honolulu Cab  limosines was a no show and we were forced to grab a cab for $40 at the last minute..We called several times and got voice mail. Beware of transportation problems, especially when you have kids. The zoo was not worth the price but the beaches and free hula show was great.. We had been to Germaines Luau 20 years ago and it was wonderful but this time the food was so bad, the 3 of us could not find anything we could eat and we did not like the atmosphere but I have never been to any of the other Luau's to compare it to..We had a wonderful time otherwise due to this hotel.
A real deal!       View from balcony - That's the "Pink Palace" Royal Hawaiian Hotel right of center.

wonderful We stayed here for 5 days at the beginning of our honeymoon, May 19-24. I have to say the entire experience was wonderful, from booking to check out. We booked the room on their website while they were running a special, $125/night for the Deluxe room. The room was huge, with a King sized bed AND an additional double bed, along with the kitchen, desk, and plenty of closet space.We requested a corner room on the 12th floor on the advice of another reviewer, and I received an email from the girl that does reservations asking me what kind of view I wanted (street view or canal view). I told her I wasn't sure, since I've never been there, but mentioned it was for our honeymoon. She was extremely friendly with her advice, and ended up giving us an amazing corner room with a mountain view. When we walked into our room after an excrutiating 10 hour flight, all I can say is it instantly erased our jet lag. The view was absolutely breathtaking. One whole side of the room was floor to ceiling glass. You can see the canal, the mountains, and at night, the beautiful twinkling lights of the city. Besides the great view and rock bottom prices, the hotel offers several amenities that ended up costing us dearly at the other 2 hotels we stayed at during our trip: free parking and free internet access. Not only that, but we didn't realize how handy it was to have a full kitchen. We were able to keep a full case of bottled water and some milk and cereal on hand for early mornings. It's just little ways to save money that really add up in the end. The on-site laundry facilities were very helpful as well. The location is extremely convenient, within walking distance of practically everything.As honeymooners, we picked 3 different locations for the duration of our trip: the Ilima to start, followed by a mid-range resort on the Big Island, then a high-end resort for our last 2 days in Oahu. We actually enjoyed the Ilima the best out of all of them. It's very private and quiet, which was great for us. We always had the pool to ourselves, which was nice because we really enjoyed taking dips at night after spending the day site seeing. We had a lot more opportunity for private, romantic moments at the Ilima than we did at the other resorts that were always brimming with families and other couples.
Great Waikiki value for families       Pool

Affordable but dumpy I'm kind of shocked to read all the great reviews of this hotel. It was an inexpensive hotel for the area yes, but grungy and worn. The bed was very uncomfortable. Maybe people are happy not to see bugs or whatnot, but nothing really great to relay about this place.

Great Value, clean and friendly staff. Stayed at the Ilima for three nights - one night in January and two nights in February. Our plabe arrived quite early - 7am and we arrived at the Ilima at about 8.30am after quite a long shuttle ride. Even though check-in time was 3pm the friendly staff at the desk made a room available and checked us in straight away. This was really appreciated after the flight from Sydney. The rooms are definitely above average in size with a small kitchen and a full size fridge. The room and bathroom were very clean and everything worked. We stayed in two different rooms, firstly on level 11 and then on level 5, both rooms were quiet. Another nice touch is that the reception area has some nice paintings.I'd recommend the Ilima to anyone who wants a hotel in a good location at a reasonable price especially if you plan to do some cooking whilst on holidays.

Great vlaue, great location. This modest hotel is only two blocks famous WaiKiKi beach. The smallest room was still huge with full kitchen, clean, slightly dated decor with a lot of pink. Free on-site parking, plesant staff. We found it to be a great value.

Great Hotel We had a condo reserved on the Windward side of the island and it turned out to be a high priced dump. We checked out and tried to find a hotel in Waikiki. We were very surprised when a room at this hotel was available. They showed us a room and quoted the rate and we were sold. Nice hotel, quiet, clean, people at the desk were very helpful and friendly. Nice balcony overlookig Waikiki. We would stay here again in a heartbeat if we visit Oahu again.
鐙嚜銇偟銉笺儞銈广仹鑹亜銇с仚   showReview(22292286, 'full');

False advertising Whoever did the photography for this place sure knew how to make it look spacious and attractive. He or she also knew how to avoid the chipping paint, the squashed bugs on the walls, the mildew on the shower curtains, the dead light bulbs, and the small size of the rooms. The parking is free, but there's very little of it, and you have to walk all the way around the building back to the front again after parking in the back. The brochures show glowing pictures of full breakfasts, complete with ham, but it is a regular contintental breakfast. The person I made the reservation with, though not onsite, saw the pictures and told me what a great breakfast they had, and it was all an outright lie, because the pictures lie. The rooms are neither spacious nor well-lighted. Everyone here speaks Spanish, but that might be what's expected in Miami. If you don't have to visit Miami, don't. If you do, find a better hotel. This one is also 8 miles from Miami Beach. On the online map I looked at, the star to denote their hotel was right on Miami Beach. It's not there, it's in Doral, 8 miles west.

Night before cruise - Great value, nice stay We spent Wed., July 9th at this hotel. Just a one night stay prior to a cruise. There is plenty of free parking. You can park your car for 14 days (free) and they provide a shuttle to the port @ $9/per person but not back to the hotel. We didn鈥檛 use this feature, but it may be economical for some. There is a fountain out front and the lobby is very nice. The gym and dining area had a new feeling about them. The carpeting looked new on our hallway and in the room. There was a slight smell in the room, may have been the new carpet. The bedding was comfortable and fresh. The bathroom was clean and it seemed as if there were some new renovations including the vanity area. The gardens around the pool are very nice and we had the pool to ourselves. The breakfast is a nice plus with sausage, potatoes, and eggs, which were new to me. It was like a flat poached egg. I had never seen this before, but most people seemed to like them. There were various breads, pastries and fruits to choose from and the beverage choices, juices, teas, milk and coffee seemed vast. The coffee machine produced some wonderful and varied brews, highly recommended. One of the reasons for choosing this hotel were the decent reviews for a 2-star hotel especially for cleanliness, which is a must for me, and a refrigerator in the room. One of us requires refrigerated medicine. When I asked the front desk to put the very small portable fabric cooler in the kitchen freezer so that the ice packs would be ready in the morning, they accommodated us with a smile and I had no problem retrieving it the next day. Overall, this is a very nice hotel and I would stay there again for a short stay.

I'll never go there again. I booked a 5 night stay for business purposes. I arrived Sunday. Tuesday I came back to my room at 5 p.m. only to find that the romm was not made up. I called the front dest. He was very rude. He offered NO help what so ever. He accused me of leaving up a do not disturb sign witch was patently not the case.The next day I just wanted to order dinner in. The front desk gave me a flier for room service. I called the listed numbers. Nothing. I called the front desk again asking them about this and he said that the room service delivery company was out of business. So what was the point of giving me the flier??? Another minor anoyenance: half the the days that they did clean the rooms they did not leave a new coffee packet. At checkout on Friday morning, I talked to thethe morning crew. No offer of an appology.

Nice Place and Pool I stayed at the Clarion Las Palmas because we wanted to use our free points with choice privileges, and we had a very nice room (414) with a pool view and comfortable beds. The pool was heated and good for an afternoon swim, they had a nice fitness center and continental breakfast. They also have 2 computers in the lobby that you can use for free. I would stay again if I am in the Miami Area do to the good service and amenities.

Good hotel, great price Stayed the night of May 17/08.The hotel itself was very nice and the breakfast was very good. We had booked three rooms and were arriving at midnight prior to going on a cruise. When we checked-in we had a small problem - one room was totally unmade and one room was occupied. We called from the third room and the desk clerk came up with new room keys and escorted us to the new rooms with our luggage. One room was upgraded to a suite. The other problem was with the transfers to the port. Our travel agent had prepaid these transfers for us on her credit card. The hotel however had no record of this information. They did try to contact the travel agent on Sunday morning, however with a 3 hour time difference were unable to do so before we needed to leave for the ship. We had to pay the $7 per person ourselves. Still working to resolve this through the travel agent. Despite these small problems I would stay there again.

its a jewel on the jungle Am a bussines man..and i had to fly to miami asap, i didnt have a reservation anywhere. doing a callaround in the area i found this perfect little hotel..it had a good price not that expensive but no that cheap.. i got there at 9 pm the front desk was absolutely helpfully they even gave a discount.. i had some questions about the area and they perfectly help me out.In the morning i got stunned when i found out the same front desk takes you to the airport. and thats a full costumer service...come on you dont see that every day. The breakfast was good but very crowd..they even have weights on the little fitting room and as i saw there is many bussines people staying in therethe only problem is that they are located close to a main street and the traffic is horrible, so you better get up early so you wont catch rush hour.The driver alberto.told me its a two star ..but hey...with all this type of service it should be at least 4 star

Would never stay at this hotel again. The hotel staff was incompetent. Upon arrival we requested a wake-up call and a 5:00 am shuttle to the airport. We didn't receive the wake-up call and the shuttle service was 15 minutes late in picking us up. The front desk make a few calls to make this happen. They advertise a 24-hour shuttle service.On our return to Miami, we called for shuttle service. The front-desk staff was uncaring. We called three times and the third time, no one would answer the phone. We waited 45 minutes for the shuttle to arrive at the airport and then the driver tossed us a paper into the backseat letting us know we would be staying at another hotel.We booked our stay in this hotel 3 months in advance. I also notified the front-desk clerk that we would be arriving late on our return flight. He told me there would be no problem.

An OK Place This Clarion was clean and the rooms were modern. But they were very, very small. Our room (which they said was the only one available when we arrived) was on the first floor right near the breakfast so it was a bit loud in the hallways. We found the room's layout awkward. The only sink was directly in the path of the door. If you were washing up and some one opened the door, you got smacked with the door. This also made washing up a bit less of a private experience. We were traveling with quite a bit of luggage and room could barely hold us and the luggage. The pool was nice and it was heated. They have a nice selection of sodas and small snacks that you can buy at the front desk. The breakfast was ok but very crowded and we could barely find a place to sit. Our second morning at this hotel we went out to eat instead of fighting the crowd at the breakfast. All in all, the hotel was ok. It was clean and modern but based on the price, I doubt that I would stay here again.
Better hotel, lower price       bathroom

Excellent value for money We stayed at this hotel for one night before our cruise and paid 拢62.00 for the room and a continental breakfast included. The rooms were clean and the reception staff were very helpful. There is no restaurant on site but if you do have a car there are plenty just round the corner.

Eh, okay This hotel is very old...and dated. The beds are very uncomfortable, as are the pillows and linens (so scratchy). The plumbing is so old it makes all kinds of noises all over the hotel. If a person three doors down was showering, we knew about it!The lobby is okay, with nice chandeliers...but needs CLEANING. The furniture is so old it has crease marks.The only plus is that the hotel is on bourbon street and if you get a balcony room you can look at all the drunk morons fighting and puking in the street. Another thing to remember- there is a club in the hotel lobby and the music is LOUD. I couldnt sleep a wink friday or saturday because of all the thumping. a higher floor probably would have helped!

Great location, cute hotel, but haunted! I was traveling for work and received a comp hotel room here. I was very happy with the location. There is a great bar with a beautiful courtyard across the street, a wonderful French store around the corner, and entertainment all around. The rooms are very small, the customer service is so-so. Lots of character though. Good local Community Coffee in the lounge. Overall I slept well and enjoyed the hotel but it is haunted. I had NO idea until I came home, told people about the unexplained and very strange experiences I had there, and looked it up. Apparently it's one of the most haunted hotels in the world. And I stayed on the 6th floor. Yeah- you guessed it, the most haunted floor, an old infirmary of a orphanage. I am so glad I didn't know while I was staying there because ignorance is bliss with these sort of things! Fascinating.

Overrated!!! Spent 2 nights at this overated hotel. Great location for a stay in the French Quarter. We had 10 couples staying for a wedding and each couple had a completely different size room for the same price??? One room was extremely tiny, others were huge - all for the same price. Front desk personnel were horrible!!! Arrived to find no phone in our room. Requested 3 times to have one placed in the room to no avail. Left the hotel without a phone and no service recovery from anyone. The front desk could have cared less. There is a club attached to the premises and the music reverberates throught the entire first floor. DO NOT STAY ON THE FIRST FLOOR. Also, the outside rooms are extremely noisy due to the location at the corner of Bourbon  Orleans, so be wary if you want to go to bed early. You can request an inside room which does help, but stay off of the first floor due to the club noise. Decent restaurant although a bit pricy. Can do better in the Quarter. The only reason I would stay again would be their location but it may just be worth it to find another locale and find transporation into the Quarter.

Mixed review We celebrated my husband's 60th birthday and I had booked 4 rooms. We had problems with the final billing for 3 of those bills. I received an internet rate of $64 a night, but the bill indicated $127 and we were charged for a valet service that we did not have for one room. Check your billing statement.Also, the rooms were very small and our view was the room of the building next store, but for $64 I can't complain.On the other hand, great location and the staff are very nice.

Good location, but not much else Got a great price on our stay at the Bourbon Orleans, and I was hoping the few positive reviews would match our experience. We got checked in okay, if a little slow. The lobby is very nice, and the room seemed very nice as well when we got into it. One lamp didn't work; there was a stain on the carpet; the shower knobs were broken. This is all stuff I can deal with and be happy with in a hotel where the location is so great (and it really is great). But the bed was horribly uncomfortable - just hard matresses. And then there is the noise. I am not talking about street noise either. Our room was facing St. Ann (back of the hotel). Yes, we could hear a din of noise from Bourbon Street partiers until late hours... but this wasn't really loud of intrusive. It was more of a dull background sound that I had no problem sleeping through. The noise from INSIDE the hotel was so much worse. The maids start banging on doors between 7:30 and 8:00 - looking for people who are checking out - and until 9:00, they are constantly slamming doors up and down the hallway. I have never heard anything like it!

Great hotel in superb location This is a really nice hotel in the most central location you will find in the French Quarter of New Orleans. The hotel is situated on the corner of Bourbon and Orleans Street. We stayed in one of the Courtyard facing rooms and there was complete peace and quite. You would never know that Bourbon St was right outside the building. The building itself is really beautiful and in good condition. The rooms are a very decent size and the bathroom is great. The decor in the rooms is slightly dated though, but other than that, the rooms are great. The staff were nice and friendly. The pool area is very nice, though the pool itself is one of those that goes from being 5ft deep to being 8ft deep in the space of about 6 inches so watch out for that! Also, for central New Orleans, the rate was fantastic and the staff were very helpful at getting us the cheapest rate.The only reason to fault this hotel is that they charged us $30 a night for valet parking, but our car was actually just parked on the street outside the hotel the entire time! Seemed like quite a rip off really!Generally though, this hotel is highly recommended.
Loved our stay and centrally located in the French Quarter!       Center court with pool

Nice hotel, nice staff, clean rooms and ghostly good! We've stayed at the Bourbon Orleans several times over the years and always enjoyed our stay; particularly for the location. Yes, the outside rooms can be a little noisy but lots of hotels in/near Bourbon street can be that way. Request an inside room (courtyard view) instead. We've never had a real problem regarding noise. Staff are always nice and hotel is clean with normal signs of wear and tear.Our rooms have always been above average in size (larger usually) and we always leave the hotel feeling we got a value for the location and amenities. This hotel is supposed to be one of the more 'haunted' places in the area/New Orleans. We've never really paid attention to that; however, on our last visit we left less skeptical!Our room was an outside room and we regularly heard what sounded like a door slam coming from the air conditioning system and it always happened when we tried to take a nap or go to bed at night. It was random but occurred all through the night. I got up and checked to be sure the air conditioning wasn't the problem, and could see no reason for the slamming. There were no guests adjacent to us and nothing was going on outside (particularly in the wee hours of the morning). It was the same door slam sound throughout the night.This happened for the two nights we stayed. I jokingly complained to the hotel staff during checkout that we either had a ghost slamming a door or they needed to look behind the wall where the air conditioning was. They didn't laugh like it was a joke and, interesting enough, other staff were interested in hearing more about it.Did we experience a haunting? Don't know but coming from someone who usually takes the 'logical' side of a problem to explain something, I'm a bit less skeptical now.Regardless, I'd stay at this hotel again with no reservation!

Was great room for great price This was one of my best stays in New Orleans. This was our first time back since Katrina, me and my wife were going every year before that. The hotel staff was great. I got a good deal from there web site and the room was clean and ready upon arrival. The only complaint I had was that the waitress I had were not very good, the one that filled the coffee were fine but my actual waitress only came to the table twice ( to take my order and then to bring it)

Disgusting bed Sheets and Terrible service Check in was at 4pm and our room was not ready. We had to wait an hour and ask them again if the room was ready. The sheets had Pubic hair all over them after the room was made up. We had them put new sheets with less hair on them. Wife refused to use the top sheets. The next day when they made up the room it was discusting again. Now if you like other people hair on your sheets and pillows,this is your dump.I raise my voice and checked out. They decide not to charge me for another night because they didn't want me upset their new customers more.Run away don't walk
Someone made a hotel just for me...       2nd floor room - vanity

Not What It Used to Be I've stayed at the Bourbon Orleans many times in the past. In fact, I have posted several good reviews of this hotel.Since it is no longer a Wyndham, it has taken a turn for the worse. While booking through Wyndham, I always got a great room, free internet and other amenities. Since they are no longer with Wyndham, I received probably the smallest room that I've ever stayed in (complete with a scenic view of a nasty service alley between buildings), they've removed the in-room safes, and now charge for the internet. In addition, the front desk staff are not too polite or helpful. There are two things the Bourbon Orleans have going for it now: a wonderful concierge and the location.

Great Location Great location...I contacted the property directly and booked a king size balcony room facing Orleans. No problems with my reservation.If noise bothers you I recommend that you book and interior room, you can hear the noise from the crowds outside. The room was clean, though you can see the wear and tear of the rug. You could also hear anyone that passed by your room, and the housekeepers talking.The front desk was not overly friendly, (not rude). Door men were always there to open the door for us.Did not use the pool but it looked liked the guests were enjoying themselves.We would return to this hotel.

Just okay My husband and I go to New Orleans every year to attend JazzFest. Last year we stayed at the Bourbon Orleans, which at the time was a Wyndham Hotel. We enjoyed it so much last year that we decided to stay there again this year. However, it should be noted that this hotel is no longer part of the Wyndham group, and has gone downhill since last year.The hotel nearly triples its rates for JazzFest, as do all of the other hotels, airlines, etc... because they can. So what would ordinarily be a $99 a night room was now a $249 a night room (using the JazzFest discount!). Our room was very small, with a queen bed, desk and office chair. No other chair, and really nowhere to sit anyway. I walked by the bed and whacked my ankle on something. When we looked, it appeared that the box spring had not been placed on the frame correctly, causing the metal frame to be exposed. Since it was under the bedskirt, I did not see it. I had an enormous bruise that still hurts more than 2 weeks later. The phone did not work. There was no safe in the room. They used to have safes in the rooms, as do all hotels where I've stayed in New Orleans. But the safes have now been removed, and valuables can be stored in a safe behind the front desk. Very inconvenient. So those are the reasons the hotel was not as nice this year as last.There are two great points about this hotel. One is that it is in a wonderful location. It's within easy walking distance of the heart of the French Quarter, Jackson Square, anywhere we wanted to be. And a major asset at the Bourbon Orleans Hotel is their concierge, Ron LaGaie. He knew everything about the city, made dining recommendations, gave us discount coupons for tours we wanted to take... He appears to love his job, and when I asked how long he'd been there, he told us this is his 19th year as concierge at this hotel. He makes up for some of what is lacking in the hotel.All in all, we would stay there again because of the location, but losing the Wyndham name has caused some noticeable changes in the Bourbon Orleans Hotel.

Worst Hotel Experience Ever This place was an absolute nightmare to deal with. I was in a group of 4 and they gave us a single bed, knowing we had a reservation for 4 people. They said, we are booked to which I responded, we have a reservation. Here is my reservation number, here is my date of the reservation. It did not matter to them because they said it was through bookit.com. The place was booked through bookit.com and I also do not recommend them in any fashion. It did not matter to them because they said it was through bookit.com. They refused to give us a cot because it would block the door, even if we moved the furniture around. Both Bourbon Orleans and Bookit.com kept putting blame on one another but in the end we stayed one night because we spent 4 hrs. being put on hold and arguing. We used AMEX to pay for the room so we called and cancelled the payments for the remaining nights, which were 3 of them.We ended up staying at the Marriot which had a room twice the size, a better view of the qtr, open bar on the top floor, and only 5 blocks form the Bourbon Orleans. I also saw a rat by the elevator of the Bourbon Orleans. The bathroom was in very poor shape also. I don't know if it was my room only but from the way they treated guests, I can see it carries over to the upkeep of the rooms.Overall impression was horrible. If I was a visitor for the first time I would have a very sour impression of New Orleans, thankfully, I had been to the city before and it did not ruin my love for New Orleans.Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. Sure the location is nice but the rooms are small, trust me, they are nothing special kinda like a motel 8, and the rates are ridiculous because it is on Bourbon St. Do yourself a favor and save the disappointment and go somewhere else.

Spoilt our trip ! Think twice. We travelled extensively throughout the United States during April and early May, and this hotel was the worst experience and spoilt the New Orleans portion of our trip.Do not rely on any promises about rooms if you book on the internet at this hotel. We booked and paid through the internet months ago (bookit.com) and arrived at this beautiful hotel which is let down completely by very poor management.The hotel itself is beautiful and wonderfully positioned. However, after traveling from the north to the south on Amtrak and arriving here exhausted, we expected to really enjoy the luxury portrayed. On presenting our paperwork from bookit.com to counter staff, she said our room which we had been promised was not available. We asked to see what was available, and it was very smelly and small. We said that we were not getting what we had paid for (which was supposed to be deluxe or better, and asked to speak to the manager. Receptionist said that the Customer Relations Manager was in a meeting. We waited nearly TWO hours at the desk exhausted, for someone to come to see us. Finally the Customer Relations Manager came out of the meeting and she was extremely cold. Just told us she couldn't help us as the promised room wasn't available. There was no apology, no attention, no compromise, not even a smile. She told us to take it up with bookit.com. We finally accepted a room that was available but was sub-standard and was not what we had paid for months ago. During the two hour wait for nothing, there were other people also upset about their rooms and wanting to talk to someone.The supposed available internet was a waste of time. You couldn't access your emails. On questioning staff about this, we were told they would do something tomorrow!! We witnessed many frustrated guests trying to access emails as most travellers rely on this. This was never rectified, and we heard that the system had actually been set up within the hotel so that you couldn't open emails and read them - probably so that the two computers were not tied up and used !! !!The hotel was being painted externally, and we were woken up at 7 a.m. some mornings with painters tapping on the windows scratching off old paint. The first morning we were woken early (8 a.m. approx) by housekeeping asking us if we had used anything from the bar fridge !!! Porters/bell boys were helpful and efficient and room service was good.We do not recommend this hotel, unless you are desperate for a central position.

Location is Key If you're looking for a spot smack dab in the middle of the Quarter, this is the place. A great location within walking distance of all the sites, with one side facing Bourbon St. The room itself was nothing special, pretty much what you'd expect. We didn't use the pool, located in an enclosed courtyard, but given the time, and a few more degrees, it would have been welcome. Don't expect free wireless, though there is a couple free-to-use PCs in the lobby. Parking is expensive ($20/day), but parking is a premium in the whole area. It was actually nice to let the valets take care of it...just give them about 10-15 minutes warning before you actually want to leave, since your car will be parked at one of two off-location lots, one 14 blocks away. Didn't try the hotel restaurant as there was plenty of other establishments to choose from in the area. Nothing outstanding, but wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Rooms incredibly noisy but beautiful ballroom We went to a beautiful wedding there last weekend. The room was decent sized for NOLA, but there were several problems.The worst were the paper-thin walls, if you're a light sleeper or don't party until the early hours, this is not the place for you. We heard every noise our neighbors made, even regular conversations carried through the walls. Also, even though our room was non-smoking, it smelled like it had been a smoking room for the past 30 years. We bought a fabreeze candle and it only partially helped with the odor. Finally there were other problems with the room such as the safe was not functioning (which is pretty important in a city like NO) and the cordless phone also didn't work. The swimming pool was not heated and mostly in the shade, so unless you go in the full heat of summer, its too chilly to swim.

great for party not for privacy stayed here for a wedding. Great location to restaurants and bars, in the heart of the French quarter. The service however could be better. The front desk did not have maps handy and few knew their way around town. Room service knocked on our door three times before 9:30am on Sunday morning. The walls and doors are paper thin so we heard all hallway conversations and the discussions the couple next door had. The valet and bell boys were polite and prompt. There are other hotels near the action with better service, insulation and similar price.
Pleasant Stay       Our room at the Bourbon Orleans

NEVER AGAIN TRY ANOTHER HOTEL FIRST. We must have had the same server in the hotel restaurant that the previous reviewer had!! She also had issues with timely serving. When our breakfast order (for 4) was finely taken and farrived, we had to remind her about the cream for our coffee yet again. When it was delivered in a chipped one serving pitcher, we were told to share it); told us to get the jellies from the next vacant table (when asking about jam) and that she had to handle room service next--perhaps making this her excuse for poor service?!! I think management may be short on staff and are putting the wrong people in the wrong jobs due to labor shortages right now? We had a confirmed reservation number for a king bed, but upon check-in, computer said queen, and there was no changing that--sorry! So we paid king rates for a queen bed because the computer said there was a king bed in the room?!! This was really irritating as the hotel had availability and their internet server had a spring special going on, as well as an advertised queen rate. Never called and offered to move us, even upon asking of king availability (due to the fact the computer said we had a king room??) They didn't even come down and check the room to see--very strange!! Employee attitude was poor. At the beginning of our stay, we kept trying to explain ourselves and ask for a manager, we were informed we had been speaking to the manager (one of the desk help)(?!). We were only staying 3 nights, and didn't want to fight with staff the entire trip, so quit even trying as the frustration would ruin the trip. Room service order arrived incorrectly (no croissants that day) so delivered what they wanted, no call to see what else we'd like (we didn't dare wait and see how long it would take to correct the order--so ate it as is). Its a shame, cause the room we had (looking at the pool) was quiet and nicely furnished, great location, but I'd never stay there again.....if you do, get everything in writing prior to your stay, don't rely on the confirmation number.
Location, Location, Location - Loved the Bourbon Orleans       From our balcony

NIGHTMARE! First, our room was right by the second floor bar, and we had loud dance music blaring all night, plus drunk people trying to hook up right outside our door. We called security, but no avail. We were up every two hours both nights asking people to please go elsewhere. It was like staying outside a very loud brothel. Next, parking was $30 a night, something the hotel does not tell you until you are there with no choice. Even the Marriott only charges $10 a night for valet. Next, the $16 a head buffet breakfast (biscuits and fruit) was worth maybe $8 in New Orleans, and we were disappointed, when the table next to us was informed that waffles, omelets, pancakes, and French toast were also available with the buffet. When we asked our server, she said, Oh, yeah, well, I'm busy, I gotta do room service, too, and I didn't want to bother with you. It really set a terrible tone to our day. Finally, we were double charged for our room (charged twice the rate we were quoted, and I confirmed that rate when I checked in). When I asked the desk, I was told, Well, honey, we got your credit card number. Your only choice is do you want this credit card charged, or do you want to give me another one? I tried to talk to the manager, I tried everything, but I had been taken. Honestly, I go to New Orleans a lot, and I would recommend one of the well known hotels on Canal or a BB in the Marigny. This hotel has a great location, but it is a pit of thieves.

Pretty Good Hotel Just stayed at the Bourbon Orleans for a girls weekend. We lucked out and got an amazing 2 story room for 3 of us with a huge balcony! the other members of our group got a standard room which was fine as well.The rooms are on the older side.. i mean, dont expect anything fancy- but the rates are rather low. the location is great- really in the thick of things.. which also means very loud- even on the 3rd floor-- but it is new orleans and the french quarter!The great things about this place are that the they have 2 computers with free printing in the lobby, and the concierge is very nice and helpful. The not so great : the pool is a bit gross and all the lounge chairs are broken and dirty, they dont seem to have enough maids to clean all the rooms everyday -- we heard lots of complains of people whose rooms didnt get cleaned each day.besides that a good location and an easy affordable place to stay.

Broom Closet or Room? First time ever using bookit.com - we booked three rooms at the same time, one for my 12 year old and I, one for my mom and aunt and one for my cousin and her husband. Their rooms were fantastic, great - however, our room was twenty dollars more and I was given the smallest room I have ever rented (I lived in europe, so I know small) with a double bed. It was also the farthest room in the hotel to walk to. I specifically booked a Queen Suite, the hotel said sorry, but you didn't book with us and we can use our discretion when placing a guest in a room through a travel site. I think it was because I had a child with me. But the staff was inconsiderate when I asked if I could have a rollaway but they said the room was too small. Ridiculous. They told me they would change rooms the next day as there were no available rooms for the first night - not only did that not happen, but - the room next to my mothers was vacant the entire time (I asked the maid) and it was the room type we requested.Nothing was offered to fix our problem and nobody made any apologies.I have stayed at the Bourbon Orleans before and loved it. So this was an isolated incident and everyone else had a fantastic room/time... But if you are traveling with children for any reason, avoid this hotel.

Beautiful Bourbon Orleans Me and my wifes fist time in New Orleans occured in May 2001.We decided to book Bourbon Orleans for a 4 night stay.We fell in love! The staff took care of us from the moment we stepped into the Hotel. We had a standard room, Very nice with victorian decor. We loved our room.Hotel is located directly in the French Quarter district were all the action and fun takes place. But best thing of all is, whenever you feel like taking it easy and relax, just go back to Bourbon Orleans and enjoy the nice inviting pool in the courtyard. It was absolutley fantastic. We did bring home nice memories from this hotel and the whole city.

Try somewhere else In town for Bowl game and stayed here-family had picked location. Easy to find-hotel name is the location (property at the corner of Bourbon and Orleans). Room big enough but bathroom really needed servicing-wallpaper hanging off walls, tub surface pulled off, poor lighting. Service poor-asked for help making reservation for airport shuttle and ignored. Resturant never busy- food didn't look good. Bar closed more often than open. Disappointing, and expensive. Choose another facility if headed here.

Don"t Stay Here I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.Have just returned from a trip to New Orleans, and never been to New Orleans before, would like to warn potential guests. Love NO, but this hotel ruin my vacation. Don鈥檛 know if I will remember this horrible hotel or the entire NO experience.My sister decided to join us at the last minutes. Try both Wyndham and priceline.com (list as 3 star hotel, and definitely is not) to secure double bed rooms, priceline.com told us to deal with the hotel directly, called the hotel they said they don鈥檛 have our reservation; this already alarmed us about this location. And this put priceline.com on my future caution list.Upon check-in asked if there were any doubles available, was told will cost us extra $30/night. Switched for one, but room was only slightly bigger than the standard room. The comforter is very dirty and cost my sister asthma!! The bathroom were dirty and water tank in one room was leaking and refilling the whole night, and took me 2 tries to get it fixed. The other room had red color (may be blood?) all over the floor, they ignored my complain completely. The morning of check-out, received a full charge of rooms (HELLO, if not paid in full at priceline.com, won't even stay there), showed to front desk, they didn't even question and just tore it up. Overall, it's in a great location, the lobby is pretty but you don't STAY in the lobby. DON鈥漈 scarify your comfort, for a short walking distant, you can find a better hotel.

Great Place to stay This is a truly fine hotel. The rooms are pretty with great views of the French Quarter. The staff was kind and courteous. We paid less than $200 per night for a beautiful two room suite. Not sure if that is usual or not. Sadly, we didn't get a balcony like some of the other rooms had. Parking was $30 per day, so beware of that. But all-in-all a great place to stay.

Bourbon Oreans a good choice Very good choice for staying in the French Quarter. The Bourbon Orleans has the charm of the smaller indepenent hotels, with the advantages of the Wyndham group. Our room was very spacious by French Quarter standards. The location is ideal! I thought the rate was quite reasonable, considering the quality of the accomodations.

fine hotel, great location Stayed between Christmas and New Year. Given a room on the quiet side of the hotel (facing courtyard) before I asked. Front desk was helpful, courteous on check in and throughout stay. Room was on the small side, but clean and adequate in size and amenities for my wife and I, including free internet available in Lobby. Absolutely unbeatable location in French Quarter. Had none of the problems noted by some others in their reviews. Excellent value for the price paid. Would absolutely stay here again.

International Incident Having stayed at the International House a number of times, I thought I knew what I was getting into. WRONG! What was once a hotel bordering on greatness, is now sliding quickly and quietly into ruinous. While checking in for a two night stay with a collegue, the New Orleans Police Department Crisis unit, paid the hotel a visit... we saw no blood, but heard much yelling. Scary stuff.
